story:
I want to bring four children from eastern Belarus to North Carolina this summer for 6 weeks enabling them to have clean air, uncontaminated food, free health care, fun and love. Hundreds of kids living in the Chernobyl radiation fall out area from Belarus desire to come. A six week trip away from their home is good for their immune systems. I have worked with bringing kids over for ten years. Most have never had dental and vision exams. Most have never seen the ocean or ridden a roller coaster. I want to change that for 4 kids, giving them a summer of a lifetime.

Our community does as much as it can. Some years we have sponsored over 40 children. However due to the economic downturn contributions have fallen. Last year dozens of children were unable to come due to lack of funding.

Will you help?

story:
Seed School Los Angeles

The aim is to raise money for partial and full scholarships to members of our community to attend the upcoming, groundbreaking Seed School to be held February 9th-14th at the Church of the Nativity in Westchester. Seed School teaches gardeners about

  • Saving historic seeds from the many ethnic populations
  • Insuring that every gardener in Los Angeles has access to non-GMO contaminated seeds
  • Breeding vegetables to be more productive
  • Supporting of food sovereignty issues

Who gets a scholarship?

We will be accepting applications from individuals who are committed to taking this information back to underserved communities and teach in local community gardens, schools and events and help us establish a network of seed saving libraries for a GMO FREE LA.  We want to insure students:

  • Continue to be a part of the food revolution in the LA area and ensure food sovereignty, bio-diversity and food justice
  • Contribute whatever they can to help more students be a part of the change for LA area and become the GMO-free food producers we need.

Where do the funds go?

Anything under our campaign or once we meet our campaign goal will directly fund scholarships. We are a 501(c)3 non-profit so your donations are tax deductible.  Additional funds will go to:

  • Cover seed school expenses included food, housing, and transportation
  • Help students continue the food revolution by providing supplies like seeds and other materials.

Can’t contribute, you can still help

  • Please get the word out and send the link to friends and family
  • Promote this campaign on your social media sites

Help us further our mission to spread the practice of seed saving to all!

story:
During the previous decade, Friends of Deckers Creek (FODC) has constructed seven projects to treat abandoned mine drainage (AMD) within the 64 square mile Deckers Creek Watershed.  As a result, chemistry and aquatic habitat within the watershed has improved, and sections of Deckers Creek have proven to support recreational fishing opportunities.  

FODC is now on the brink of constructing an eighth treatment system that will remove 40,000 lbs/yr of acidity, 3,000 lbs/yr of iron, and 3,000 lbs/yr of aluminum, thereby contributing to additional improvements in watershed health.  The site is located along Mile 19 of the Deckers Creek rail trail, just east of Reedsville, WV.  If constructed, the site will be accessible from the Deckers Creek rail trail and will serve as an educational facility for rail trail users.

A potential set-back, however, is FODC must produce $7000 to purchase the designated land parcel to house the AMD remediation project.  This is taxing FODC resources and could ultimately result in a loss of the project.

FODC would like to reach out to its dedicated community supporters in an attempt to raise the required funds for the land purchase.  The landowner is ready to proceed and we are on the brink of losing this opportunity.  

Please, if you support FODC and the work we have done to improve the watershed, please consider making a contribution in support of this land purchase.  Contributors will be recognized in our future newsletter publications as well as be deserving of unending gratitude from the board and staff of FODC.

story:
Why we need funding

We need funding to complete our Research and Development efforts, which will ultimately help us service thousands of vehicles and convert their diesel and gasoline engines to compressed natural gas (CNG). We are also looking to expand our waterless carwash program. See more details below. 

The Impact

How will this make a difference? 

We are looking to reduce Carbon Emissions and Greenhouse Gases, reduce the amount of waste materials being emptied into the environment, and create hundreds of new jobs. 

Waterless Carwashes

Each Carwash only needs less than 1 cup of water per wash, saving on average more than 50 gallons of water per wash

All soaps and detergents are enviro-friendly

We use reusable microfiber towels for wiping down all vehicles

We are eliminating the flow of water or chemicals down the storm drain, saving the fish!

More on Compressed Natural Gas

By converting 1000's of Vehicles from Diesel and Gasoline to Compressed Natural Gas we will reduce Co2 emissions by 35 Million pounds per year. This is like planting about 100,000 trees



Our business plan will save drivers over $7 Million in annual fuel costs also calls for the creation of over 300 new jobs in the next 5 years!

As our expansion becomes greater and greater we will have a bigger reduction of the world's greenhouse gas emissions.

FleetCare team members are socially responsible, involved in numerous civic and community services locally and internationally.

And we have unique perks too!

For those of you within 100 miles of San Francisco, we are offering various packages for your vehicle.

Waterless Car Washing, Exterior Detailing, Filter Changes, Maintenance

 



For those of you outside of the area we have awesome perks for you too!

Subscription Boxes with Artisan Local Products, Subscription boxes with everything you need to (waterlessly) wash your car, and Fleet Evaluations 




Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:

Remember than any donations help. Even if you can't help by funding us monetarily please tell your friends and family about how they can save the environment with one car wash at a time. 

Use the Indiegogo share tool above and spread the word!


FleetCare International is a rapidly growing San Francisco based Commercial Fleet Maintenance Company. We specialize in offering on-site maintenance solutions for medium and heavy duty equipment, including trailers, transit and paratransit fleet, commuter coaches, forklifts, industrial, construction and mining equipment. Our dependable service is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. We offer Emergency Road Service, with service vehicles available for response both on and off highway.

FleetCare International offer maintenance and repair service to commercial vehicle fleets in:

  • Contra Costa County
  • Marin County
  • Napa County
  • San Mateo County
  • Santa Clara County
  • San Francisco County
  • Solano County
  • Sonoma County
  • Sacramento County
  • San Joaquin County
  • Yolo County

FleetCare International’s services include:

  • Fleet Inspections (Pre & Post Purchase)
  • Fleet Maintenance, Service & Repair
  • Preventative Maintenance
  • Diesel Opacity Testing
  • Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) Cleaning
  • Fleet Cleaning & Detailing
  • LRV Inspection & Cleaning
  • Construction Equipment Inspection & Cleaning
  • Construction, Mining & Industrial Equipment
  • Inspection Maintenance & Repairs
  • Roadside Assistance
  • Engine Tune-Up and Overhaul
  • Pressure Washing
  • Steam Cleaning
  • Minor Repairs
  • Oil Analysis Programs
  • On-Site Fueling & Fuel Programs
  • Diesel Exhaust Emission Test
  • Major Repairs are outsourced under our control (Major body repairs-Chassis
  • Repairs-Engine Overhaul-Transmission Overhaul-Differential Overhaul)
  • Warranty Work
  • Breakdown Services
  • On-Site Steam Cleaning, Detailing and Pressure Washing
Our goal is to provide outstanding value and service to our customers by consistently completing each job and filling each order right the first time, on time, at the quoted price while maintaining clear communication with each client before, during, and after each transaction.

Our goal is to provide outstanding value and service to our customers by consistently completing each job and filling each order right the first time, on time, at the quoted price while maintaining clear communication with each client before, during, and after each transaction.

story:
We are Adrien Lindon and Benjamin Barca, two young Italian conservationists who have recently completed a Masters’ programme in Biodiversity, Conservation and Management at the University of Oxford. With the support of Dr Paul Jepson, passionate birdwatcher and leading conservation scientist, we are going to carry out a country-wide overview study of the status and trends in migratory bird-hunting in Italy.

We both have expertise in natural and social science research and in policy and practice, especially with regard to conflicting issues and traditional activities. We are well aware of the subtle cultural and historic differences between Italian regions. We occupy a more neutral position and will listen carefully to the perspectives of bird conservationists, hunters and the authorities, old and young alike.

In a recent National Geographic article, award winning author Jonathan Franzen calls for renewed action to tackle the issue of migratory bird hunting (MBH) in the Mediterranean. This is because, nearly 35 years after the EU Birds Directive, MBH is still widespread and its impact appears to be increasing as populations of European birds decline.

The practice of MBH is deeply embedded in Italian culture and society, and is governed at the regional or local level. However, knowledge on actions and trends in hunting, as well as the politics surrounding the issue is fragmented. We want to try and change this. By touring hunting areas, we will compile and generate up- to- date information that will both raise its policy and public profile internationally and provide a resource for new thinking on solutions.

In the 1970s MBH was a key issue that generated popular support for bird conservation and the creation of European conservation frameworks, notably the 1979 Birds Directive. Today, there is growing awareness among conservation groups that the issue needs to be revisited as MBH seems to be on the rise again. This seems to be due to a combination of increasing ease of accessibility (e.g. hunting tourism), new technologies (particularly song play-back), the Euro-zone crisis (economic hardship leading to trapping and selling birds) and political instability. Furthermore, there is a growing talk of deep antagonism between hunters and bird-protectionists in parts of Europe and that hunter perspectives are attracting populist political support locally.

The practice of MBH is deeply embedded in Italian culture and society, and is governed at the regional or local level. However, knowledge on actions and trends in hunting, as well as the politics surrounding the issue is fragmented. We want to try and change this. By touring hunting areas, we will compile and generate up- to- date information that will both raise its policy and public profile internationally and provide a resource for new thinking on solutions.

Over the last 30 years, groups in Italy – bird conservationist and hunter federations alike – have worked hard to find solutions to migratory bird trapping and shooting. However we think there is now a need to step back andproduce an independent country-wide overview of social and cultural trends in the practice of MBH, and the politics surrounding efforts to regulate it. There are important questions where we lack thorough knowledge, such as: In which regions of Italy are traditions of hunting getting mixed in local politics? Are new technologies (e.g. song play-back, mobile phones) changing the practices and impact of migratory bird shooting and trapping? Are younger men still taking up hunting activities?


We are preparing for a rapid survey of popular MBH areas in Italy. We strongly believe that understanding the current situation from inside is essential to better grasp the intertwined dimensions of the issue, to analyse the different viewpoints, and to understand the rationales underpinning this widespread practice. MBH is not only a problem in Italy. We are convinced that findings from this research may later be used as an important starting point that, with the addition of similar studies in other countries, will help paint an overrall picture of the situation for the whole Mediterranean.

Our objectives are to understand: 

·  How MBH is currently governed

·  The current issues and challenges

·  How different stakeholders (e.g., hunters, bird protectionists, local authorities)    are interplaying and/or conflicting

·  Whether the interest is increasing or decreasing among new generations 

The research is placed in a broader cultural context, in order to understand whether there are differences between and within regions. 

We are going to drive around Italy by car to explore the key sites where this practice is common. In each site we will meet with Italian experts on the issue, main authorities regulating hunting, local hunter associations, local bird protectionist groups, and migratory bird hunters themselves.

The project will start on Monday September 23th from the Southern tip of Italy (Sicily and Calabria regions), and, depending on your support we will progressively move northwards to investigate the main hunting areas in other regions, for example Campania and Lombardy. We are hoping to explore multiple sites per region, spending at least 2-3 days in each site. If we achieve our funding goals, we are planning to be working for a total of 5 weeks, until the end of October. We will keep an online blog to update you on our moves, insights and anecdotes throughout the journey.

The findings of the research will be then written up for publication in a conservation policy journal, presented and circulated to key conservation professionals, and incorporated into the online Atlas of Migratory Bird Hunting:

http://research.ouce.ox.ac.uk/migratorybirdhunting/

Your contribution to this project will be essential for allowing us to persevere in what we think will be an insightful and important study of the human side of migratory bird hunting. Your assistance will go towards helping us cover our petrol and travel, food and accommodation, as we cross the rural dust roads from the South to the North of the Italian peninsula. We will keep our costs to the bare minimum.

The breakdown of our costs, for a total of £5,000, is as follows:

· £2,800 for food and accommodation (£35 per day per person, 40 days)

· £1,000 for petrol, insurance and highway tolls

· £500 for ferries (e.g. Calabria to Sicily, Sicily to Naples)

· £500 for equipment and maintenance costs (GPS, video-camera, batteries etc.)

· £200 for telephone and internet in the field

Thanks a lot! Con affetto, Adrien and Benji

*Thanks to Rupert Masefield for the photo on the cover

story:
SOLAR POWER PLANT 10kW
Bosnia and Herzegovina

We are a group of young students, and fans of solar power. Some time ago we started a blog about the application of solar energy in the business and practice. All team members are economists or engineers well-familiar with the topic of solar energy and renewable energy.

Unfortunately, in Bosnia people's awareness of renewable energy is very low.So through this project, the construction of a small solar power plant we want to show the reality of how it works and that it is not a myth or a hoax.

It will certainly be followed by the media since it was one of the first such plants in the entire country. Which will affect a large number of people change their mind and start thinking about investing in the future.

Only with your donation we can realize this project.

Location

Macro location

 

Microlocation

The solar power plant will be set up in the village Osinja on the slopes facing south. Once known for good grapes, in view that this position is abundant sunlight throughout the day. This location ensures project rentability.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds collected during this campaign will be used to construct a solar power plant (capacity of 10 kilowatts - $ 3 per watt). Before that requires registration company, administrative work, obtaining permits and preparing fields for plant installation. All it takes about 12 months.



All who participated in this campaign have the opportunity to be part of a pioneering project in Bosnia and Herzegovina when it comes to solar energy. Your name will forever remain inscribed in the history of the solar industry in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Also according to the amount pearks, some of you will get a T-shirt with the logo of the company, while some will have the opportunity to personally participate in the putting into operation of the plant.

if it does not achieve enough money, project will continue as an investment in blog and also in organizing seminars and lectures on solar energy among students at universities throughout the country.

Online monitoring of the plant and whole project

According to the project design, and will build a website on which will enable tracking of electricity generation in this solar power plant.

Here you can see an example of how this is done in a company in Lithuania.

The Impact

It will certainly be followed by a media which will result in a broader class of people and their awareness of solar energy and ecology in general. 

As part of the plan to organize and online monitoring of power generation. The ability to track energy production this plant at our website from anywhere in the world gives you the assurance that your pearks went to the right place.

We expect that after this project, more people start to invest in solar energy and thus help the sustainable development of the whole of humanity.

Sustainability of the project

Funds raised from the sale of electricity will be invested into the web site, seminars, lectures and other forms of promotion of solar energy and sustainable development, and if the ordinary maintenance of solar power plant.

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow our blog and facebook fun page, and spread the link of our campaign.

As part of the plan to organize and online monitoring of power generation. The ability to track energy production this plant at our website from anywhere in the world gives you the assurance that your pearks went to the right place.
We expect that after this project, more people start to invest in solar energy and thus help the sustainable development of the whole of humanity.
Sustainability of the project
Funds raised from the sale of electricity will be invested into the web site, seminars, lectures and other forms of promotion of solar energy and sustainable development, and if the ordinary maintenance of solar power plant.


Other Ways You Can Help
Follow our blog and facebook fun page, and spread the link of our campaign.

story:
Adventure With Purpose

In February 2013, a group of adventurers from every corner of the globe will come together for a once-in-a-lifetime, world record-breaking event to climb and fly from the “Roof of Africa” Mt. Kilimanjaro, at 19,340 ft the 4th highest of the 7 summits and the highest free-standing mountain on the planet, and in doing so will raise over a million for charity bringing awareness to the needs of the people of East Africa and Tanzanian. I have been invited to join this expedition as a pilot.

My invitation is contingent on several things. One is my getting in shape physically and mentally for the climb and flight off a nineteen thousand foot launch. The other is to raise a portion of the one million dollar goal.  That portion is five thousand dollars before January 1, 2013. 100% of the $5000 will go directly to the local charities listed below who focus their efforts on community, environmental and humanitarian aid. Any over will go towards the production of a video of the event and to defray some expense.

Not only are the Wing's pilots rasing funds for 3 important causes we are also injecting close to another million in the local economy just by being there. Our climb and flight will have an effect far beyond our donations to charity.  Exposure brought by this event will bring focus to problems in the area. We will also have a positive impact in tearms of wages earned localy during this climb because of it's size and scope along with world wide exposure for tourisum and travel in this region.  Please join with Wing's for an Adventure With Purpose!

Thank you.

Tom

 

 

OUR CHARITIES


The One Foundation will identify schools in the Kilimanjaro region that are in need of resources, skills and infrastructure and deliver upon these needs with funds raised by the Wings Of Kilimanjaro project.


Plant With Purpose works with 38 different communities in the regions surrounding Mount Kilimanjaro to create alternatives to deforestation, and share the tools needed to empower local people replenish the land and improve their lives.


WorldServe International is a community development Charity working in close cooperation with Maji-Tech, a social enterprise it founded in 2002. Headquartered in Arusha, near the foot of Mt. Kilimanjaro, Maji-Tech specializes in safe water projects requiring deep Borehole drilling and the installation of water pumping, storage and delivery systems. “Maji” is the kiswahili word for ‘water’.

story:
Wonderful news!  Thanks to you, we received enough money to plant tomatoes - an outstanding array of incredibly delicious, heirloom tomatoes!!  We start them in our energy-efficient, wood-fired starter greenhouse every year, but this year we were woefully short on seed money. Thanks to you, the tomatoes will be germinating by this time next week!  Bravo!

OUR TOTAL IS REALLY $1,989! Add $500 for a generous check we received in the mail.   THANK YOU EVERYONE for getting us this far down the road. SO-o-o-o appreciated!


Short Summary

White Buffalo Farm epitomizes the hopes of so many now drawn to the organic farm movement.  We are actively working towards transferring ownership so that a farm-based ecovillage might be nurtured by the current owner's years of caretaking of this special land with senior water rights and 40 years organic, highly-vitalized soils along the North Fork of the Gunnison River.  The clay soil is also perfect for cob construction and we plan to host our first cob workshop summer 2013!

To get things rolling this year, we needed SEED MONEY! 

PLEASE TELL YOUR FRIENDS and anyone you know that is a strong supporter of the organic food movement!  THANK YOU.

For friends less likely to go online, let them know they can contribute by mail directly to the farm.  Checks only by mail, thank you.  White Buffalo Farm, 16877 Grange Road, Paonia, CO 81428  970 422 1373 for questions.

Please use the following link to spread the word about our fundraiser on FB! THANK YOU!

It let's you ask your friends to join in and maybe contribute or share it, too!  It feels good and real, like all things farming!                                                                           https://www.facebook.com/WhiteBuffaloFarm/

This campaign was created on Indiegogo by me, the Communications and Development Director for White Buffalo Farm.  I have been helping Wayne since 2010.  We are now planning on converting the farm to new ownership as Wayne needs to retire.  But, we need to keep the farm running until it sells and in preparation for a fine hand-off!  Wayne and I, along with the farm's long list of supporters, would like to ensure a transition in keeping with the years of hard altruistic work Wayne and many others have offered in service for so many years.

Budget

We start in our wood-fired starter green house, first 5000 tomatoes plants and then a month later 5000 squash seedlings. We need $500 for tomato seed, $500 for squash seed, $500 for chicks to replenish our laying hen brood and $500 for bees to pollinate the 20 acre orchard.  Wayne used to have his own bees, but one year he was stung so many times that he can no longer tend bees.  There is also peat moss, feed for the chicks and a fee to Indiegogo and paypal!

The Impact

Make this year a special one!  You will make this year a special one for the last free-roaming, organic farmer of his generation in Colorado!  The early organic pioneers of Colorado!  All the others have given up or gone bankrupt!  Wayne is a living legacy in Colorado's organic movement aka Mr. Organic and godfather of organics!   Wayne dedicated his last 40 years to making organics a reality in Colorado...and we can honor him by helping to make this year his best ever!  Wayne started the farmer's market in Telluride, served on Gov. Romer's Organics commission, keynoted a talk to western slope growers on organics in 1984 (to good effect as we all know), and was the first to sell pears to Earth's Best Baby Food and other well-known brands in organics, like Whole Foods and Natural Grocers!  Wayne grows using his own organic methods many varieties of pears, asian pears, cherries, apricots, plums, apples, greens, and all kinds of vegetables!

By contributing to this project, you help will ensure the tastiest and freshest squash and tomatoes on the Western Slope.  We are well known around Colorado for our fine fruit!  And many on the Western Slope love our greens and cage-free eggs! 

Please spread the word.  We have only one week to reach our goal and get the tomatoes started on time for this season!  THANK YOU! 

UPDATE!!!! Thanks to you we have reached our goal to plant tomatoes!!

Like the farm at www.facebook.com/whitebuffalofarm

www.whitebuffalofarm.org

This iconic farm was in the New York Times on 2/3/13  We love you Wayne!!!

http://www.nytimes.com/2013/02/03/us/colorado-communities-take-on-fight-against-energy-land-leases.html

story:
"The future of drones isn’t in the skies. It’s in the ocean.""It feels like an amusement park ride–except it’s real. You’re really driving around underwater, exploring." - Gizmodo

"OpenROV’s new Trident is a powerful, speedy vehicle that can remotely navigate underwater locations never before accessible." - Mike Senese, MAKE

"OpenROV Trident Drone: because aerial footage is so passé." - Outside

"The future of ocean exploration is here." - Entrepreneur

"Ever since you watched Jacques Cousteau on TV possibly caught Bill Murray in “The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou,” you've dreamt what it would be like to explore and film the briny deep yourself. Well now you can—without setting a single flipper in the water."- Maxim

"Suddenly, you don’t need to be a James Cameron or a Jacques Cousteau to explore beneath the waves." - Zachary Slobig, takepart

"A new revolution in ocean exploration has begun, mirroring, in many ways, the invention of the Aqua-Lung. Small, low-cost, and easy to operate underwater and aerial vehicles are creating a sea change in how humans interact with the marine environment." - Motherboard VICE

"But this machine is also a kind of manifesto, an exhortation to humanity to join together with their robots and explore the universe." - Annalee Newitz, io9

"It's such a cool idea! They should be in every hardware store." - Sylvia Earle, National Geographic Explorer-In-Residence and TED Prize Winner

story:
January 11th Update:

Thank you to everyone who helped me meet the $1200 goal to cover filing & serving fees in one week!

These are sadly only the initial costs of my legal battle. While the exact amounts aren't yet set, the legal advice I've received says I have to expect to pay several thousand for discovery costs and several thousand more for an expert witness to review our mistreatment at the hands of Wood County's law enforcement.

This fundraiser has been successful so quickly that I'm nowhere close to having those future expenses set, but I hope that won't stop people from continuing to show support. 

Thank you again to everyone who has donated any amount!


Hello,

My name is Benjamin and I was brutalized by the Wood County Police Department while engaging in a peaceful, nonviolent, non-destructive protest against Transcanada's KXL pipeline. I need this money for filing and legal fees to hold the Wood County Sheriff's Department accountable for its reprehensible and illegal behavior on Sept 25th, 2012.

Treehugger reported on the incident here: 

http://www.treehugger.com/environmental-policy/these-two-texans-were-tasered-choked-and-pepper-sprayed-protesting-keystone-xl.html

The story has many parts, but it boils down to 3 basic issues: 
  1. "Pain compliance" should never be used on anyone!
  2. Police should not take marching orders from corporations 
  3. Tools need to be used for their intended purpose, not misused as improvised methods of torture

"Pain Compliance" is another term for torture. Even at face value, it means "we're going to hurt you until you do what we say." This is not how civilized people behave, as anyone who attended Kindergarden should be able to tell you. 

Second, the police officers in Wood County did not escalate the violence until the agents of Transcanada, a large Canadian corporation, arrived on the scene. Our police officers should not be taking marching orders from corporate middlemen who have no accountability to the general public. 

Third, tasers are tools for immobilizing someone who poses an immediate threat - not tools for "pain compliance" to convince protesters to stop protesting. Pepper Spray is designed to be sprayed from a distance so it can mix with the air - not sprayed after its expiration date into a small enclosed area.  

I hope people who care about these issues will support me as I try to bring about some accountability.

story:
Short Summary

 

Drinkabrick is a new concrete construction system. It makes traditional Concrete Walls, but they have plastic air bubbles on the inside. They are laid out ordered and unexposed  inside the wall making the wall Lighter, more economical and providing Thermal insulation, Acoustic insulation and Humidity insulation. The interesting thing about this system is that the plastic air bubbles are PET water or soda containers. This way the Construction industry can utilize an almost free material (lowering construction costs) and at the same time giving a second utilization to used plastic containers that currently have a short life cycle, a low recycle percentage, takes hundreds of years to degrade and in a high percentage ends up polluting rivers and oceans.

 

Concepts

-Bottling companies start providing their water/soda inside a "brick" instead of bottles.

-The new container is nothing but a change of shape (same plastic, same production system)

-The shape is standard, thus the system can be certified

-The resistance and structure is taken by the concrete. Plastic only acts as internal mold (no structural request)

-The system can be reinforced with steel re bars (just like bricks and concrete bricks)

-Two industries collaborating and benefiting from each other. One get almost free material, the other one gets a second use for their residue and lowers plastic contamination. Both contribute to lower worldwide environmental Plastic Pollution and at the same time lowering worldwide housing deficit.

 

  

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are ready to produce the first units for certification. So we are asking for help to fund the following:

1-    The matrix or injection blowing mold and  The first 10.000.- units for testing One third goes to testing on a University, one third goes to a housing NPO for testing and the rest goes to building and standard material certification   (US$15.000.-)

2-     The first 3 official and standard material certifications. (Vertical Strength / Fire / Diagonal strength resistance (for earthquakes)) (US$25.000.-)

3-    The investing on Eco-design study (US$10.000.-)

 

 

The Impact

 

•    We’ll address the problem of plastic pollution of PET containers. These are the most common plastic containers  for water, juice and Soda and they are the standard for the bottling industry. Recycling covers around 5 to 6% of the production, while the remain either gets to dumps where it will take 200 to 1.000 years for them to decompose, or they end contaminating landscape , rivers or oceans being one of the biggest contributors to plastic pollution in the planet.  

•    Our organization will help Bottling companies by improving their product life cycle in terms of environmental impact, transportation cost, Social enterprise responsibility, differentiation, and marketing.

•    Besides giving bottle companies a solution for plastic contamination, we aim to create a positive impact in the environment as well as to create a positive impact in the housing deficit by providing an inexpensive building system on an almost free building material.  

•    Profit will be reinvested in PET container technology and environmental protection innovation.

 

Patent pending MU 2015-00988

 

Risks & Challenges

 

•    To probe the system can perform as a standard material. Bottling companies can modify their product life cycle improving their company image by showing a concrete way of not contaminating the environment and at the same time collaborating with housing deficit. They periodically change their formats for aesthetic and marketing pourposes.

•    DrinkaBrick contributes to the construction industry. A very economic and hopefully abundant one since the bottling company pays it as a regular container and the second use is almost for free. Allowing people to save them for own use, donating them for people in need, or resell them at a very low cost. Current attempts for building with plastic bottles is not considered a construction system since it is not standard, thus it cannot be calculated and therefore approved by counties and it cannot be protected by insurance companies.   It also has a resistance to build with waste and with an element no suit for building. With our system, the bottling companies start delivering their product inside a “brick”.

•    We provide a second use for the container. A new PET container standard that allows  it to be reused in a second industry. The lifecycle of the product changes, instead of becoming trash that involves cost to get disposed, It receives second life.

 

   

Patent pending MU 2015-00988

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

•    You can also spread the word and share. We are looking forward to reach international  social responsible bottling companies that may want to improve the lifecycle of their products  by providing a second use for their container. A new PET container standard that allows it  to be reused in a second industry. The lifecycle of the product changes, instead of becoming  trash that involves cost to get disposed, It receives second life allowing it to contribute to alleviate housing deficit especially in third world countries where they lack of recollection recycling and trash disposal systems.

 

Source Chris Jordan

 

The Problem

 

•    The problem of PET containers is numbers. While the standard in bottling has become  the PET bottle because of it resistance, lightness, toughness, transparency and cost, the problem relates to the amount of production. There is a huge problem that comes with the enormous amount of plastic bottles that remain after consumed their content. Just in Santiago 2.000.000.000 bottles are produced annually. In the US, 2.000.000 bottles are being consumed every 15 minutes. After a recycling closer to 6%, remaining bottles are considered  waste and have to be disposed in dumps, while an important percentage goes to polluting landscape, river and oceans. Collaterally, we aim to address the housing deficit, especially  in the underdeveloped countries.

 

Our Story

 

It was until I started researching on the problem that I realize about the problem. The numbers  involved shocked me. I believe we are living in a moment where the human race has grown so much that while the industry thrives, the result of their actions impacts the Earth in a way that will a long time to mitigate. While the environmental issues are commonly known, as individuals we have very little impact on this mitigation. If by implementing this system we can  contribute to mitigate in part the pollution of landscape, rives and water bodies, we believe  we could find a lot of meaning in our work and lives.

 

  

 

 

OUR TEAM

 

Our team have a common commitment with the environment and specifically with plastic waste.

 

             

Marcos Ortiz                               Maria Jose Vargas

Architect                                      Industrial Designer

 

 We firmly believe that the future will require collaboration between industries in order to take care of the immense amount of material that it is currently being produced. We believe we can contribute to the planet by taking care of an immense amount of this material by reusing it in a positive way that can help the people at the same time that protecting the planet.

 

THANK YOU!

We are looking forward to reach international  social responsible bottling companies that may want to improve the lifecycle of their products  by providing a second use for their container. A new PET container standard that allows it  to be reused in a second industry. The lifecycle of the product changes, instead of becoming  trash that involves cost to get disposed, It receives second life allowing it to contribute to alleviate housing deficit especially in third world countries where they lack of recollection recycling and trash disposal systems.
 

Source Chris Jordan
 
The Problem
 
•    The problem of PET containers is numbers. While the standard in bottling has become  the PET bottle because of it resistance, lightness, toughness, transparency and cost, the problem relates to the amount of production. There is a huge problem that comes with the enormous amount of plastic bottles that remain after consumed their content. Just in Santiago 2.000.000.000 bottles are produced annually. In the US, 2.000.000 bottles are being consumed every 15 minutes. After a recycling closer to 6%, remaining bottles are considered  waste and have to be disposed in dumps, while an important percentage goes to polluting landscape, river and oceans. Collaterally, we aim to address the housing deficit, especially  in the underdeveloped countries.
 
Our Story
 
It was until I started researching on the problem that I realize about the problem. The numbers  involved shocked me. I believe we are living in a moment where the human race has grown so much that while the industry thrives, the result of their actions impacts the Earth in a way that will a long time to mitigate. While the environmental issues are commonly known, as individuals we have very little impact on this mitigation. If by implementing this system we can  contribute to mitigate in part the pollution of landscape, rives and water bodies, we believe  we could find a lot of meaning in our work and lives.
 
  
 

 
OUR TEAM
 
Our team have a common commitment with the environment and specifically with plastic waste.
 
             
Marcos Ortiz                               Maria Jose Vargas
Architect                                      Industrial Designer
 
 We firmly believe that the future will require collaboration between industries in order to take care of the immense amount of material that it is currently being produced. We believe we can contribute to the planet by taking care of an immense amount of this material by reusing it in a positive way that can help the people at the same time that protecting the planet.
 
THANK YOU!

story:
Hi! My name is Jason and I've started this Campaign to raise money for South Slope Dog Run improvements / flood drainage system.

The South Slope Dog Owners Association has adopted this park land located on 18th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues. Our mission is to improve the quality of life in the South Slope area by creating and maintaining a dog friendly space and fostering positive interaction between dog owners and the community as a whole.  Go to http://www.southslopedog.org to learn more.

Recent improvements have been basic cleaning/maintenance, putting up fencing, laying wood chips, and building a double safety door.  
  • We raised $550 for the double safety door which was put in last summer.

Here are some of the things the Park is in desperate need of now:  
  • Drainage System  (IN PROGRESS)
  • New Bench
  • Dog Park Sign (IN PROGRESS)
  • Tools (rake, shovels, tool shed)
  • new surface?? (this needs a general consensus)
One of the biggest problems now is the FLOODING that happens after it rains.  So, a few of us got together last week to build a drainage system.  We dug drainage trenches and filled them with blue stone, pea pebbles and mulch.  This should alleviate the massive flooding which occurs at the bottom of the park after each rain.  
  • The total cost of this project was $238.25 (supplies)
  • The remaining contributions will go to any other improvements that we as a group decide are necessary.
Please make a small contribution to help us make the dog park the best dog park it can be.

story:
Short Summary

Fifty-seven years. That’s how much time went by between the 1947 discovery of the Mishmi wren-babbler and when the bird was observed again. The Eastern Himalayas—the species’ only home—has the second-highest terrestrial biodiversity on the planet, making it a bona fide biodiversity hotspot. Yet because it is so remote and its infrastructure so rudimentary, the Eastern Himalayas is understudied and under-explored, leaving species to remain undiscovered or to go unseen for decades on end.

Gautam Surya, an associate conservation scientist with Global Wildlife Conservation, is headed to the remote forests of the Indian state of Arunachal Pradesh to conduct one of the first--and the most comprehensive--surveys of bird species, like the Mishmi wren-babbler and other "lost" species, in the Eastern Himalayas. Surya and his team aim to survey a wide range of altitudes to fully capture patterns of avian diversity, focused on the valleys created by five large rivers.

"We simply do not understand where species are located, and therefore it is almost impossible to do any meaningful conservation work," Surya says. "Once we better understand the distribution of threatened species, we can start prioritizing areas for conservation action."

What We Need

Field expenses fall under three categories. The first is travel to and between different field sites--Surya is doing altitudinal transects along the main river valleys in the state. The second is field assistants--Surya hires a local person as a field assistant to assist in surveys, and also for safety in the forest. Finally, there is the everyday cost of living--food, shelter, etc. Surya stays in villages wherever possible to help forge a connection with the local people.

  • $10 donation: Pays for an average day's food and shelter for Surya's team (Surya, a field assistant and a driver)
  • $30 donation: Covers the cost of a vehicle per day.
  • $100 donation: Covers the approximate salary for a local guide for a week.
  • $250 donation: Covers the cost of travel from Delhi to Surya's field site, round trip.

The Impact

First, you're supporting the continued existence of biodiversity. You're supporting efforts that will allow your children, and their children, to travel this part of the world to see all the wonderful things Surya gets to see. Secondly, you're supporting the people of the region. They are largely impoverished, and being tribals they are also somewhat cut off from most of the rest of Indian sociopolitical society. One of the main pathways out of poverty, in the short term, is through ecotourism--and ecotourism development requires that we better understand the places that people might go to see. In a broader sense, you are supporting science. Diversity is ultimately the source of all biology, and who knows what insights await us from a careful study of this region. What might we discover about genetics...or medicine...or resilience to climate change...or simply some cool natural history?

Risks & Challenges

There are a few issues related to working in this area. To begin with, it's disputed territory (administered by India but claimed by China), and therefore has a large military presence--and they're not generally thrilled about strange folks with binoculars. There are also issues with insurgents in specific locations. Elephants are a presence and a threat in lower-elevation forest, and snakes are also numerous. The weather is a big challenge as well--the monsoon causes a lot of landslides, roads often are blocked, river unfordable, etc. And then there are all the minor inconveniences, from obtaining drinkable water to the leeches and biting flies.

As GWC's conservation associate scientist in this part of the world, Surya has already successfully maneuvered these challenges and will use those same skills on this leg of the expedition. "As a kid growing up in India, the Northeast was always a mysterious and far-away place that I always wanted to visit," Surya said. "I was also a birdwatcher, and when I got my first field guide, I flipped through it eagerly--and found that most of the coolest birds were only found there. I've been wanting to work in Arunachal Pradesh since I was about 11--and now I am!"

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a contribution to our work in the field, you can still help!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools. 
  • Follow and share Surya's blog updates during the field work on GWC's website at http://globalwildlife.org/blog/.

story:
The ocean absorbs almost a third of the CO2 released into the atmosphere every year, changing the chemistry of the seawater, a process called ocean acidification. Calcifying organisms, like pteropods, that are critical to the food web are one of the most vulnerable organisms because the changes in ocean chemistry are dissolving their shells.

Hello Ocean is working with Swift Engineering, Dr. Nina Bednarsek, and Dr. Ryan McCabe to create a global citizen science study on the effects of ocean acidification on pteropods. Your donation will support the pilot study’s goals including equipment design and testing, data analysis, and optimizing for future citizen science research.




A Changing Environment Threatens Cetaceans
The role cetaceans play in marine ecosystems surrounding Belize and the Western Caribbean or the consequences they face from anthropogenic impacts are largely unknown. Now they face new threats and changes to their environment. However, the impacts cannot be understood without critical data.

Improved Protection for Marine Mammals

Your donation will facilitate the first systematic data to assess the status and abundance of cetaceans in the Western Caribbean. The results will be used to support improved protection for marine mammals and pelagic ecosystems. Partnering with scientist Eric Ramos, Hello Ocean aims to create an opportunity for citizen scientists across the globe to listen and record the vocalizations of whales and dolphins to further the research. The pilot study is the first step in expanding this opportunity to citizen scientists.


Our film One Simple Question was 50% funded through a crowdfunding campaign. The money didn’t go to people. It went directly to making the film - licensing fees, equipment, etc. Now, thanks to many of you, One Simple Question is being seen across the country and will be available on DVD before the end of the year.

We believed in the film enough to dedicate countless hours and you believed in us enough to donate. Our team has expanded and our work is now more critical. We hope you will join us in this campaign to understand and protect the oceans.

This project is all about CROWD-SOURCING... data, resources, boats, equipment, science and funding. It's community driven science. It's Real Science by Real People. Because of this communal effort, we feel crowdfunding is not only an appropriate, but an ideal avenue for helping to fund this project.





Join our email list for opportunites, news and inspiration.


Please share this campaign on social media. Sharing is one of the best ways to help us reach the right audience.


We really apprieciate your relevent connections & introductions. If you  know someone who can help with this project, let us know.


We are looking for print shops to contribute t-shirts at a reduced cost for our donor rewards.


We need translators to transcribe English and Spanish video interviews. This work can be done anywhere you have Internet and a computer.


We are especially interested in gear that will support ocean research and media and will happily accept new or used gear in working condition. We are looking for the following: 



Joining an ocean conservation campaign and pledging your hard-earned money can be risky, but an even greater risk is taken through inaction thereby entrusting our future and the health of our planet to someone else. We will face challenges after the pilot study is complete and we move toward expanding the project into the citizen science effort we are aiming for. However, this is important work and the goals are achievable. That is why your support and our elbow grease are very important. Together we can make this possible.


Thank you for your donation! You’re awesome and we couldn’t thank you enough. So, please select one of our donor perks as a token of our thanks. (All perks have been donated to Hello Ocean by our sponsors - thank them for believing in this project!)

story:
INTRODUCTION

We are Chubu Nihon Plastics who have been doing our plastic recycling business for 50 years in Hamamatsu, Shizuoka, Japan. Since our founding, we've ever done so many things to contribute the maintenance of global environment. And now we've found another way to help our planet. We can't do this without you.

THE IDEA

Our new factory is under construction right now. Then, we've decided to make it an environment-friendly site with a bunch of trees that can absorb carbon dioxide which is a cause of global warming. By this, we'll have nature that we have been losing in the city. That'll decrease the amount of CO2 and people in the city passing by the forest will be able to feel nature. However, to be honest, we don't have enough money for that. That's why we have resolved to do crowdfunding here. Join us!

BACKGROUND

Our city, Hamamatsu, has been relatively developed in Japan.  In recent years, it's becoming even more advanced with tall and modern buildings. In my childhood, there were lots of rice fields and other places where I was able to be in nature. I would catch frogs and play with mud there. Those types of opportunities mustn't be lost for kids. We must protect and regain nature. It is good for people to become convenient to live but not for children and our planet. Therefore, we want to create a new place to make kids and everyone in the city happy. In addition, we hope it will serve as a way of helping the environment.

BUY A TREE FOR OUR NEW FACTORY!

LANGUAGE OF TREES

We'd like to make it even a better place with the help of the language of trees. We expect you to pick one kind of tree with a meaning that matches up with your wish. If you choose one, we'll plant it around our new factory and take a good care of it to make your wish come true. Also we'll put your name on it. We hope our new factory will become a spiritual site that can give energy to people. 

LIST OF TREES

You can choose what kind of tree you want from below. 

IMAGES OF OUR NEW FACTORY

  • As well as you can own a tree, you will contribute to preservation of the environment. 
  • Of course you can choose a tree without regard for the meanings. 
  • We'll send you a picture of your tree one year after planting.
  • Our new factory is scheduled to be completed in April this year. 

We kindly ask for your cooperation. 

BECOMING A FOSTER PARENT OF TREES

There is one more thing that we plan to do. It is a fact that there has been lots of deforestations in the world, which lead to the progression of global warming. Therefore,  in order to save living trees, we are thinking of adopting as many trees that someone can no longer take care of as possible. They will be transplanted to our factory ant stay alive. We think that they have to be protected because they are filled with feelings of those who have raised them.

HAMAMATSU CITY

Hamamatsu is famous for motorcycles and musical instruments thanks to YAMAHA and KAWAI, which founded there. Also, there is Hamamatsu Castle. Many of successful lords of this castle promoted to higher positions in Edo era. That's why it is said that you will succeed by visiting there.

VIEW OF DOWNTOWN OF HAMAMATSU

HAMAMATSU CASTLE

 

WHO WE ARE

CHUBU NIHON PLASTICS. CO, LTD

 We are a trading company called Chubu Nihon Plastics relating to plastic recycling business in Shizuoka, Japan. It has been 50 years since our founding. "Happy Eco" is our corporate philosophy, which means we want to keep the earth clean and make everyone happy.

- What we mainly do as a company

Plastic resins we sell

Simply put, we purchase plastic waste from manufacturers,  recycle it into resins and sell them. Therefore, our business itself is an eco-friendly effort. In addition, we've done various projects for our planet.

Beach Cleaning for Sea Turtles

We have done this project more than 10 years. It is important for sea turtles to lay eggs in a beautiful beach and for babies to walk into the sea safely.

Eco Education Picture Book

We created it because we hope children will become adults that can contribute to global environment by understanding the importance of resources.

Art Garbage Bag

Humans, animals and plants! Everyone, smile! Enjoy picking up garbage!

Development of T-shirts and towels made of biodegradable plastics

Biodegradable plastics are materials that are changed by bacteria into substances that do not harm the environment.

Space Recycling

Recently, there is an increase in space debris because the space development is drastically progressing. We have started to work on this type of problems as well.

 Besides those projects, we have passed down earth-friendly jobs to the current-generation. We'll continue that in the future too. 

THE WAY OF USING FUNDS

It'll cost us $300 through $400 to plant a tree. Our ambition is to plant over 100 trees. Plus, we'd like to raise money for its maintenance after planting. Therefore, the whole money will be used for transportation, plantation and maintenance. 

RISKS

There may be delays in plantation and you are not able to choose where your tree will be planted. Plus, there will be individual differences in size and shape of trees. If we become unable to take care of trees for some reason, we will find the next owner so that trees can stay alive with your wish.
In 2021, COVID-19 is still going around, which is the biggest risk. So nobody knows what will happen from now on. But still, we are determined do this until the end whatever will happen.

story:
Short Summary

I summed the situation up succinctly in this very recent article in Asia Sentinel, and this project recently got some great coverage on Mongabay...! Check it out.

What We Need & What You Get

You will get high-definition camera trap photos as well as jungle lore and field gossip@

The Impact

You and your contributions are all that stands between Virachey and annihilation. 

Risks & Challenges

It's always risky, hard work, but we're used to it, as we've been at it for a decade now. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't like donating via this platform, you can do so directly via my Paypal here. If you'd prefer to send equipment rather than make a cash donation, then please contact me directly via email at: greg.mccann1@gmail.com
story_txt:
Short Summary
I summed the situation up succinctly in this very recent article in Asia Sentinel, and this project recently got some great coverage on Mongabay...! Check it out.

What We Need & What You Get
You will get high-definition camera trap photos as well as jungle lore and field gossip@

The Impact
You and your contributions are all that stands between Virachey and annihilation. 

Risks & Challenges
It's always risky, hard work, but we're used to it, as we've been at it for a decade now. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't like donating via this platform, you can do so directly via my Paypal here. If you'd prefer to send equipment rather than make a cash donation, then please contact me directly via email at: greg.mccann1@gmail.com

story:
Dans le cadre du Festival de Sciences et Génie, les étudiants des baccalauréats en génie agroenvironnemental, alimentaire et chimique, ainsi que leurs confrères de génie électrique et informatique tentent d'adopter un béluga! Le moment est venu de retrousser vos manches et tâter le fond de vos poches, fouiller dans les craques du divan et sonder sous les sièges de votre transporteur pour en extirper quelques écus afin de faire rayonner l'université Laval; votre université. 

Le béluga désigné portera le nom de Festival Sciences et Génie ULaval, les longs noms ont la cote chez les mammifères marins. 

L'argent recueilli va au GREMM, le groupe de recherche et d'éducation sur les mammifères marins. Il faut 5000$ pour officiellement adopter un béluga, si cette somme n'est pas atteinte, l'argent recueillie va quand même financer l'organisme.

story:
Who we are...

We are Angela, Ivan, Manuel and Gio, a Canadian-Colombian family passionate about holistic wellness, permaculture and eco-living.  Five months ago, we dropped our Canadian lives and took the plunge to live out our dreams in the beautiful Colombian Andes.

We found and acquired a 4-hectare property at the base of the snow capped mountains national park (Parque de los Nevados) near the city of Pereira.  Our land is surrounded by fresh spring waterways, forest and guadual (giant bamboo), with breathtaking views of forested mountainside.  We have a variety of fruit trees growing, including bananas, oranges, mandarins, mango, lemons, grapefruit, avocado, soursop, plantain, papaya and guava.  

We have been independently studying the art of permaculture for the past two years with a plan to live in a more sustainable way.  Ivan left his career as an Ironworker and Engineer, where he commuted 3 hours per day, to work the land and get back to nature.  Angela transferred her yoga, Reiki and Thai Massage practice from the busy city to the lush green countryside with a desire to build a holistic centre and host retreats.  With over 24 years of yoga practice, Angela wishes to share the incredible benefits of yoga and meditation on a larger scale.  Along with tending the land and working on individual projects, Ivan teaches at a local university, while Angela teaches English and promotes her wellness services. Unfortunately, the money they earn is only enough to cover the existing mortgage payments and current living expenses. The budget doesn't stretch to cover future development of this project.

We believe that the world desperately needs change, current systems are not serving the majority of the population or the planet.  We feel that permaculture is the answer to many problems of the world.  

What is permaculture?

"Permaculture is the conscious design of 'cultivated' ecosystems that have the diversity, stability, and resilience of natural ecosystems. It is a harmonious integration of people into the landscape in such a way that the land grows in richness, productivity and aesthetic beauty".   Washburn TN PDC

The founder of permaculture, Bill Mollison, describes it this way: "Permaculture is a philosophy of working with, rather than against nature; of protracted and thoughtful observation rather than protracted and thoughtless labor; and of looking at plants and animals in all their functions, rather than treating any area as a single product system." 

The word permaculture originally referred to "permanent agriculture", but was expanded to stand also for "permanent culture", as it was understood that social aspects were integral to a truly sustainable system. (Wikipedia)

What we're doing...

In the past five months, we've been working hard to develop the land and design our system.  We've been tending to the plants; managing the guadual; digging terraces; building animal housing, an outdoor kitchen and a dry toilet system.

Our overall goal is to offer this beautiful place to the world and have a platform to share information and host workshops and retreats, as well as hostel accommodation for learners and travelers.  In order to achieve this goal, we have a far way to go.  We still need to build cabins, workshop space, facilities for guests, grey water systems, solar shower, more animal housing, among a number of other projects.  This is where you come in.  With your help we can turn this dream into a reality, sharing this wonderful way of life and helping to heal the planet and the self.

Budget...

Our total goal budget is $36,000 USD.  This will allow us to build the three cabins (using bamboo), bathroom facilities, a greenhouse, additional animal housing, workshop and kiosk; and provide power generation (hydroelectricity from the creek), grey water systems and a water well.  Some funds will also be allocated to driveway improvements and advertising.

If we don't reach our complete goal, we aim to build at least one cabin with facilities and ideally a space for workshops.  If we do reach our goal, we anticipate completion of these projects by August 2016. If we raise more than our goal, we have a lot of great ideas; from expanding into an eco-village to launching environmental conservation programs and reforestation of the area.

Stretch Goals...

. with an extra $3,000 we will build a natural swimming pond for our guests. 
· with an extra $5,000 we will build an additional cabin for guests.
· with an extra $10,000 we will upgrade all the cabins incorporating sacred geometric architecture.
· with an extra $20,000 we will adopt the 1km long creek which runs through our property and that of others, ensuring that no untreated sewage, residue waters or rubbish flows downstream.
· with an extra $25,000 we will donate 1 acre of pasture to the community with the goal to reforest it with native trees and turn it into a natural reserve for all to enjoy (if similar perk is not claimed).
· with an extra $40,000 we will pay off our existing mortgage for the land and be able to focus 100% on our conservation and permaculture projects.  
· with an extra $100,000 we will acquire the neighbouring land to expand our project and open opportunities for an eco-village.

Perks...

We would like to invite you to come and stay at Anukara Eco-Cultura and experience the magic and tranquility for yourself.  Imagine waking up to the beauty of the Colombian countryside before taking in a yoga class or a Thai massage; drinking a rich organic, local coffee or tea while enjoying the multitude of birds and butterflies; swimming in the local spring fed river; or learning some new skills at one of our workshops.  

However if you cannot travel to Colombia, we have many other options for our supporters.  We are offering a range of unique perks to suit a variety of budgets and situations, from naming a tree or conservation plot to guided audio meditations, permaculture resource guides and recipe e-books - with some of the healthiest and most delicious dishes we know of.   For travelers, we're offering all inclusive 10-day retreats and services.   Your contribution will make this all possible.

The Impact

You can feel satisfied in knowing that your contribution is making a huge impact for the good of the planet.  Our goal is to educate and influence future generations, teach them to embrace nature and care for the earth.  We want to create community and share healthier ways of living both locally and internationally.  Every dollar you give will help to bring back the natural balance and spread the awareness that is so desperately needed in this day and age.

Through Yoga, Thai Massage and Reiki practices, our aim is to bring the balance and connection back to the individual through self-healing, stress reduction, and personal development.  In this way, we can better connect to our environment and the people around us and be inspired to make a difference in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, you can still support us by sharing our campaign with your friends and family and on social media.  Any assistance you can give is greatly appreciated.

story:
FINAL COUNT DOWN SPECIAL MOOPmessage:




NOW BACK TO CAMPAIGN...






. 


The Birth of the MOOPsquad...


Hello and welcome! Thank you for visiting! I am Sylvie, and I am part of the MOOPsquad! Please take a look at our incredible team of MOOPagents working hard to make the world a better place!

The MOOPsquad is a movement, one that is now growing fast! From my heart, and from the collective heart of all beings, I express our deepest gratitude for all the hours our team invest to beautify our world.

The challenge we are passionate about solving is one of the most urgent challenges we face everyday. We did our best to keep this brief and provide you with a message of hope. I kindly request that you now invest 10 minutes to find out about what we are doing.

I was fortunate to be raised in a family where I learned self-responsibility. As a little girl I was deeply involved and mentored through the girl scout network. Living with honor, keeping our world clean, and taking responsibility for my actions was ingrained in my DNA. As I grew older; performing, theatre, event production, and full time study at Berkeley kept me quite busy, but never enough to extinguish my desire for a better world.

Today I have a vision for each human to respect our earth at the highest level, and treat her with the respect she deserves.

Our worldâ€™s trash problems became crystal clear to me while doing some world travel to Costa Rica in 2001.







.

All the little things I had seen over the years had piled up, quite literally! When I witnessed trash being thrown out of the bus windows by children, trash being thrown in the rivers, and trash piling up on the beaches, a heavy heartache kicked me into gear to take action. I began yearning to make something happen.

Soon thereafter in 2002, I went to Burning Man, and was introduced to MOOP (Matter Out of Place). The Leave No Trace philosophy was in direct alignment with my dream and revived my full passion and intense drive for our cause. This is the micro community  that I have since lived, and itâ€™s now time to inspire, share, and engage the macro community in these ways of being.

My overall goal has become to make a world impact on humanitiesâ€™ general behavior around MOOP. The past methods were obviously not working. The solution is not another boring educational about facts on MOOP. Parents and even kids have now heard enough to make them numb. Humanitiesâ€™ full attention is required now, we MUST wake up.


Put simply, humanities thought patterns & behaviors around MOOP require an upgrade!


I knew I had to invent a concept that was FUN, ENGAGING, and fully utilizing the MAGIC that flows while connecting with other beings. The idea required creativity, imagination, play, event production skills, and a lot of spirit power! This is how the MOOPsquad was born.


.

As the MOOPsquad, we are a passionate core group of female performers. While being dressed up in cool suits, twirling, dancing, and holding our MOOPwands like guns we passionately utilize a deep seeded feminine power that evokes a magnetic and mysterious curious sensation that inspires lasting actions within our audience. While we have them captivated, we politely show them itâ€™s actually â€œcoolâ€ to pickup MOOP.

From our efforts, we see heads turn and mouths drop in amazement!


"Since theMOOPsquadâ€™s birth in 2002, we now have about 20 MOOPagents passionately serving the cause. We have inspired over 100,000 people, and through normal wear and tear we have gone through over 200 MOOPwands!"


With a population of over 7 billion it is our vision to enroll over a million MOOPsquad agents to inspire this behavior change that is required for humanities future success on Earth.


the MOOPsquad Mission: Eradicate MOOP on Planet Earth


Why you care about this...

People care about Eradicating MOOP on Planet Earth because it gives relief to a discomfort & hope to a heart ache that we all share on some subconscious level.

Our challenge is now so big that most people look the other way when they see MOOP. Its a common belief that MOOP clean up is another persons job and totally deny the MOOP they see everyday. Our hearts are required to be reactivated. Facts donâ€™t activate our hearts to care. Deep down, we all know if we all help we can make huge strides together.

"People care about what we are doing because this is about our planet. Itâ€™s not about me, it is not about our MOOPagents, this is about OUR world and for all of US!"



.

At the moment we are fully invested and no other major fundraising has ever been done. To be honest, itâ€™s actually been hard for me to ask anyone for money, and I have drained all my extra money into this venture. Our clean world is my passion. It's for me, for us and for our children to have a more beautiful world.


The GREAT news is that we are NOT a startup with a good idea... after many years, I can assure you that this actually works!


Calls, emails, and text messages regularly come in that are filled with gratitude and proof that after seeing us do our magic, people are coming home after a night out with MOOP in their pockets! People who would not have otherwise done so are cleaning up after themselves and their fellow strangers!

Now it is time to raise the bar! It is time to launch a world wide campaign!
.

Why are we fundraising?

Itâ€™s time to go back to the roots of my discovery. It's time to spread the message in one of the places that is most pristine, most virgin, most diverse, and in most need of assistance. We are fundraising for a 14 day journey into Costa Rica, with a goal to touch the lives of 1000â€™s of people and plant seeds that will inspire viral behavior change!

.

Welcome to MOOPmission: Costa Rica!

We have a 6 MOOPagent, 14 day MOOPmission planned to visit over 10 cities where we will be facing the beaches, jungles, and rivers that are in dire need of attention. Through our actions we will be performing and inspiring change in the local communities everyday! We will also have meetings with local press and plant the seeds for integration of our photo shoots in their upcoming publications.



 

The MOOPsquad tour will culminate at the Envision arts/sustainability festival where we have been invited to lead a portion of the Green Team. At this festival alone there will be over 1,000 local and international attendees that we will have the pleasure to inspire!



Why would you give?

People donate for various reasons:

Some people feel this is a cool idea- they desire being part of this movement and will help vicariously through their financial support. Because it has worked for us on a smaller level, it can work on a really BIG level, so they support to be part of a solution and to be part of a vision that truly serves humanities existence on earth.

Some people are waking up to our grim reality and seeing that we MUST change. These people may lack the time to help, or they may even lack a lot of money to help, in any case they see and deeply feel the calling to support this cause with anything they can.

Some people are blessed with financial abundance and they give because they believe we MUST collaborate and share our own abundance with causes that help humanity. They understand that the MOOPsquad is not a huge financial endeavor just yet, but their abundance can serve in a place where it is in dire need.

No matter at what level you choose to give, we will honor your gift with a special MOOPsquad Badge of Honor.

Whatever your reason is for giving, we desire for you to know that we appreciate your assistance so much. Without assistance from people like you, we canâ€™t keep doing this forever. By helping us now, our Earth will be a cleaner place, and we will be able to sow the seeds that continually inspire new behaviors that create ever lasting MOOPconsciousness in each person we inspire.



Our Team & Network

In addition to our strong passion, we have a core team of 6 MOOPagents. Our core team have skills that range from media creation, event production, aerial and fire performing, to environmental specialists.


.

We are also part of a larger sisterhood called the Beckys, which expands our MOOPsquad to over 50 high caliber performers.


Our network of friends extend in to some of todayâ€™s most popular Los Angeles & San Fransisco Musicians, Djâ€™s and artists, as well as strong support from some of todayâ€™s biggest thinking and action oriented social entrepreneurs.


How much are we raising?

We are now raising $10,022 for MOOPmission:Costa Rica.



How will the money be used?

We will be using the money raised for:
  • Airline tickets to Costa Rica for 6 MOOPagents
  • Accommodations at safe hotels
  • Food
  • Transportation
  • 100+ Moop Wands
  • Marketing materials: stickers, business cards
  • Post production assistance for video and print products


Due to the current state of our planet, we are expecting to be raising much more than $10,022.

With YOUR help...we certainly do not expect to raise less than our goal, in any case...here is what each level of funding will allow for:

At 2k, all marketing expenses are paid for, and two MOOPagents go to support the Envision Festival as the MOOPsquad.

At 4k, some Costa Rica community outreach is possible, and three MOOPagents do MOOPmission: Costa Rica

At 6k, the full Costa Rica community outreach program is possible and four MOOPagents do MOOPmission: Costa Rica

At $7,500 the MOOPsquad will be able to activate 10 additional local MOOPtroop (volunteers) at the Envision Festival for daily MOOPmissons

At 10k, the full vision of MOOPmission: Costa Rica will be a reality with our 6 full-time MOOPagents ready to lead!


We have much bigger goals that extend far past Costa Rica. We have a full US tour planned, innovative technology to develop, and the vision to be able to purchase and share 1000's of MOOPwands with our community of supporters. Some of our plans include the "Becky Saves the World Tour", SXSW, Coachella, Lightning in a Bottle, BOOM (Portugal) and Burning Man!

When we raise more than the $10,022 it will give us the opportunity to get a head start on future fundraising.



What will the result of MOOPmission: Costa Rica be?

After we get back from Costa Rica we will have inspired 1000â€™s of people to look at MOOP in a whole new way.

We will bring back stories and adventures that will strengthen our bond with our cause, and provide more fuel to continue. From our missions scouting for MOOP in the jungle and our interactivity in the surrounding communities, we will have cool MOOPsquad photography that we can create powerful print media with. We will share our photography and story with local & international press. We will also have connected with dozens of people that desire doing what we are doing, and they will create their own MOOPsquad troops!

Through documenting this journey we will be able to complete our proven system that can be duplicated in cities all over the world for all future MOOPsquad MOOPagents to follow.

This is a movement!
MOOPmission: Costa Rica is for ALL of us

We feel that we have lined up a perfect opportunity, and now we are requesting your support.




.
PS. Other Ways You Can Help

Have you seen trash on the street?


Trash on the beach?


Trash anywhere other than a trashcan?


Then you have seen MOOP! Spread the word, not the mess! PLEASE let others know we have a working model that inspires collaborative involvement that actually creates a change! So, after you donate, PLEASE share this and make some noise about this campaign!


Use the Share tools!
