.



Welcome to MOOPmission: Costa Rica!

We have a 6 MOOPagent, 14 day MOOPmission planned to visit over 10 cities where we will be facing the beaches, jungles, and rivers that are in dire need of attention. Through our actions we will be performing and inspiring change in the local communities everyday! We will also have meetings with local press and plant the seeds for integration of our photo shoots in their upcoming publications.





 The MOOPsquad tour will culminate at the Envision arts/sustainability festival where we have been invited to lead a portion of the Green Team. At this festival alone there will be over 1,000 local and international attendees that we will have the pleasure to inspire!


Why would you give?People donate for various reasons:Some people feel this is a cool idea- they desire being part of this movement and will help vicariously through their financial support. Because it has worked for us on a smaller level, it can work on a really BIG level, so they support to be part of a solution and to be part of a vision that truly serves humanities existence on earth.Some people are waking up to our grim reality and seeing that we MUST change. These people may lack the time to help, or  they may even lack a lot of money to help, in any case they see and deeply feel the calling to support this cause with anything they can.Some people are blessed with financial abundance and they give because they believe we MUST collaborate and share our own abundance with causes that help humanity. They understand that the MOOPsquad is not a huge financial endeavor just yet, but their abundance can serve in a place where it is in dire need.No matter at what level you choose to give, we will honor your gift with a special MOOPsquad Badge of Honor.Whatever your reason is for giving, we desire for you to know that we appreciate your assistance so much. Without assistance from people like you, we canâ€™t keep doing this forever. By helping us now, our Earth will be a cleaner place, and we will be able to sow the seeds that continually inspire new behaviors that create ever lasting MOOPconsciousness in each person we inspire.Our Team & NetworkIn addition to our strong passion, we have a core team of 6 MOOPagents. Our core team have skills that range from media creation, event production, aerial and fire performing, to environmental specialists.







.

We are also part of a larger sisterhood called the Beckys, which expands our MOOPsquad to over 50 high caliber performers.



Our network of friends extend in to some of todayâ€™s most popular Los Angeles & San Fransisco Musicians, Djâ€™s and artists, as well as strong support from some of todayâ€™s biggest thinking and action oriented social entrepreneurs.How much are we raising?We are now raising $10,022 for MOOPmission:Costa Rica.How will the money be used?We will be using the money raised for:
Airline tickets to Costa Rica for 6 MOOPagents
Accommodations at safe hotels
Food
Transportation
100+ Moop Wands
Marketing materials: stickers, business cards

Post production assistance for video and print products




Due to the current state of our planet, we are expecting to be raising much more than $10,022.

With YOUR help...we certainly do not expect to raise less than our goal, in any case...here is what each level of funding will allow for:


At 2k, all marketing expenses are paid for, and two MOOPagents go to support the Envision Festival as the MOOPsquad.


At 4k, some Costa Rica community outreach is possible, and three MOOPagents do MOOPmission: Costa Rica


At 6k, the full Costa Rica community outreach program is possible and four MOOPagents do MOOPmission: Costa Rica


At $7,500 the MOOPsquad will be able to activate 10 additional local MOOPtroop (volunteers) at the Envision Festival for daily MOOPmissons


At 10k, the full vision of MOOPmission: Costa Rica will be a reality with our 6 full-time MOOPagents ready to lead!



We have much bigger goals that extend far past Costa Rica. We have a full US tour planned, innovative technology to develop, and the vision to be able to purchase and share 1000's of MOOPwands with our community of supporters. Some of our plans include the "Becky Saves the World Tour", SXSW, Coachella, Lightning in a Bottle, BOOM (Portugal) and Burning Man!


When we raise more than the $10,022 it will give us the opportunity to get a head start on future fundraising.


What will the result of MOOPmission: Costa Rica be?After we get back from Costa Rica we will have inspired 1000â€™s of people to look at MOOP in a whole new way.

We will bring back stories and adventures that will strengthen our bond with our cause, and provide more fuel to continue. From our missions scouting for MOOP in the jungle and our interactivity in the surrounding communities, we will have cool MOOPsquad photography that we can create powerful print media with. We will share our photography and story with local & international press. We will also have connected with dozens of people that desire doing what we are doing, and they will create their own MOOPsquad troops! Through documenting this journey we will be able to complete our proven system that can be duplicated in cities all over the world for all future MOOPsquad MOOPagents to follow.


This is a movement!
MOOPmission: Costa Rica is for ALL of us

We feel that we have lined up a perfect opportunity, and now we are requesting your support.




.

PS. Other Ways You Can Help

Have you seen trash on the street?

Trash on the beach?

Trash anywhere other than a trashcan?

Then you have seen MOOP! Spread the word, not the mess! PLEASE let others know we have a working model that inspires collaborative involvement that actually creates a change! So, after you donate, PLEASE share this and make some noise about this campaign!

Use the Share tools!

story:
Queridos todos,

¡¡Hemos alcanzado nuestra meta!! ¡Muchísimas gracias a todos los que han apoyado en este camino hasta ahora! ¡Nos sentimos muy honrados de recibir tanto apoyo de ustedes! ¡¡Gracias!!

Ahora estamos tratando de alcanzar la meta de 9,000 USD para cubrir los costos totales de participación en la Aceleradora de Agora. Los 3,000 USD adicionales se destinarán a los viáticos de dos representantes de nosotros para participar en el evento de empresas sociales en Nicaragua en enero y en la conferencia de inversionistas en Washington en mayo de 2014.

¡Muchas gracias por el apoyo increíble que nos han dado en este camino! ¡¡Ayúdanos por favor a dar los últimos pasos!!

Abrazos y saludos por parte de todo el equipo de La Mano del Mono


Dear All,

We have reached our target!!! Thank you to everyone supporting us all the way long till now!!! We feel extremely honored for receiving so much support from you!!!

We are now trying to reach our goal of 9.000 USD to cover our full costs to participate in the Agora Accelerator. The additional 3.000 USD will go towards travel expenses of two representatives of us to assist in the Entrepreneur Rereat in Nicaragua in January and in the Investor´s Conference in Washington in May.

Thank you  for the amazing support you have already given us in this journey!

Please help us to take the last steps!

Hugs and greetings from the team of La Mano del Mono - The Monkey´s Hand


Nuestra campaña - Our campaign
(Find english version below)

¿Por qué hacemos lo que hacemos?

¡Piensa en una persona querida que tenga más de 50 años!

Desde que nació esta persona hasta ahora, hemos destruido más de la mitad de los bosques y selvas de México y más de la mitad de la población rural ya migró a las ciudades por falta de trabajo y muchos viven en condiciones marginadas!

¡¡En sólo 50 años!!! ¿Que nos espera para los siguientes 50?

¡¡La buena noticia es que la solución esta en tus manos!

La Mano del Mono

En La Mano del Mono, unimos manos locales para hacer los cambios globales que necesitamos y además lo logramos haciendo lo que más nos gusta hacer: viviendo experiencias inolvidables en paisajes impresionantes dentro de diversas Áreas Naturales Protegidas (ANPs), como el bosque de niebla más grande de México en la Reserva del Triunfo, o la Selva Lacandona en Chiapas, donde habita gente increíble de comunidades rurales e indígenas de nuestro querido México.

Así generamos empleo local y conservamos los bosques de donde sale el agua, la energía y la comida que consumes. Con estas innovadoras experiencias que combinan ecoturismo, aprendizaje vivencial y educación ambiental, invitamos a preparatorias, universidades, corporativos, turistas y gobiernos a que disfruten y aprendan en Áreas Naturales Protegidas para hacer los cambios que necesitamos.

EL IMPACTO

En los últimos cinco años los impactos que hemos tenido son:

  • Más de 500 personas que después de vivir increíbles experiencias, regresan a casa cambiando hábitos relevantes en su vida para crear un mundo mejor.
  • Replicado el modelo en 4 Áreas Naturales Protegidas en alianza con 4 empresas comunitarias.
  • Aumentamos en un 8% los ingresos económicos de las empresas comunitarias en temporadas bajas de turismo.
  • Generamos 20 empleos temporales comprometidos a la conservación y desarrollo local.
  • Logramos involucrar a más de 50 funcionarios públicos aliados en Chiapas para conservar los bosques en los lugares de donde sale tu agua.

AYUDANOS A PARTICIPAR EN LA ACELERADORA DE AGORA

¡Necesitamos tus manos locales para hacer cambios globales!

Necesitamos tu ayuda para recaudar $6,000USD para participar en la aceleradora Ágora Partnerships que se dedica a impulsar negocios con mucho potencial de crecimiento y que además resuelvan los retos sociales y ambientales que enfrentamos hoy en día. En promedio, por cada dólar que inviertas estarás generando $24 más que serán usados para sistematizar este modelo de trabajo y replicarlo en otras Áreas Naturales Protegidas y generar así más empleo en zonas rurales y conservar nuestros bosques y selvas de las que dependemos.

¡Lo que vamos a lograr con tu ayuda!

  • Replicar el modelo de trabajo en 17 Áreas Naturales Protegidas
  • Aumentar en un 20% los ingresos de empresas comunitarias de ecoturismo
  • Generar 200 empleos locales temporales durante zonas rurales comprometidos con la conservación y el desarrollo local.
  • Consolidar una red de 3,000 personas, empresas y organizaciones comprometidas con la conservación y el desarrollo local!
  • 15,000 personas por año vivirán increibles experiencias y para disfrutar y aprender de áreas naturales protegidas para que juntos dejemos el mundo mejor de como lo encontramos!

¿Cómo ganamos todos?

Con tantas manos que nos han ayudado en este increíble camino, hemos tenido la suerte de congelar imágenes, y capturar historias de la gente linda de México. Para agradecer tu donación te estaremos regalando imágenes e historias de las áreas naturales protegidas! Tu puedes elegirlas...

  • US$10. ¡Te llevas una postal digital con increíbles imágenes de áreas naturales protegidas!
  • US$30 ¡Te llevas una historia digital: una serie de 3 fotografías con una historia detrás de la cámara!
  • US$60 ¡Te regalamos un set de 3 increíbles historias con grandes mensajes de nuestros pueblos indígenas de México!
  • US$100 ¡Te regalamos un calendario digital de 2014 con 12 increíbles mensajes de nuestros pueblos indígenas de México!
  • US$250 ¡Te enviamos a tu casa un calendario con 12 increíbles imágenes de áreas naturales protegidas y sonrisas de comunidades rurales e indígenas de nuestro México!
  • US$500 Opción 1.  ¡Te regalamos una increíble experiencia acuática de un día para dos personas en la Selva El Ocote en Chiapas, saliendo de San Cristóbal de Las Casas y aplicable para el 2014!
  • US$500 Opción 2. ¡Regalarás una beca para que un estudiante de una escuela urbana participe en un programa de educación ambiental en un Área Natural Protegida! Te enviaremos el reportaje del su experiencia.
  • US$700 ¡Regalarás una increíble experiencia de ecoturismo y educación ambiental de un día a todos l@s niñ@s de una escuela rural en un área natural protegida de Chiapas! Te enviaremos el reportaje del evento.

¿Quieres ayudar más personalmente ?

¿Quieres involucrarte personalmente para conservar las áreas naturales protegidas y fortalecer el desarrollo local?

¿Eres una empresa? Te invitamos a que tengas reuniones de planeación, team building y viajes de incentivos en áreas naturales protegidas con tus manos corporativas.

¿Eres una preparatoria o universidad? Te esperan divertidísimas experiencias donde aprenderás de manera vivencial  el programa del currículo con tus manos académicas.

¿Eres turista? Prepárate para inolvidables experiencias en impresionantes paisajes con gente increíble de las comunidades indígenas de nuestro México con tus manos viajeras.

¿Eres gobierno? Conoce los bosques de los que depende tu pueblo con tus manos Institucionales.

¡Contactanos!

¡Muchas gracias por unir tus manos para hacer los cambios globales que necesitamos!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ENGLISH VERSION

PROBLEM - Why we do what we do?

Think of a friend or family member who is more than 50 years old!

Since this person was born, more than half of the forests and jungles in Mexico have been destroyed and more than half of the rural population has moved to cities due to a lack of work opportunities, many of whom are now living in marginalized conditions.

All this in only 50 years! What can we expect in the next 50 years?

The good news is that the solution is in your hands!

SOLUTION: La Mano del Mono

In La Mano del Mono we join local hands to create global change by doing what we love to do: living unforgettable experiences in unique landscapes in various natural protected areas, such as the largest cloud forests of Mexico in the Biosphere reserve El Triunfo, and the Lacandon Jungle, where extraordinary people from Mexican rural and local indigenous communities live.

Through this, we generate local employment and preserve the forests where your water, your energy and your food come from. La Mano del Mono creates innovative experiences that combine ecotourism, experiential learning and environmental education. We invite high schools, universities, companies, tourists and governmental institutions to have fun and learn in natural protected areas.

THE IMPACT

In the last five years we have created the following impacts:

  • More than 500 people gained incredible experiences, and, upon returning to their homes, changed relevant daily habits in their lives to create a better world.
  • The model has been replicated in four natural protected areas in collaboration with four local communitarian companies.
  • We have increased the income for local communitarian businesses by about 8% during low seasons of tourism.
  • We have generated 20 temporary jobs dedicated to the conservation and local development.
  • We have involved more than 50 public employees in Chiapas, Mexico to preserve the forests in areas with fresh drinking water.

HELP US PARTICIPATE IN THE AGORA ACCELERATOR

Join hands with us and help us creat the global changes we all need!

We need your help to raise $6,000 USD so we can participate in a venture-coaching program called the Ágora Partnership Accelerator, which is dedicated to boost socially and environmentally beneficial businesses with high growth potential and the ability to solve social and environmental challenges we face today.

On average, every dollar you invest in us will generate $24 more, which will be used to replicate our business model in other natural protected areas, generating jobs for rural areas, and preserving our forests and jungles which we depend on.


What we will achieve with your help!

  • Replicate our model in 17 Protected Areas.
  • Increase the income of community-based enterprises of ecotorism by 20% during low seasons of tourism
  • Generate 200 jobs in rural and indigenous communities oriented to conservation and local development
  • Create a network of 3,000 people, companies and organizations commited to conservation of our forests and local development.
  • Reach more than 15,000 people per year and provide them with incredible life-transforming experiences that inspires them to be the change they want to see in order to leave the world in better condition than we found it.
How we all can win?

  • US$10. You get a great digital post card with amazing images of protected areas
  • US$30 You get an incredible story with three pictures and a story behind the camera!
  • US$60 You will get a series of 3 incredible illustrated stories with messages from our indigenous communities of México!
  • US$100 You will get a digital calendar with 12 amazing messages from our indigenous communities of México!
  • US$250 We will send you a calendar of 2014 to your home with incredible images of wildlife in protected areas and messages of rural and indigenous people of Mexico!
  • US$500 You get an amazing aquatic experience for two people in the Selva El Ocote Biosphere Reserve, leaving from San Cristóbal de Las Casas. It will be valid during 2014!
  • US$500You will give a scholarshipfor a studentfroman urban schoolto participatein anenvironmental education program ina Natural Protected Area! We will send areportofhis experience.
  • US$700 ¡You will give an amazing experience of ecotourism and environmental education of one day to a group of children of a rural school in one protected area in Chiapas! We will send a report of the event.

Would you personally like to get involved in preserving natural protected areas and improving local development?

Are you a company? We invite you to host your planning meetings, team building activities and incentive trips in natural protected areas with our corporate hands. (It is one of our services)

Are you a high school or university? There are amazing experiential learning activities waiting for you from our academic hands’ programs.

Are you a tourist? Get prepared for unforgettable experiences in unique landscapes with extraordinary people from local rural communities in our beloved México with our traveler hands.

Are you a governmental institution? Get to know the forests and the environmental services it provides and which your village depends on with help of our programs of institutional hands.

Contact us!

THANK YOU!... THANK YOU!... THANK YOU!

natural protected areas with our corporate hands. (It is one of our services)
Are you a high school or university?
There are amazing experiential learning activities waiting for you from our
academic hands’ programs.
Are you
a tourist? Get prepared for unforgettable experiences in unique landscapes with
extraordinary people from local rural communities in our beloved México with
our traveler hands.

Are you a governmental institution? Get to know
the forests and the environmental services it provides and which your village
depends on with help of our programs of institutional hands.
Contact us!THANK YOU!... THANK YOU!... THANK YOU!
campaign_city: San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Mexico

story:
Short Summary

Huancavelica is Peru's poorest state capital and one of the world's most mercury-contaminated urban areas as a result of over 400 years of mercury production. Although mercury is no longer refined there, the residents of the city continue to be exposed to this toxin on a daily basis. The problem is exacerbated as most residents in this city of 35,000 live in homes that they have constructed with mercury-laden adobe.

Since 2009, the non-profit Environmental Health Council has conducted research on this problem. Based on The World Health Organization (WHO) and United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) benchmarks 45 of the 60 homes in our study require remediation due to mercury vapor and toxic dust emanating from the unsealed interior walls and earthen floors. Almost all homes in our study are led by women who have children living there, and both groups are especially at risk of mercury poisoning. 

We have recently completed a remediation plan for the city, and are now ready to begin with a pilot project. Our goal is to remediate the four most contaminated homes in the study by applying cement stucco to interior walls and pouring a cement floor. This largely eliminates interior sources of contaminated dust and dirt and, based on the effective use of cement as a vapor barrier, we expect that it will significantly reduce or eliminate off gassing of mercury vapor from the walls and floors.  As we do our work, we will monitor contamination in the home to ensure the efficacy of the work and make adjustments as necessary.

Our team is bi-national and multi-disciplinary, including Peruvian and American experts in medicine, mercury remediation, public health, anthropology, biostatistics, community development, and environmental engineering. The results of our work have been published in peer-reviewed scientific publications, and our plan and approach follow standard remedial approaches.

The participants in our project are also our collaborators, and the poorest of the poor in Huancavelica. Many have been living in their toxic homes for decades, breathing mercury vapors and ingesting contaminated dust. Our work will not only help them lead healthier lives, but serve as a model for a larger scale intervention.

To our knowledge, no one has ever studied mercury-contaminated adobe, or done any remediation work in the city of Huancavelica.

Help us, Help Huanca and Be A Part Of History!

What We Need & What You Get

Each house costs about $1,300 to remediate. This includes cement, rebar, labor and relocating the family and storing their belongings for about 5 days. Donors can sponsor a wall, room, floor, or entire home.

Sponsors will receive the rewards such as a certificate, HelpHuanca! mugs, and Peruvian handicrafts depending on the amount of their donation:

If we do not reach our entire goal, all funds will still be dedicated to the project as described, and we will remediate as many homes as possible based on their level of contamination.

The Impact

This is a unique and unprecedented opportunity to make a significant and very positive impact on underprivileged people's lives. Our work will not only greatly reduce or eliminate their exposure to mercury laden dust and vapor, but will also enable them to live healthier lives overall by having a  more hygienic home.

Most of the mercury which was refined in Huancavelica was destined to Andean silver mills, where it was used to refine silver through the amalgamation process. As a result, the city played an important role in the emergence of the global economy in which we live today. 

Unfortunately, Huancavelica became contaminated as a result of mercury vapor escaping the smelters as it was being refined, before settling in the soils and waterways of the town and region. Among all populations, mercury intoxication can produce persistent and even irreversible neuropsychological effects.

These include personality alterations including psychoses, irritability, impatience, violent outbursts, hypercriticism, depression, anxiety, obsessive-compulsive behaviors, memory loss, problems concentrating, diffidence, indecision, and lack of affect.

Physical symptoms include tremors, a loss of hunger, weight and muscular control, speech impairment, anemia, uncontrollable salivation, gingivitis, and gum discoloration.

Despite the magnitude of the problem, there are solutions, and they include you!

Our approach to tackling the problem of residential mercury contamination in Huancavelica is based on the concept of “fractionalization,” or breaking the problem, and solution, into manageable components.

We do this through two ways. One is by “fractionalizing” the home into its component parts, such as bedroom, living room, kitchen etc. The second is through seeking individual and group donations to remediate each part, allowing the donor to have a direct impact on a specific home and to see the results of their contribution.

We have already sampled, analyzed, and prioritized 45 homes in Huancavelica based on the levels of contamination and number of children in the household. In addition, we have developed a remediation plan for each home, and have the remediation teams organized and ready for action.

We have 5 homes ready to be remediated as well as another 40 planned for remediation.  If we having additional funding beyond the $5200 campaign total, we will continue remediating as many of the next 40 homes as possible. 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge we face is the scale of the problem in Huancavelica. We estimate that approximately 20,000 people are exposed to mercury vapor or contaminated dust in their homes above safe levels. Our work will demonstrate that there are cost-effective and culturally relevant solutions to this problem, and will also create a broader local, national, and global awareness concerning this problem. In so doing, we will engage multiple constituencies and use this pilot study to leverage additional funds from foundations, governments, and other organizations.

We are ready for the challenge! We have been working in Huancavelica since 2009, collecting and analyzing hundreds of samples of soil, air, adobe, dust, and food and conducting community educational meetings. Our network in the city includes not just part of our scientific team, but also the National University of Huancavelica, the local, non-profit Nuevavelica Association, local outreach experts, construction specialists, and our project participants.

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone is able to make a monetary contribution. If this describes you, you can still help by spreading the word to other potential sponsors with the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is this about?

While photography is my medium, my love is for the wilderness. I feel very lucky to live in a place like Washington, because of the beautiful, jagged snow-capped peaks and majestic volcanoes that dominate the horizons here in Washington.

The more I discovered, the more I came to love Washington.

Unfortunately, I also became more concerned by the amount of devastation we have, even here in Washington, with coal plants, gold mines, oil refineries, and far too much traffic.

Photographing the world around us isn't just about making art. It's also an attempt to make a difference.

Last year I climbed Kilimanjaro for myself. Now I'm going to climb Mount Rainier for all of us.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding is going to the American Lung Association, the organizers behind the Climb for Clean Air.

The American Lung Association is using the money to combat big things like pollution, but also small things that affect individual people, like ConnieD whose building manager refuses to evict residents who have a meth lab in the building. It's affecting Connie's health, and even the police aren't helping. Yet the American Lung Association is actively seeking to hire staff in her area so that they can help her.

Some of the contributions will be paying for the gifts I'm offering. Everything else is going to the American Lung Association; I won't make any profit from this campaign. I'm just going to climb a mountain and document the adventure in pictures and video, to tell the story of our trip, the volunteers who are helping us train for the climb, and the other climbers who seeking to do the same thing that I am.

My commitment to the American Lung Association is $4000, and so far I have raised $1000.

What you get is a print. Not just any print, but a beautiful, fine art giclee print from White Crane Photography, printed by the master printers at Giclee on Metal. These makes great gifts; if you have friends or family suffering from emphysema or asthma or who are environmentalists, you could contribute in their name and send them the print to remind them of what we're doing.

I'll sign every print, and include a thank you postcard for your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that money is tight these days, and that not everyone reading this can spare money to help out.

If you can't afford to contribute, but you would like to help reduce pollution and emphysema, and help ConnieD get rid of her meth lab neighbors, then pass the word and encourage your friends to help.

story:
My name is Lieven Devreese. As a primatologist I spent a total of 18 months in the Central African forest studying agile mangabeys and bonobos at three different field sites. Over the years I build up a good knowledge of all primate species in the region.


                                                                   Tshuapa red colobus (Piliocolobus tholloni)

For this expedition I want to go to the Republic of Congo to look for a critically endangered species of red colobus monkey, called Bouvier’s red colobus (Piliocolobus bouvieri). The species has not been seen by scientists since the 1970s and virtually nothing is known about them. If you google it, you will not find a single picture. Actually, the species is largely ignored in the literature. A single report from 1949 gives some information about its distribution and only three museum specimens are known that have been collected about 100 years ago. They are reported to live in an area where scientists rarely go, along the banks of rivers in very inaccessible habitat. They might be extinct, but we just don’t know. Help us fill in this gap. Help us find this elusvie red colobus monkey!


Expedition outline

In January 2015 I want to set off and spend three months looking for monkeys in Congo. It will be an adventurous expedition by car, motorbike, or bicycle, but mainly in a dug-out canoe and on foot through extremely remote areas. A Congolese assistent will go with me on the whole trip. We will ask the people in the villages whether they know this red monkey and then we will head off, hiking through the forest, searching along the rivers. We will hike from one faraway village to the next, covering four forest blocks, a total of 300 or more kilometers. We will bring our tents, cook on wood fire and we will have to rely fully on local food supplies. During my last 10-month stay in the field I learned Lingala, so I don't have a problem talking to the people in Congo.



What do we expect to find?

The inaccessible swamps red colobus monkeys live in might give them some level of protection against hunting. And if no scientist ever goes there, we have no data and it might be they are not as endangered as we think. But that’s the optimistic view. More likely, these monkeys are under severe threat from the commercial bushmeat trade. Hunting is traditionally part of the Central African culture, but nowadays a lot of meat is smoked and transported to the cities. Traders use rivers as highways and in the habitat of Bouvier’s red colobus monkeys there are a lot of big rivers. Red colobus monkeys are also extremely vulnerable to hunting. They are among the largest monkeys in Africa, so they are a good kill for hunters. They live in large, noisy groups and are not particularly good at detecting predators, or hunters.


What we need

For this three-month expedition we need about $5000 in total. We need money for:

  • transport, lodging and food
  • salaries of the assistant, trackers, porters and cooks
  • research permits and permission of the village chiefs to enter their forests
  • some of the necessary equipment, like a solar panel to charge gps batteries

See the detailed project proposal for more information on the bugdet, aims and planning of this expedition. Travelling and working in remote areas in Congo is not an easy thing and a lot of obstacles have to be overcome. At any time it is possible that the expedition will have to be cancelled because of security or health issues, to name just two obstacles. However, I build up a good amount of field experience and I am confident that the expedition aims will be fulfilled, hopefully finding Bouvier's red colobus.



Perks

We will greatly appreciate your support, in any way. In return we can offer you a number of special perks. See the details on the right side of this page.

  • For 25 dollar Lieven will send you a postcard from Brazzaville, the capital of the Republic of Congo. 
  • Donate 50 dollar and we will send you a package with pictures, videos and unique sound recordings from the forest, hopefully including red colobus monkeys. 
  • 100 dollar equals the same multimedia package, plus a unique, locally-made Congolese bracelet. 
  • For 300 dollar Lieven will come to your living room, zoo or institution to give an exciting talk about the expedition.
Conservationists have been writing for a long time that an expedition for Bouvier’s red colobus has utmost priority, but to date no one ever went to Congo. Help us fill in this gap. Help us find the elusive red colobus monkey. Matondo mingi na bino. Or for those who don't speak Lingala: Thank you very much!

story:
Now is the time to help Kauai's beautiful native forest birds by protecting their nests and young from non-native rats!


Due to the overwhelming and humbling support, we ran out of key chain bottle openers!
Sorry for this inconvenience and thank you for your donation!


THE CHALLENGE

Forest bird populations on Kauai are in decline, and rats are a primary culprit, eating eggs, young, and even adults; and competing with birds for food. Traditional methods of rat control, such as snap traps, are extremely labor intensive, and thus impractical in Kauai's rugged terrain. However a new, self-resetting trap made by Goodnature overcomes this issue. The goal of this campaign is to buy at least 25 Goodnature traps to establish a protected area for Kauai's forest birds. More traps would allow us to protect even more birds.

  • All donations will go directly towards buying traps to remove rats from Kauai (and get some cool perks!)
  • With a donation of $300 or higher, you can adopt one or more personalized traps and track your own rat removal progress

THE BACK STORY

Once upon a time...

The beauty of the Hawaiian Islands – apart from endless beaches and tropical flair – lies in the diversity of their native plants and animals, but today many of them can only be found in the most remote forests and mountains of Hawaii.

The magnificent and rugged Alakai Plateau, home of Kauai's native songbirds. Photo: Barbara Heindl

The geographical isolation of the Hawaiian islands fostered the evolution of a fascinating array of songbirds that exist nowhere else in the world.

Hawaiian Honeycreeper beak diversity. All of these species originated from a single finch ancestor. Hawaiian Honeycreepers are found exclusively in Hawaii. Photo: Doug Pratt

But paradise is in danger...

Hawaii is at the epicenter of the current global extinction crisis.  Of the original 130+ native Hawaiian bird species, many have been lost forever, and only 11 are not yet endangered! Multiple threats have been identified, including habitat loss, climate change, disease, and most notably, invasive predator species like rats. 

Rat preying on eggs in a songbird nest. Photo: Jack Jeffrey

Today, Kauai is home to eight native forest bird species, three of which are federally listed as endangered: the Puaiohi or Small Kauai Thrush, the Akeke'e or Kauai Akepa, and the Akikiki or Kauai Creeper. Populations of these birds have plummeted as much as 10-fold in the last 5 years; the Akikiki and the Puaiohi now number fewer than 500 birds, and the Akeke'e numbers fewer than 1000 individuals. Our goal is to reverse these declines.


The endangered Puaiohi, or Small Kauai Thrush, is the island's only remaining native fruit-eating and seed dispersing animal. Photo: Lucas Behnke


The endangered Akikiki, or Kauai Creeper, searches under moss and bark for grubs to eat. Photo: C. Robby Kohley


The endangered Akekee, or Kauai Akepa, is a canopy specialist, using its crossed beak to pry open buds in search of insects to eat. Photo: C. Robby Kohley

Rat traps - and YOU - to the rescue!

We, the Kauai Forest Bird Recovery Project, are working to conserve Kauai's native forest birds, with our fiscal not-for-profit sponsor, Garden Island Resource Conservation and Development, Inc.  But we need YOUR help!

We have identified rats as a major threat to these birds in their native habitats. Rats have been found in the most remote parts of the forest, where they feast on bird eggs, and attack nesting female birds.

Bird eggs destroyed by a rat. Photo: Jack Jeffrey

Rats also destroy the native vegetation by feeding on the bark, fruits, and flowers of native Hawaiian trees and shrubs. Thus they also compete with native birds for food.

A simple and very effective way to control the rat population in the forest is to set  humane Goodnature traps. We successfully tested those traps at our study site last spring; with 37 traps we killed over 100 rats in three months with minimal human effort, but we need many more to make a real impact on the birds. Neither State nor Federal agencies have adequate resources to purchase these traps.

Our goal through crowdfunding is to amplify our ability to protect native birds by controlling the rat population in the heart of Kauai's Alakai Plateau with the purchase and installation of an additional 25 Goodnature rat traps.

By donating at any level, you will help buy these traps and promote the nesting success and survival of native forest birds and plants. Every trap helps: each trap can directly protect a nest tree, but a grid of a minimum of 25  traps defends an entire plot of forest, and all the birds and plants within it. More traps will help us protect more birds in an even larger area.

Saving birds is rewarding!

All donations of $40 or more will receive a t-shirt custom designed by PRBY Apparel for this campaign!


All donation levels will receive some of the perks shown below!


One of our most exciting perks is adopting your own rat trap that will bear your name and logo or other personalized image (All Akeke'e level and higher donors).

When your trap is up and running you will be able to monitor its success online with updates posted by our crew!

The perk for our highest level donor ($2500-Kahu Manu) is a trip to the Alakai Swamp with the Kauai Forest Bird Recovery Project Team (airfare to Kauai and lodging out of the forest regrettably not provided). It is a unique opportunity to experience the beauty of Hawaiian rain forest first hand and to see some of the world's rarest birds.

Dinner at our field camp with volunteers. Photo: Geoff Young

And of course you are always welcome to forgo any perks and have your full donation go towards helping save Kauai's forest birds.

Spread the word about our campaign!

If you've come to our campaign website, chances are it's because someone you know and trust told you about us. To help us meet our fundraising goals, we're asking you to reach out to your own circle of friends - by phone, by email and by social media. Get out there and recruit more Kahu Manu!

If you'd like to learn more about...

  • Kauai's forest birds and their conservation
  • Rat traps and how they work
  • How removing rats and other predators will protect Hawaii's native species
  • The global extinction crisis
  • Hawaii's vanished birds

Like us on Facebook for project updates!


Sunrise on the Alakai. Photo: Barbara Heindl

Mahalo to our partners!
story_txt:
Now is the time to help Kauai's beautiful native forest birds by protecting their nests and young from non-native rats!Due to the overwhelming and humbling support, we ran out of key chain bottle openers!Sorry for this inconvenience and thank you for your donation! THE CHALLENGE
Forest bird populations on Kauai are in decline, and rats are a primary culprit, eating eggs, young, and even adults; and competing with birds for food. Traditional methods of rat control, such as snap traps, are extremely labor intensive, and thus impractical in Kauai's rugged terrain. However a new, self-resetting trap made by Goodnature overcomes this issue. The goal of this campaign is to buy at least 25 Goodnature traps to establish a protected area for Kauai's forest birds. More traps would allow us to protect even more birds. 
All donations will go directly towards buying traps to remove rats from Kauai (and get some cool perks!)

With a donation of $300 or higher, you can adopt one or more personalized traps and track your own rat removal progress
THE BACK STORYOnce upon a time...
The beauty of the Hawaiian Islands – apart from endless beaches and
tropical flair – lies in the diversity of their native plants and animals, but today
many of them can only be found in the most remote forests and mountains of Hawaii.



The magnificent and rugged Alakai Plateau, home of Kauai's native songbirds. Photo: Barbara Heindl
The geographical isolation
of the Hawaiian islands fostered the evolution of a fascinating array of
songbirds that exist nowhere else in the world.


Hawaiian Honeycreeper beak diversity. All of these species originated from a single finch ancestor. Hawaiian Honeycreepers are found exclusively in Hawaii. Photo: Doug Pratt
But paradise is in danger...
Hawaii is at the epicenter of the current global extinction
crisis.  Of the original 130+ native Hawaiian bird species, many have been lost forever, and only 11 are not yet
endangered! Multiple threats have been
identified, including habitat loss, climate change, disease, and most notably,
invasive predator species like rats. 





Rat preying on eggs in a songbird nest. Photo: Jack JeffreyToday, Kauai is home to eight native forest bird species, three of which are federally listed as endangered: the Puaiohi or
Small Kauai Thrush, the Akeke'e or Kauai Akepa, and the Akikiki or Kauai Creeper. Populations of these birds have plummeted as much as 10-fold in the last
 5 years; the Akikiki and the Puaiohi now number fewer than 500 birds, 
and the Akeke'e numbers fewer than 1000 individuals. Our goal is to 
reverse these declines.The endangered Puaiohi, or Small Kauai Thrush, is the island's only remaining native fruit-eating and seed dispersing animal. Photo: Lucas Behnke

The endangered Akikiki, or Kauai Creeper, searches under moss and bark for grubs to eat. Photo: C. Robby Kohley

The endangered Akekee, or Kauai Akepa, is a canopy specialist, using its crossed beak to pry open buds in search of insects to eat. Photo: C. Robby Kohley

Rat traps - and YOU - to the rescue!
We, the Kauai Forest Bird Recovery Project, are working to conserve Kauai's native forest birds, with our
fiscal not-for-profit sponsor, Garden Island Resource Conservation and Development, Inc.  But we need YOUR help!
We have identified rats as a major threat to these birds in
their native habitats. Rats have been found in the most remote parts of the
forest, where they feast on bird eggs, and attack nesting female birds.



Bird eggs destroyed by a rat. Photo: Jack Jeffrey Rats also destroy the native vegetation by feeding on the bark, fruits, and flowers of native Hawaiian trees and shrubs. Thus they also compete with native birds for food.
A simple and very effective way to control the rat population in the forest is
to set  humane Goodnature traps.
We successfully tested those traps at our study site last spring; with 37 traps we killed over 100 rats in three months with minimal human effort, but we need many more to make a real impact on the
birds. Neither State nor Federal agencies have
adequate resources to purchase these traps. 

Our goal through crowdfunding is to amplify our ability to protect native birds by controlling the rat
population in the heart of Kauai's Alakai Plateau with the purchase and installation of an additional
25 Goodnature rat traps. 
By donating at any level, you will help buy these traps and promote the nesting
success and survival of native forest birds and plants. Every trap helps: each trap can directly protect a nest tree, but a grid of a minimum of 25  traps defends an entire plot of forest, and all the birds and plants within it. More traps will help us protect more birds in an even larger area.
Saving birds is rewarding!
All donations of $40 or more will receive a t-shirt custom designed by PRBY Apparel for this campaign!


All donation levels will receive some of the perks shown below!


One of our most exciting perks is adopting your own rat trap that will bear your name and logo or other personalized image (All Akeke'e level and higher donors).


When your trap is up and running you will be able to monitor its success online with updates posted by our crew!The perk for our highest level donor ($2500-Kahu Manu) is a trip to the Alakai
Swamp with the Kauai Forest Bird Recovery Project Team (airfare to Kauai and lodging out of the forest regrettably not provided). It is a unique opportunity
to experience the beauty of Hawaiian rain forest first hand and to see some of
the world's rarest birds. 

Dinner at our field camp with volunteers. Photo: Geoff Young
And of course you are always welcome to forgo any perks and have your full
donation go towards helping save Kauai's forest birds.


Spread the word about our campaign!
If you've come to our campaign website, chances are it's because someone
 you know and trust told you about us. To help us meet our fundraising 
goals, we're asking you to reach out to your own circle of friends - by 
phone, by email and by social media. Get out there and recruit more Kahu Manu!
If you'd like to learn more about...


Kauai's forest birds and their conservation


Rat traps and how they work


How removing rats and other predators will protect Hawaii's native species


The global extinction crisis


Hawaii's vanished birds




Like us on Facebook for project updates!
Sunrise on the Alakai. Photo: Barbara Heindl 

Mahalo to our partners!

story:
Short Summary

Help A 17 Yr Old Grow His Crystal Clean Bins Business

You see, a trashcan cleaning business is a very simple business to run, My Son started out just Cleaning our Two Trash Bins Then He Started Asking neighbors to clean ther bins and it just grew from there to about 100 customers for him a month. Let me explain why I decided to help him get into this fast-growing industry as an independent business owner.

We have become aware and recognize that the convenience of having a trash and recycle bin cleaning service is essential. However, there is no disputing that no one likes to go near a trash bin, especially during the hot summer.  Our goal is to provide an efficient, easily affordable curbside trash and recycle bin-cleaning service to the community, protecting them from the hazards of bacterial and fungal infection commonly detected on, in and around un-cleaned bins. Our natural solvents kill 99% of all known germs, fungi and viruses. We recycle all water and comply with all EPA regulations. Our system is 100% environmentally friendly and the fully self-contained cleaning unit collects all the chemicals and wastewater to avoid urban run-off causing no harm to the storm water system or environment in the manual cleaning does. In addition, all wastewater will be disposed of safely at a locally approved treatment facility.

What We Need

We or asking for funding For a self-contained units with high-pressure water, environmentally friendly detergent and organic enzymes to clean, disinfect, deodorize and kill the germs and bacteria that reside in your garbage can. For Crystal Clean Bins LLC from Sparkling Bins (See Unit In Video Gallery )

Sparkling Bins specializes in residential and commercial TRASH & RECYLE BIN cleaning. They also focus on custom state of the art bin cleaning devices. There Hydraulic lifter is custom engineered for bin washing…the only one in the industry!!  There cleaning device comes equipped with a 1, 2 or 3 bin lifter. These cleaning devices have been proven to clean over 150 bins per day.
Most importantly, they include 12-months of unlimited support, 8-hours of training on the cleaning device, as well as a complete marketing strategy to help maximize your immediate growth, provide sample advertising materials; such as door hangers, direct mail strategy; provide direction for press releases in your local town newspapers, how to market your local Property Management Companies and much more!!  They want to see you succeed!! Any amount of funding from $1 or more will be appreciated if we do not receive the total amount. The Funding  will be used as a down payment and we will work on geting financing for the balance. THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR HELP


The Impact

I did a lot of research and found that trash can cleaning was virtually untapped in the US, and also where I live. I am located in South Georgia and we have a lot of stinkin' trashcans here. It's sunny most of the year, but especially so from spring to fall, where it can reach 100 degrees in the mid summer. Not only is it impractical to try and clean your own city-issued trashcan here, but in most places it's actually illegal to dump the trash residue and waste water into the city drains and municipal water system. Who wants to get fined for cleaning their trashcan?

And let's face it, who in their own right mind would even want to clean a trashcan in South Georgia  in 100-degree weather anyway? I didn't, and I knew other people didn't want to either!

I discovered all that I needed was the right garbage can cleaning machine, a truck, and some advertising materials to let people know about his service, to get this business going. I could easily see that offering this service to people living in mid to high-income residential areas was a no-brainer. And I found out it was true!

Other Ways We Can Help

Our natural solvents kill 99% of all known germs, fungi and viruses. We recycle all water and comply with all EPA regulations. Our system is 100% environmentally friendly and the fully self-contained cleaning unit collects all the chemicals and wastewater to avoid urban run-off causing no harm to the storm water system or environment in the manual cleaning does. In addition, all wastewater will be disposed of safely at a locally approved treatment facility.

story:
Morgan: founder and CEO of MilkCrate, bikes to most meetings, with one eye on traffic and the other on the lookout for the newest and next, sustainable business.

Jason: South Philly tech nerd & CSA foodie; MilkCrate’s ‘vested’ magician-behind-the-computer-curtain-programmer.

Rachelle: Center City brownstone rent share; dairy farmer lover, regional brand marketing/sales rep; ‘who-don’t-you-know?’ style maven and foodie.

Caitlin: Washington Square’s loss will be South Philly’s gain, ballad heroine-worthy curly redhead; alias ‘tweetie’, blog slog and slogan slinger.

Nicole: Arizona’s Last Chance rancher moves to Graduate Hospital, goes urban, sharpens calculator, calculates sustainable everything, bi-coastally.

Camille: “Thank heavens the Jenkintown station bridge is finally finished” recent art undergrad; tats and stats; find-and-go-seek new MilkCrate businesses.

Greg: Old City’s sustainability-all-in. Has video camera, will travel, coach, edit, lighting, animations, voice-overs, and more! Will do/redo/can do!

Corey: South Philly garden-tender lending her printmaker and designer know-how for our graphic and brand development.

Risks & Challenges

If we raise our targeted amount we can afford to build the next version of the app. With any tech undertaking there are always setbacks, but we have managed to hit every milestone on time for the last year and we are confident we will keep on track. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute,  that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help us get the word out and make noise about our campaign.
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word

FAQ's

Q: Can I download MilkCrate right now?

A: The MilkCrate App is live and free 

Google Play/Droid https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.milkcrate

iPhone/iOS/The App store https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/milkcrate-philly/id910982806?mt=8&ign-mpt=uo%3D4

Q: Can I use the app if I don't live in Philadelphia? 

A: Right now we only have data for the Philadelphia area, but you can submit businesses on our new website for anywhere in the world! www.milkcratephilly.com

Q: Should I donate even if I don't live in Philadelphia? 

A: Of course! We would love to have you involved no matter where you live, although most of our perks are for local businesses. However! You can get our product perks shipped to your house OR just donate because you care :)

Q: I know someone that would like to invest/partner/mentor for MilkCrate, who do I contact?

A: Write us at info@milkcratephilly.com - we'd love to chat!

----------------------------- That's it for now, check back for updates!--------------------------

story:
Summary

The Worcester Spinning and Finishing Company site is a former textile manufacturing, finishing and dying mill classified as a Superfund site by the EPA. In addition to the possible human and environmental health issues posed by the hazardous wastes present at this site, the mill building itself is condemned due to a fire and the site is not being developed or repaired by the current owners. In order to move ahead with the reclamation and cleanup of this site, we need to evaluate the extent of the chemical and hazardous waste damage by completing our own Phase I and II environmental assessments. Only after completing these assessments, can we know how we should proceed with the cleanup and restoration of the site.

You can view more photos of the site at http://www.lcatrust.org/programs/kettle

What We Need

We need funds to begin the assessment process of this land.  We have potential funding sources for the BIG CLEANUP but the specific cleanup needs are essential to pursue those funds.

Because this mill is listed as a Superfund site by the EPA, it is highly likely that there is hazardous waste contamination present, but it is the extent of the damage that is unknown. With the information provided by the assessments, we can better plan the future of this project and account for such factors as how long it will take to restore this site, how much future funding we will need to clean up the site and complete a restoration, which chemicals or hazardous wastes are present and which professionals have the proper expertise to deal with them.

The Impact

Our ultimate goal is to reclaim a dangerous and hazardous waste site and convert it into a site for conservation, recreation and possible renewable energy production. Reclamation will ensure that this site is converted to positive environmental and societal use and protect it from further contamination or from being bought by developers and converted into more urban sprawl. This will stop the degradation and loss of ecosystems and habitats in a culturally and historically significant area. The site also contains a dam and a pond. The possibility of restoring and using this dam as a renewable energy resource is being explored, as well as the use of the mill building area and the pond for a land-based and partially aquatic-based solar panel farm. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help with donations, by promoting this effort and by volunteering for our organization.

About Us

Land Conservation and Advocacy Trust, Inc. (lcatrust.org) was formed on the belief that conservation and preservation of natural and organic spaces is vital to the physical, emotional and spiritual health and well-being of communities. Our goals are to strengthen community stewardship   and to assist in the preservation of open spaces, farm land, historic architecture, and natural resources by providing emergency funding and legal support to local and burgeoning conservation groups. We seek to promote smart-growth ideals that foster these land conservation values. Founded in 2008, LCAT is a non-profit organization based in Massachusetts and works with conservation and preservation interests throughout the Unites States.

Go to http://lcatrust.org for more information.

story:
We will be conducting food and clothing drives for the victims of wildfires in Colorado every weekend this summer! If you would like to help volunteer or donate, please visit our facebook page, like or follow us, and send us a message! We are always in a different location, and we're always looking for help!


We are looking for families to sponsor. If you have been affected by the wildfires - please contact us. We may be able to provide shelter, food, clothing and more - with no questions asked!

 

Short Summary

Don't you wish that you could actually volunteer when a wildfire breaks out in your area? Instead of just donating money to an organization that has the fire as one of their projects - wouldn't it be nice if an organization was dedicated just to wildfires?

We will be the first regional volunteer fire fighting agency in the nation dedicated solely to wildfires in the southwest region of the United States. 

We will train regular citizens - such as yourself - to become volunteer firefighters and support staff for wildfires and the communities affected by them.

Our teams will focus on the following areas:

Property notification of wildfires and evacuations

Support personnel for burnout operations and digout operations

Fuel removal from forest beds and surrounding areas

Private help with animal rescues during evacuations

Road closures and land closures

Food and beverage support for fire personnel

 

By providing these support services to the local community, and the fire departments - the professional fire teams can focus more on fighting the actual fire and the fireline - instead of all of the secondary duties required to make an operation successful.

By having more volunteers available at the start of a fire, we can reduce property loss, reduce loss of life to humans and animals, evacuate areas more quickly, and put out the fire faster!

What We Need & What You Get

This is our first round of funding - with this round of funding, we will complete the following:

~Build a new website for the company

~Find a location in which we can headquarter, expand, and store materials and equipment as needed

~Register a new phone

~Setup our basic office

~Begin recruiting citizens for firefighter training

 

People that donate will be able to help with the following:

~Design aspects of the website - including live alerts of fires and evacuations, memberships and newsletter design, and more.

~Location - HELP US FIND A HOME! We need to find a location where we can answer phones, store fire equipment (coats, pants, suits, maybe a few vehicles)

 

The Impact

Once we have our first round of funding complete, and we are setup - we will begin accepting donations to expand and begin training of citizens to become volunteer firefighters. We would like to donate to local fire stations for them to provide the training for our organization.

We will approach all local and regional fire departments and open training in multiple locations, multiple times per year - to meet citizen needs.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will be accepting material and equipment donations in a very short time. When we begin accepting these donations, we will be looking for the following:

~Fire equipment - including but not limited to suits, helmets, axes, chainsaws, boots, gloves, masks, oxygen tanks, breathers, re-breathers, etc.

~Vehicles - The larger the vehicle, and the better gas mileage, the better. We will provide transportation to and from the fires for the volunteers fighting the fires. We will also provide local pickup points in local towns to reduce travel times for each citizen.

~Office Equipment - We would much rather furnish our office with donated items instead of spending donations on furniture! If you have a desk, newer computer, printer, calendar - anything that you think may help in a fire chief's office - please let us know!

Support Equipment - Tables, cups, plates, silverware, napkins, non-perishable food items, unopened baby wipes, coffee and tea dispensers, caution tape, orange construction cones, emergency vehicle lights (flashing lights to place on a vehicle, preferably magnetic)

 

IF WE REACH OUR GOAL EARLY - We will find a location asap - have our office setup asap, get our website live within 7 days - and begin our second round of funding - OUR GOAL IS TO BE LIVE AND START TRAINING BY AUGUST 1ST!

IF WE RAISE MORE THAN OUR GOAL - This money will go directly into finding volunteers, and singing up members for training. The faster we have volunteers - the faster we can fight fires!

 

IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, IDEAS, OR WAYS TO HELP US - PLEASE EMAIL US ASAP - WILDFIREALERTS@GMAIL.COM

 

If you are a company or individual interested in making an anonymous donation, please contact us at wildfirealerts@gmail.com

Once we have our first round of funding complete, and we are setup - we will begin accepting donations to expand and begin training of citizens to become volunteer firefighters. We would like to donate to local fire stations for them to provide the training for our organization.
We will approach all local and regional fire departments and open training in multiple locations, multiple times per year - to meet citizen needs.


Other Ways You Can Help
We will be accepting material and equipment donations in a very short time. When we begin accepting these donations, we will be looking for the following:
~Fire equipment - including but not limited to suits, helmets, axes, chainsaws, boots, gloves, masks, oxygen tanks, breathers, re-breathers, etc.
~Vehicles - The larger the vehicle, and the better gas mileage, the better. We will provide transportation to and from the fires for the volunteers fighting the fires. We will also provide local pickup points in local towns to reduce travel times for each citizen.
~Office Equipment - We would much rather furnish our office with donated items instead of spending donations on furniture! If you have a desk, newer computer, printer, calendar - anything that you think may help in a fire chief's office - please let us know!
Support Equipment - Tables, cups, plates, silverware, napkins, non-perishable food items, unopened baby wipes, coffee and tea dispensers, caution tape, orange construction cones, emergency vehicle lights (flashing lights to place on a vehicle, preferably magnetic)
 
IF WE REACH OUR GOAL EARLY - We will find a location asap - have our office setup asap, get our website live within 7 days - and begin our second round of funding - OUR GOAL IS TO BE LIVE AND START TRAINING BY AUGUST 1ST!
IF WE RAISE MORE THAN OUR GOAL - This money will go directly into finding volunteers, and singing up members for training. The faster we have volunteers - the faster we can fight fires!
 
IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, IDEAS, OR WAYS TO HELP US - PLEASE EMAIL US ASAP - WILDFIREALERTS@GMAIL.COM
 
If you are a company or individual interested in making an anonymous donation, please contact us at wildfirealerts@gmail.com

story:
On March 2nd, hundreds of students from across the country for XL DISSENT, a march from Georgetown to the gates of the White House, upon which a group will risk arrest through non-violent civil disobedience.

Help Middlebury students get down to DC by donating money for gas and bail for students who cannot afford the $100 post and forfeit. 


This is a critical moment in the fight against the Keystone XL Pipeline. President Obama promised at Georgetown this summer that he would not approve the pipeline if it were proven to cause an increase in emissions. The recently Environmental Impact Statement said it won't. We know it will. Help us hold Obama accountable to the youth who voted him in as we say no to KXL.

What is XL DISSENT?

XL DISSENT is the vision of a group of young organizers to respond to one of the most pressing environmental decisions of our time. If approved, the Keystone XL pipeline would increase the economic viability of extraction in Alberta, exacerbate pollution and health risks from refining, and spell game over for the climate. As young people we must respond: our future is on the line. We believe that by orchestrating the largest youth climate civil disobedience in US history we can send a strong message to President Obama: Unlock us from a fossil fuel future. XL Dissent is a weekend event that will include a civil disobedience training and divestment campaign meeting on Saturday, and an action on Sunday. For more information, visit xldissent.org.
