story:
SUMMARY

The disposable lifestyle is what Americans have championed since the post-war economic boom of last century.   But now as we approach the limitations of those choices, we're recognizing that more sustainable lifestyle and business practices are necessary.  These changes require recycling more (rates are on the rise!) and using less stuff (unfortunately, our consumption rates also continue to rise) -- so this is the part we’re helping with!

The team at Beeco has developed an innovative consumer loyalty program that incentivizes people for taking small acts to reduce waste while shopping, and promotes retailers who are sustainable corporate citizens! 

Beeco's program promotes that individual small acts can add-up to Big Rewards for you and for our environment!

With the BeecoSmartTM Sustainability Rewards Program, you can earn points toward rewards for something as simple as bringing your reusable bag or mug when shopping at your favorite stores. 

Beeco's revolutionary program of rewarding people for using less stuff is simple to use.  For example, our system can be easily deployed in coffee shops and consumer goods & food stores so that patrons who bring their own bag or mug may log their reward activity by entering a user id or scanning a QR code in the Beeco user interface.  Shoppers feel good about earning points and increasing loyalty to participating stores, and for helping the environment!  Points turn into rewards offered by the Network of Participating Retailers for reducing the use of single-use disposable products and the waste they generate.  

We are very excited to start our first municipal partnership with the City of Boulder, Colorado who will promote the BeecoSmart Program to residents and shoppers throughout the city starting this spring. The BeecoSmart Program is already being piloted at a coffee shop with demonstrated success. We are also in discussions with several other cities in Colorado, and look forward to taking the program nationwide after we have reached a critical mass!

Your support will help us provide the sales and development momentum to ensure this first rollout of the program is successfully deployed in as many stores as we can, so that we can spread this sustainability program to other cities and communities.   The more we increase awareness about how simple and rewarding it is to use less, the better it is for our health and the health of our environment.

Thank you for supporting us, and for getting the word out about Beeco and Sustainability!

p.s. Please forward our campaign to your friends, and like us on Facebook! 

p.s.s. Perks that include reusable products are available for shipping in US and Canada only.  Thx!

HERE’S WHY WE DID IT, AND HOW IT WORKS:

The Beeco Team believes that:

Small acts can have powerful positive impacts. When people make small changes in their daily habits, it will create a huge benefit to our environment;

Information is empowerment - as people learn how their individual choices can bring about real environmental improvements, they will be excited, enthusiastic, proud and inspired;

Our individual acts can collectively overcome the enormous problems facing us, that on our own, seem out of reach and unmanageable;

Everyone wants to live in a healthy and sustainable world - it’s up to each one of us to make it happen. 

Beeco provides tools to make those tasks simple, fun … and rewarding!

Did you know...

Americans generate 250 million tons of trash each year!!

That is nearly 4 ½ lbs by each of us, every day!!

We soundly beat every other nation in the waste generation competition!

And we know that you’re probably not proud of that honor either … 

While this may be the statistical state of things, not all the news is bad.

Recycling rates by Americans are on the rise! In 2010, recycling rates increased to 34% of all municipal solid waste. However, most of this increase is for paper and metals recycling and composting.

As for plastics, only 8% of all plastic disposed of was recycled!

And only about 2% of the 100 billion plastic bags we use each year (approx. 500 is used by every adult in the U.S.) gets recycled.  Part of the reason for that is because they are very difficult to process - plastic bags cause significant damage at recycling processing centers, requiring costly additional processing to keep the bags separated from other recyclable material.  And many of the billions of plastic bags that don’t end up being recycled often end up in the landfill either. Instead, polluting our waterways, neighborhoods and parks.  Yet, we use more and more of it every year. 

  

We especially need to reduce, reuse and recycle plastics because, unlike paper, it doesn’t biodegrade – ever!  It just fills up our landfills and collects in our oceans. When it ends up in lakes and oceans, it photo-degrades into tiny pieces that the fish and other sea life ingest.  And guess what happens when we eat that seafood? 

Would you knowingly choose to eat petroleum?  Ick!

Over 330 million barrels of petroleum and natural gas liquids are used to make plastic products in the U.S. each year, nearly 5% of our total petroleum consumption. And 12 million barrels of that is used just to make disposable plastic bags.

We won’t even go deep into the significant adverse health and environmental impacts of paper and Styrofoam products (high levels of methane greenhouse gas emissions and toxic chemicals), we’ve already said enough to inspire action, haven’t we?

Although, our population and consumption and pollution rates continue to increase, we have a huge opportunity to make strides in reducing the volume of food & beverage containers, and plastic bags being trashed. 

And on a really straightforward, direct shout out –

WE NEED TO STOP POLLUTING SO MUCH!

Beeco’s consumer ‘Eco-Loyalty’ program gives us all an extra incentive for doing just that!

And it’s really easy!  And fun!!  And to top it all off, you earn rewards from participating retailers for doing your part to solve a big problem facing us! 

INTRODUCING The BeecoSmartTM Sustainability Rewards Program!

The BeecoSmartTM Program is a market-driven ‘Eco-Loyalty’ program that rewards consumers for using reusable products instead of single use, disposable bags, cups, and beverage bottles made from plastic and trees. 

As a result of this, businesses are able to reduce their expenses for purchasing single use products and for having less trash!

Businesses also gain more loyal customers who appreciate the company’s commitment to sustainability and for being a good corporate environmental steward.  They also receive metrics on their stores’ user participation and the resulting environmental benefits (e.g. resources saved, waste prevented, etc.)

Gotta love how doing one simple thing can have so many upsides!

HOW IT WORKS:

You can sign up to be a Beeco member at your favorite business on one of the BeecoSmart user interface tablets -- or on our website, or mobile app (coming soon), or directly through the stores system.

Then follow our simple three-step process:

1.  Once you are registered using your phone # (or other 10 digit number) or by using a Beeco Key Fob having a unique QR code to scan at a Retailers’ checkout location, you log your reward activity each time you bring a reusable bag, mug or container to a participating Beeco Network Retailer. When you make a purchase and use your own bag or cup, you are eligible to earn points at that retailer.

2.  Watch your points accumulate through your online login or mobile app.  Once you earn enough points, they can be redeemed for discounts or merchandise offered through any of the participating Beeco Network Retailers who subscribe to the program.

3.  Choose from the rewards offered by any of the participating Retailers.  Beeco's subscription agreement with Retailers includes the requirement that they offer consumer perks that are more valuable than what is offered to the general public, for example 20% off any purchase if the store already offers a coupon for 10% off; or free coffee drink after 8 purchases if a punch card for 'buy 10 get one free' is already offered. 

That’s it!   Simple.

NOW LET’S GET STARTED!

Beeco is partnering with the City of Boulder, Colorado to bring the BeecoSmart Sustainability Rewards Program to retailers throughout the City starting this Spring!  And we are in talks with another even larger city to do the same. 

This is great, however we need to complete more of our technical development (complete a mobile app for reading stations, and the software solution for existing POS systems at larger retailers that have lots of integrated cash registers), and market it to everyone - as well as keep the lights on.

And we want to make sure these first launches go great, so we can have a successful foundation to bring the BeecoSmart Program to other communities nation-wide!  Increasing awareness about reducing pollution on a large scale of our population is our goal!

YOUR PART:

We are looking to raise $35,000, which will allow us to complete what is needed for this initial successful launch, and have a solid foundation for subsequent roll outs in other communities.  Any funding we raise above this amount will help us continue to grow the business and implement the sustainability rewards program.  :)

For your support in this effort, we are very excited to offer you several awesome perks:

From – appreciation and recognition of your support;

To – sending you one or more of our high quality, reusable products all of which are made from recycled materials,

 

To – appointing you a Beeco Ambassador, Sponsor or Sustainable Partner to promote our BeecoSmartTM Sustainability Rewards Program in yours or other communities!

It is extremely important (and even more so appreciated) that we have your support in launching this program in our first city.  It is of the highest priority for us that this launch is a success as it lays the foundation of our future growth and proves the viability of the program.

Nearly everyone we have talked to - individuals, business and municipal leaders and retail store managers - are very excited about the potential of BeecoSmartTM Sustainability Rewards Program to make real meaningful collective change toward reducing our social environmental impacts.  And we are confident with your help we will exceed their expectations.

Be sure to share this message on all the social sites.  We put some links below. 

Thank you very much!

Leslie Weise

President, Beeco Corp.

HERE’S OUR BEECO TEAM: 

Management:

Leslie Weise, LLM, Founder and President

Daniel Ziskin, PhD, co-Founder and Director of Technology

Darrell Ritchie, Director of IT Marketing

Marisa Katz, Director of Business Development

Team of dedicated Business and Policy Advisors:

Dan Benavidas

Rebeca Bishop

Alison Burchell

Larry Christensen

Herb Rubenstein

Team of Interns from the Bachelor of Innovations Program at the University of Colorado, Colorado Springs:  John Franck, Justin Bills, Kevin Lam and Lucas Schmidt.

Web Developer: Strassner Web & Video Services.

Graphics Design: DesignInk of Boulder. 

For more detail about our Sustainability Rewards Program and for bios of our Beeco Team members, visit us at  BeecoRewards.com.

THE BACKSTORY:

Beeco started after Leslie Weise, a corporate intellectual property attorney and business consultant with a passion and activism for environmental and civil rights, became impatient after years of observing that our nation’s (and world) consumption and pollution rates were continuing to increase, yet our recycling and reuse rates were going in the opposite direction. At about the same time she had her first child, she clearly realized that if each of us doesn’t become part of the solution, then a solution might not happen.  So when her son turned 5 in 2011, she quit her comfy corporate life and decided to strike out on her own in pursuit of finding business friendly solutions that incorporate current social and technological trends that would appeal to more people. 

A second child was then born, named Beeco!  Beeco is pronounced "Bee-co" but stands for “Be Eco”, and its mission is to create tools that are engaging and simple so that people and businesses want to participate … and get rewarded for doing so!   The goal for Beeco is to appeal to as many demographics of people as possible, and not be exclusive to any person or group who may wish to participate.  By increasing awareness that the solution rests with each one of us, and that collectively our actions can overcome the enormous problems facing us that otherwise seem out of reach - the goal for recycling and reuse to become the norm, and no longer the exception, will be achieved! 

As for user engagement, Leslie and her brilliant and dedicated co-Founder Daniel Ziskin, have made sure that the user interfaces are accessible to not only those people with the latest smart phone devices (they may scan QR codes or use wireless for tracking their transactions).  They have also made sure that those without the latest gadgets can still participate; those folks can simply enter a phone or other 10 digit code into an easy to use interface screen at the checkout station.  And finally, they have been cognizant that the tools they create must scale so that people, stores, communities and cities can adopt the program nation-wide!

Beeco is designed to appeal to a wide range of people, from the sustainable and environmental minded who will enjoy the BeecoSmart Program to earn rewards for what the acts they are already taking, to those folks who make consumer savings a priority who will also appreciate the rewards to supplement their good feeling for acts that help the environment.  Beeco's proprietary, patent-pending business process is integrated in this combined software, social media, technology and marketing solution!

As for appeal to Cities and Communities, Beeco works both in conjunction with regulatory approaches to addressing our pollution problem, and also as an alternative to municipalities that prefer a market-based solution over regulatory methods for waste reduction.  A carrot, with or instead of, the stick!

And its appeal is working.  Nearly all business and municipal leaders to whom we have introduced the BeecoSmart Sustainability Rewards Program, as well as people of all consumer types, have been excited to participate in the BeecoSmart Program.  The first two cities whose officials have roles that include waste reduction and sustainability with whom we have discussed the program, have expressed their commitment to actively promote it. 

The Beeco Team now includes additional Rock Star talent: another Technical IT Director, Darrell Ritchie, and a Business Development Director, Marisa Katz.  We are also blessed to have dedicated, experienced business advisors who have spent tireless efforts helping get Beeco launched over the past year.  And we have had the help of interns from the University of Colorado, Colorado Springs Bachelor of Innovations Program, as well as intern/advisor Rebeca Bishop, a talented IT Program Manager from the Columbia University Master of Science Earth Institute Sustainability Management Degree Program.

Thanks for helping our business continue to grow, and most importantly, for supporting the Beeco Mission to reduce pollution and help make our planet healthy for us and the children among us, and for all their children for generations to come!

Sustainably Yours,

The BEECO Team

story:
Please help us make this bold and innovative local no-waste solution become reality! We need your help to better the environment on a grand scale! :)

Greater DC Cup Share will be a green initiative service providing reusable cups to the metro DC establishments that currently use disposable cups. The goal is to provide a complete and ubiquitous cup reuse system that is almost transparent to the user and establishments and that will eliminate millions of disposable cups from the DC landfills by providing a substantial drink discount to the user when they return witht the Cup Share reusable cup.

- Parallel replacement to the current disposable cups in use.

- Provided to the establishments to be sold to the customer.

- The establishments will offer the stainless steel cups to the customer at POS

- After the cup is purchased, the user returns to any participating establishment with the reuse cup and recieves a drink discount when reuse cup is used in lieu of a disposable cup.

- Return used stainless steel reuse cup at any time to any participating establishment.

The Cups:

- Single Wall Stainless Steel

- Pint size (16oz), Weight 3.5 ounces

- Dimensions are identical to the standard disposable cup.

- Most standard size lids, caps, and sleeves fit perfectly.

- Safe, no BPAs, and are not only recyclable, but are also upcyclable.

Cleaning:

- Cups can easily be cleaned with hot soapy water.

- The user must ensure they properly clean their cup before returning for another drink purchase.

- The establishments must refuse any dirty cup.

The Environment:

- Will remove millions of disposable cups a year in the DC area.

- Will eliminate energy spent from the transportation of millions of cups.

- Will eliminate the energy and resources required to make millions of disposable cups every day!

- Eliminates energy required to recycle other plastics.

- Bicycle collection and delivery will be used when feasible.

- Eliminates chemicals found in plastics from the landfills.

Team Members:

Kevin A. Brown - Founder / CEO

Zicky Anumudu - Co-Founder / CIO


STRATEGY: Phases 0-4

Phase 0 - The Creation (This Project): This is the hardest part of any start-up business, the creation and build up of the business itself. This is what this indiegogo project is for...to get us going. The creation phase contains some of the hardest aspect to find and obtain. This includes; funding, initial customers, assets/stock, awareness, finding the right team members, and building the business case/plan. This project will help obtain our most important asset...the cups.

Phase 1 - The First Start: Once we obtain funding via indiegogo and other sources, and get our first customers to agree to this bold idea, our next big step is a leap of faith. Here we actually begin to operate the business and processes. Our goal is to start with a minimal of 1 to 3 establishments in the fall of 2013.

Phase 2 - Expansion: Beginning in the spring 2014 after we proof the concept and processes of the business, we hope to begin expansion into neighboring establishments. The great thing about the system is that it is extremely scalable. To take on more establishments is a matter of purchasing more cups, and obtaining more labor.

Phase 3 - Advancement: This is the point where we can go BIG! Here is the point where we develop advance processes using technology and begin to automate and refine the system. The phase will allow us to advance quickly in the DC area. The phase will require considerable funding to develop the IT infrastructure. This phase is planned in 2016-2017.

Phase 4 - The Push: Here is where we will be prepared to obtain participating establishments in the greater DC area to include all of Northern DC and Maryland. This phase will include creation of several more cleaning facilities in other areas. This phase is long term and will most likely occur in 2018-ish.

Phase 0 indiegogo Funding - What do we need:

We need a minimal of $3000 to begin with one establishment. This is bare bones. The idea amount is $30k, but we could start comfortably with $10k

$3000 funding will allow a start with 1 establishment and:

      ·$1200 - 300 laser engraved stainless steel cups

      ·$100 - Laser engraving set-up fee

      ·$400 – Business registration

      ·$500 – One month business liability insurance

      ·$300 – One month share kitchen fee

$10,000 funding will allow a start with 2 to 3 establishments and:

      ·$3600 – 900 laser engraved stainless steel cups

      ·$100 - Laser engraving set-up fee

      ·$400 – Business registration

      ·$1500 – 3 month business liability insurance

      ·$900 – 3 month share kitchen fee

      ·$1300 – Initial marketing campaign (includes website and branding)

      ·$500 – Initial lawyer consultation

      ·$900 – LLC filing fee

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q. Will these cups be used for both hot and cold beverages?

    A. Yes. The single wall cup is made for cold beverages. Hot beverages will require the use of a sleeve.

Q. Does the cup transfer a metallic flavor to the beverage?

    A. No. Unlike other metals, stainless steel is not known for this, but just to make sure the interior is electro-polished to eliminate any transfer of a metal taste to the beverage or beverage taste to the metal.

Q. Can I use any type of lid on these cups?

    A. Yes. These cups are make to exact industry cup standard. All style of standard lids will fit. This includes coffee lids, soda lids, and frappuccino lids.

 

Risks:

- Users and Customers fail to accepts or reject the system. Solution to this is a highly effective marketing campaign and creating a culture around the concept. Customer and user surveys will continuously be used.

- The business model fails to produce sustainable revenue. Solution is great metrics and a stellar operations to ensure maximum efficiencies and constant adjustment of costs and charges to continuously maintain an increase in revenue. An outstanding COO will be essential here.

- Big name competition enters the market. Solution is to work aggressively to pre-position ourselves to meet this challenge. This includes rapid expansion, marketing, follow-ship, culture, sponsorship and funding. When the competition enters, we must be ready to out compete them to maintain a large share of the market in DC.

Challenges:

- The stainless steel cups fail to meet the expectations that they are durable and can sustain multiple use cycles. Solution will to be monitor the cup endurance early and assess the situation. If needed then alternate cups will be researched and purchased to replace the stainless steel cups.

- The cleaning process fails to meet expectations causing the customer and user to reject the reuse cups, especially over the course of time. Solution is to monitor and assess the cleaning process early and identify problem areas and work rapidly to remedy the situation. The stainless steel cups were chosen because of their great clean-ability and durability.

story:
This September the United Nations Climate Summit is being held in NYC. The people are holding their own summit and march and I need your help to be there!

I feel deeply called to take a stand on Climate Justice and Environmental Justice for our water, land, animals, people most effected by climate change, indigenous, poor, and future generations.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise 600 hundred dollars to purchase a round trip flight from Tucson to NYC, for the summit.

  • A unique perk I am offering for your support is a post card I'm having printed of a beautiful Tucson Sunset. It's a picture I took this past winter. I will send you a personal message of inspiration and courage.
  •  Also I am offering you a chance to be part of independent media. I will being doing live moment to moment coverage of the event via my personal Facebook and Twitter sites
  • If I don't reach the 600 hundred dollar goal on indiegogo, and only raise a portion of the money required. I will reach out for loan or trade to supportive people in my life for the rest. And while the work I do doesn't pay much I am sure I can contribute 100 -150 myself!

The Impact

 This impact of our collective efforts are the only ways we've seen change in this world, and your support is part of that collective effort for a better future.

 

Other ways you can help include getting the word out! Share the video attached here! Start talking in your home and with your neighbors about sustainability of water, food, fossil fuel use, and corporate decisions that effect your communities and their future! If you don't know what those decisions are start asking and find out!
 

Thank you so much for your giving what you can - every dollar makes a difference

story:
My name is Christopher (Krzysztof in Polish) and I am putting together this campaign to help an inventor in Niagara Falls, called Bruce McBurney,  to get enough funding for him to create a prototype of a 100 mpg carburetor.

I have known Bruce for over two years and in the past few months I have been helping him with his website and in converting his book into an ebook (Kindle and epub) format.

I have read the book that Bruce wrote - The Super High Mileage Report - and was impressed with how clear it was in describing why the various high mileage vehicles that have been created in the last 80 years were getting such outrageously high miles per gallon compared to what vehicles get these days. He also writes about others who claim to get  5 times the regular mileage.

Bruce's information when converted into a working prototype will save the consumer thousands of dollars and will take away money from the oil interests and the government (due to the high percentage of revenue from every gallon/liter that goes to the government in the form of taxes).

Anyone can take Bruce's book, read it, understand that this is possible but very few could then make their own super high mileage carburetor fuel system too. It is fairly complex as history has proven and it would take a fair bit of investment hence this campaign to raise the monies to build one to demonstrate the feasibility and get this information out to the world.

To help Bruce achieve this goal various bonuses are provided for different levels of contributions. The main one is the Compensator which is a kit that costs $150 (+ shipping) for either regular or V8 size. If we can get over 230 of these units sold then we would have met our target. It is understandable though the some people may not have the monies to give. Which is why the other bonuses are provided. Hopefully there is something for everyone's budget.

The biggest benefit for getting the Compensator is its ability to cut down up to 75% of the emissions coming out of the tailpipe. The mileage gains are up to 25 % depending on engine and wear factors.

Another benefit of this campaign is making people aware of the fact that cutting emissions is actually very simple. The reason that this invention has not been taken up by the various car manufacturers is that the automotive industry makes money on engine tune ups and repairs which the Compensator cuts down on substantially.

We hope that you will contribute in some way and we would also like you to pass this campaign on to your family members and friends. The more people that know about this the better for everyone, the environment and the world.

Thank you for looking.

Bruce's website is http://www.himacresearch.com  where he has assembled  an amazing amount of information which is shared for free so that we can all know about this. Please help also by sharing his website with all your family and friends.

You can download a pdf and have a look at an article here on the Compensator (actually a paid ad that gives testimonials from various locals – best viewed at 200% zoom level) from 2004 and read what people say about it. Strike a blow against suppression by passing this info on to family and friends!

Since there were not enough perk spots available (max of 12 via this site), if you want the CD on the HEFS system or the CD with 900 patents on it please let us know at the email below and we will send you an invoice for $30 +SH and send it out to you after you pay it.

[Note: Please send emails if you get bonuses that are PDFs as we need your email address to get these to you. The email to send us your email address is bruce@redstorm7.com.]

story:
Peliti, a Greek non-profit organization for the saving of traditional seeds, is building its Seed House.

Το Πελίτι, μια μη κερδοσκοπική οργάνωση για τη διάσωση των παραδοσιακών σπόρων,
χτίζει το σπίτι τών σπόρων.

Peliti's Seed House will serve as the guardian of a part of peliti's traditional Seeds Collection,
It will also be an exhibition place for seeds, offering an educational space for young and older, as well as a seedbed for dreams.
The Seed House is located in Mesohori, a village near Paranesti, 38 km from Drama, North East Greece.

In 1995, Panagiotis Sainatoudis, the founder of Peliti (www.petiti.gr), walked and hitch hiked all over Greece, collecting seeds of traditional varieties in order to prevent them from disappearance.

After 20 years, Peliti has extended its network to 15 local teams throughout Greece plus one in Sofia, Bulgaria.

Besides, seeds have been freely distributed to more than 150,000 farmers and growers.

The first Peliti Pan-Hellenic Seed Exchange Festival took place in 1999 and since then it's been growing every year.

The 2013 Festival has been declared by the Australian organization "Seed Savers" as "the largest Seed Exchange in the World".

https://www.youtube.com/watch?list=PLlS7wiwl7yw2DnyI1fUad4gtUIDWmfs1P&v=zqC1sMpGHDM

In April 2014, An International Solidarity Caravan for Seeds has left the land of Peliti, Greece, to reach Kokopelli headquarters in France. The caravan was organized by:

Peliti,www.peliti.gr

Seed Freedom http://seedfreedom.info

Navdanya http:///www.navdanya.org

and Kokopelli https://kokopelli-semences.fr

http://www.peliti.gr/images/pdf/2014/caravan/Solidarity_Caravan_for_Seeds_eng.pdf

In 2009, Panagiotis Sainatoudis was granted the Price "Guardian of the Biodiversity of the Mediterranean" by Bioversity International and the Town Hall of Rome, Italy.

http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=335%3Apagosmiadiakrisi&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=el

In 2014, The President of the Greek Democracy, Mr Karolos Papoulias, honored Peliti for its volounteer work.

http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=367%3Anisidespoiotitpas&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=el

In January 2015, Panagiotis had a personal meeting with the Orthodox Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomeos to discuss the importance of seeds.

Στο σπίτι των σπόρων θα φυλάσσουμε ένα μέρος από τη συλλογή παραδοσιακών ποικιλιών του Πελίτι.

Θα εκθέτουμε ένα άλλο μέρος των σπόρων και θα είναι ένας χώρος εκπαίδευσης για μικρούς και μεγάλους αλλά και ένα σπορείο ονείρων.

Το σπίτι των σπόρων βρίσκετε στο Μεσοχώρι Παρανεστίου,38 χιλιόμετρα απο τη Δράμα στη Βορειανατολική Ελλάδα,

Το 1995,ο Παναγιώτης Σαινατούδης,ο ιδρυτής του Πελίτι (www.petiti.gr) περπάτησε και έκανε ωτο-στόπ σ' ένα μεγάλο μέρος  της Ελλάδας, μαζεύοντας σπόρους απο παραδοσιακές ποικιλίες για να  τους προστατεύσει απο την εξαφάνιση.

Μετα απο 20 χρόνια (1995-2015),το Πελίτι εχει επεκτείνει το δίκτυο του σε 15 τοπικές ομάδες στην Ελλάδα και μια στη Σόφια της Βουλγαρίας.

Εκτός αυτού το Πελίτι έχει διανείμει δωρεάν σπόρους σε περισσότερους απο 150.000 καλλιεργητές.

Το 1999 το Πελίτι διοργάνωσε το πρώτο πανελλήνιο φεστιβάλ ανταλλαγής σπόρων κι απο τότε καθε χρονο γίνεται όλο και μεγαλύτερο.

Το Φεστιβάλ του 2013 έχει χαρακτηριστεί απο την οργάνωση της Αυστραλία seed savers ως το μεγαλύτερο φεστιβάλ ανταλλαγής σπόρων στό κόσμο.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?list=PLlS7wiwl7yw2DnyI1fUad4gtUIDWmfs1P&v=zqC1sMpGHDM

Τον Απρίλη του 2014 ξεκίνησε απο τη γή του Πελίτι το πρώτο διεθνές καραβάνι για την ελευθερία των σπόρων, με προορισμό το kokopelli την αντίστοιχη οργάνωση για τους σπόρους στη Γαλλία.Το καραβάνι οργανώθηκε απο τις παρακάτω οργανώσεις

Peliti,www.peliti.gr

Seed Freedom http://seedfreedom.info

Navdanya http:///www.navdanya.org

and Kokopelli https://kokopelli-semences.fr

http://www.peliti.gr/images/pdf/2014/caravan/Solidarity_Caravan_for_Seeds_eng.pdf

Το 2009 ο Παναγιώτης Σαινατούδης κέρδισε το βραβείο τού "φύλακα της βιοποικιλότητα της Μεσογείου" απο τη Bioversity International  και το δημαρχείο της Ρώμης στην Ιταλία.

http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=335%3Apagosmiadiakrisi&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=el

Το 2014 ο Πρόεδρος της Δημοκρατίας κ.Κάρολος Παπούλιας βράβευσε το Πελίτι για την εθελοντική του προσφορά.

http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=367%3Anisidespoiotitpas&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=el

Το 2015 ο Παναγιώτης είχε προσωπική συνάντηση με τον Οικουμενικό Ορθόδοξο Πατριάρχη Βαρθολομαίο,για να συζητήσουν τη σπουδαιότητα του θέματος τών σπόρων.

http://www.peliti.gr/images/pdf/2014/caravan/Solidarity_Caravan_for_Seeds_eng.pdf
In 2009, Panagiotis Sainatoudis was granted the Price "Guardian of the Biodiversity of the Mediterranean" by Bioversity International and the Town Hall of Rome, Italy.
http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=335%3Apagosmiadiakrisi&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=el
In 2014, The President of the Greek Democracy, Mr Karolos Papoulias, honored Peliti for its volounteer work.
http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=367%3Anisidespoiotitpas&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=el
In January 2015, Panagiotis had a personal meeting with the Orthodox Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomeos to discuss the importance of seeds.
Στο σπίτι των σπόρων θα φυλάσσουμε ένα μέρος από τη συλλογή
παραδοσιακών ποικιλιών του Πελίτι.
Θα εκθέτουμε ένα άλλο μέρος των σπόρων και θα είναι ένας
χώρος εκπαίδευσης για μικρούς και μεγάλους αλλά και ένα σπορείο ονείρων. 
Το σπίτι των σπόρων βρίσκετε
 στο Μεσοχώρι Παρανεστίου,38 χιλιόμετρα απο τη Δράμα στη Βορειανατολική Ελλάδα,Το 1995,ο Παναγιώτης Σαινατούδης,ο ιδρυτής του Πελίτι (www.petiti.gr) περπάτησε και έκανε ωτο-στόπ 

σ' ένα μεγάλο μέρος  της Ελλάδας, μαζεύοντας σπόρους απο παραδοσιακές ποικιλίες για να  τους προστατεύσει απο την εξαφάνιση.Μετα απο 20 χρόνια (1995-2015),το Πελίτι εχει επεκτείνει το δίκτυο του σε 15 τοπικές ομάδες στην Ελλάδα και μια στη Σόφια της Βουλγαρίας.Εκτός αυτού το Πελίτι έχει διανείμει δωρεάν σπόρους σε περισσότερους απο 150.000 καλλιεργητές.Το 1999 το Πελίτι διοργάνωσε το πρώτο πανελλήνιο φεστιβάλ ανταλλαγής σπόρων κι απο τότε καθε χρονο γίνεται όλο και μεγαλύτερο.Το Φεστιβάλ του 2013 έχει χαρακτηριστεί
απο την οργάνωση της Αυστραλία seed savers ως το μεγαλύτερο φεστιβάλ ανταλλαγής σπόρων στό κόσμο.https://www.youtube.com/watch?list=PLlS7wiwl7yw2DnyI1fUad4gtUIDWmfs1P&v=zqC1sMpGHDMΤον Απρίλη του 2014 ξεκίνησε απο τη γή του Πελίτι το πρώτο διεθνές καραβάνι για την ελευθερία των σπόρων, με προορισμό το kokopelli την αντίστοιχη οργάνωση για τους σπόρους στη Γαλλία.Το καραβάνι οργανώθηκε απο τις παρακάτω οργανώσειςPeliti,www.peliti.grSeed Freedom http://seedfreedom.infoNavdanya http:///www.navdanya.organd Kokopelli https://kokopelli-semences.frhttp://www.peliti.gr/images/pdf/2014/caravan/Solidarity_Caravan_for_Seeds_eng.pdfΤο 2009 ο Παναγιώτης Σαινατούδης κέρδισε το βραβείο τού "φύλακα της βιοποικιλότητα της Μεσογείου" απο τη Bioversity International  και το δημαρχείο της Ρώμης στην Ιταλία.http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=335%3Apagosmiadiakrisi&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=elΤο 2014 ο Πρόεδρος της Δημοκρατίας κ.Κάρολος Παπούλιας βράβευσε το Πελίτι για την εθελοντική του προσφορά.http://www.peliti.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=367%3Anisidespoiotitpas&catid=118%3Adiakrisis&Itemid=119&lang=elΤο 2015 ο Παναγιώτης είχε προσωπική συνάντηση με τον Οικουμενικό Ορθόδοξο Πατριάρχη Βαρθολομαίο,για να συζητήσουν τη σπουδαιότητα του θέματος τών σπόρων.

story:
Solar and Wind Solutions LLC is committed to providing alternative energy to people across America. Our latest project, that we have been dreaming about, and planning on for years, is a solar farm in Arizona. We are finally ready to put it into action and we need your help! 


What? 

A 25MW system that will supply 30,000 homes in Arizona for 25 years or more without any degradation to the planet's environment and with zero health issues related to burning carbon based fossil fuels.

How?

At this time we are raising funds to purchase and/or lease land in Arizona to develop our solar farm. We are seeking $850,000 in order to accomplish the 1st stages of our project. With this amount we can create a platform for a 25MW system, ultimately we plan to expand this project to a 100MW sized project.

Initial costs will be related to planning and architecture, civil engineer, labor, and negotiations between the local municipalities, utilities and our project. 

By creating this smaller project we would be able to support and sustain expansion costs via the buyback of our clean and renewable energy source to local municipalities and utilities for a fraction of the cost. Thereby these municipalities and utilities won't have to use as many counterproductive carbon based fossil fuels in our environment.

Why?

The successful completion of this project will mean cleaner air and less fossil fuel usage for an overall greener and cleaner planet. Your contribution to this project will be the first step in making this happen. 

Help us in our goal to: 

  • Stop global warming.
  • Stop using all pollution causing fuels (oil, coal, gas and nuclear).
  • Start to give our future generations, our kids and grand-kids, a chance to breath clean air.
  • Start using renewable energy like solar and wind which will be available and renewable for many, many, millennia and will never be a problem for nature or mankind.  

We need to act now, together, to ensure that inaction does not triumph over positive action to move towards renewable energy and end human-induced climate change. As Secretary of State John Kerry says, ""Those who deny the science or choose excuses over action are playing with fire," he said. "Once again, the science grows clearer, the case grows more compelling, and the costs of inaction grow beyond anything that anyone with conscience or common sense should be willing to even contemplate."

Our Dream...

After the expansion we plan to start solar projects in Haiti and other developing countries that bring FREE electricity to schools, hospitals and homes. Our dream and vision is that the whole world uses renewable energy which will make our environment and world a lot better, safer, and cleaner. Energy should NOT be a luxury of the rich countries. The sun, wind and waves belongs to everybody on this planet. 

Who are we?

Solar and Wind Solutions LLC provides alternative energy solutions and planning services for residences and corporate entities throughout North America, South America, and Canada. Visit us at www.800solarwind.com

Mr. Kallin and Mr. Smith, Co-Founders; 

Before founding Logos Selecta INC, and, Solar and Wind Solutions LLC, Mr.
Kallin and Mr. Smith worked in the technical data field, (Mainframe, and web based Computer systems, in the financial sector). We have a combined 60+ years in this computer database system area. After sharing similar stories and concerns over the impact of fossil fuels in our environment, we found that we had mutual concerns. Realizing that we had this commonality we decided to begin a partnership that would have a positive impact on our environment, and future, hence was born Logos Selecta INC, now called Solar and Wind Solutions LLC, (this name is more descriptive as to what we do).

We have been working together for the last 5 years and in that time, with a staff of engineers, system designers, and marketing specialist, have consulted on projects from the very small (Self sustaining golf carts that run completely from solar power and never stops), to large scale solar projects that are estimated to be able to put out multi-megawatt capacities, enough to run small communities. In our experience we feel that this process is a little slow. After much consideration we determined that it would be best to do a large scale project that would have an immediate impact on our community's health and well being, by developing a large scale solar project as quickly as possible in order to lessen polluting fuels in our environment.

In order to accomplish this goal we would appreciate your help. Not only will you receive a wonderful gift for your efforts and contributions but also you'll receive the gift of a longer and healthier life for generations to come.
 

Thank You

Like our project? Pass it on!

In order for this project to be succesful we need your help! Give to our campaign and share our project with your friends, family and associates. Together we can create a cleaner, healthier and safer environment for generations to come. 

Like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter. Start a conversation with us and pass it on. We really appreciate it.

story:
What it's about

"Cloud forests are nature's 'water towers,' providing billions of gallons of fresh, clean, filtered water. They are home to thousands of indigenous peoples, and storehouses of biodiversity, at least 80 percent of which has not yet been catalogued.

Yet in as little as ten years' time, biologists warn, the world's cloud forests—evergreen mountain forests that are almost permanently shrouded in mist and clouds—may be all but gone." National Geographic

I design gardens. I love to design a garden that makes someone feel more connected to nature and to beauty. It is becoming more and more important that gardens, in doing this, also help the environment, and help the community. 

In the winter, work slows down and I have about 4 weeks to learn something new, volunteer, and bring back fresh ideas and understanding to work. This year I want to volunteer at La Hesperia Nature Preserve in Ecuador, helping with habitat restoration. 

Seeing how the different elements of a natural environment work together is hard to do in NYC. But in the cloud forest of Ecuador, I'll be working in one of the most biologically diverse areas on earth. The effect that human activity has on the habitat will be very clear, and human solutions to the problems created will be very interesting to learn about first-hand.

I want to be able to offer my clents and the community more and more knowledge and skill in designing environments that are beautiful and also sustainable. I love to learn by doing. I also love to learn from other people who are passionate to be good stewards of the land where they live.

Why $2,600

Here is where the money will go:

*$700 airfare NYC-Quito 

*$350 car from home to airport, from airport to hotel, from hotel to La Hesperia (roundtrip)

*$300 hotel two nights. The volunteer orientation occurs in Quito on only Mondays & Wednesdays, to show up on time I'll need to arrive the night before. To leave, I may need to stay over in Quito again to catch my flight on time.

*$300 fee to volunteer for 2 weeks at La Hesperia, including the application fee

*$100 shots needed for the trip (Hepatitis, Typhoid, etc)

*$650 sleeping bag, backpack, raingear, rainboots, work gloves, flashlight, mosquito net, binoculars, notebook, books, workboots, camera

*$200 meals, toiletries, tips

If I don't reach my entire goal, that portion I do receive will go toward the trip at a later date.

Perks

*$25--I'll send you a postcard from Ecuador!

*$100--I'll plant a tree for you, and put together a miniature photo album of your tree, its genus & species, and its location on a map

*$2,000--if you're in NYC, Boston, DC or Baltimore, I'll do a design plan of your garden based on a municipal site survey. I'll do the design after the trip to Ecuador, and include things I learned on that trip in your garden design!

Making better gardens

When gardens are designed with beauty, the community, and the environment in mind, they are truly good gardens. First-hand understanding of ecosystems helps a garden designer identify and respond to their own environment more effectively and responsibly.

Better gardens make better cities. The more gardens can help absorb stormwater, for example, the less sewage washes into the rivers around cities (as happened during Hurricane Sandy, and every other major storm).

I've designed many gardens over the past 11 years, including intensive greenroofs, which capture stormwater. Doing garden design work with a clientele who are more and more interested in sustainable practices creates a great opportunity to have a really positive impact, on a lot of different levels!

Thanks!

Please let others know about my volunteer trip to the cloud forest. You can use the Indiegogo share tools if you'd like to let others know about my trip.

Thank you so much for reading about my project!!

story:
Whales in Canada Need your help!

Help these incredible animals, and receive a TAX RECEIPT!!

The waters of the Pacific Northwest are home to a wide variety of majestic marine mammal species. Among these are the iconic Killer whales (or Orcas) that people travel from around the globe to have a chance to glimpse in their natural environment. Killer whales are highly intelligent, extremely social and undeniably charismatic but unfortunately they are also still very much at risk. There are fewer than 90 individual killer whales left in the Southern resident population (frequently seen around Victoria and Northern Washington).  

Although once feared and grossly misunderstood, killer whales began to capture our hearts during the 1970’s when they began to show up in marine parks around the world. Unfortunately there are still many killer whales facing life in captivity but there has been a definite shift in public perception of these living conditions and many people now opt to seek out experiences with these animals in the wild.

We are blessed to have a chance to see these incredible beings in their natural environment but with increased shipping traffic and underwater noise, decreased salmon stocks and concerns around accumulated toxins, their natural environment is becoming increasingly challenging for them to live in. 

If we want to protect this beautiful, iconic yet fragile species it’s imperative that we do all we can to decrease current pressures that these animals are facing. We do not want to have to explain to our grandchildren that this incredible, intelligent black and white whale that used to exist off our coast is no longer there because our generation didn’t care enough to protect them. 

Who We are

Cetus is a non-profit, charitable society based in Victoria BC. Since 2005 we have been working to facilitate the conservation of the marine environment through a variety of programs. One of our main programs is called Straitwatch and is an on-the-water monitoring and education program which helps to minimize disturbances to killer whales and other marine mammals.

Southern resident (fish-eating) killer whales are listed as endangered under the Canada Species at Risk Act (SARA) with fewer than 90 animals in the entire population. Research has demonstrated that killer whales show avoidance behaviour in the presence of vessels, and that whale responses to vessel presence and/or sound may include ceasing of feeding, resting and social interaction. Because of these impacts, federal guidelines have been developed to minimize disturbances while still allowing boaters to view these majestic animals in their natural environment.  The Straitwatch program helps to ensure that these guidelines are understood and adhered to.  

For the past ten years the Straitwatch program has received a significant portion of its funding from Environment Canada’s Habitat Stewardship Program. This year our federal government funding was not approved. As a result we were forced to take our vessels off the water for all of August and September. This is the busiest time of year for both boats and whales and since our boats have been tied up we have received reports almost daily of concerning incidents happening around the whales. These reports only help to reinforce the need for our program!

Without the government funding that we have relied heavily on since our inception, we are concerned about our ability to move forward as a society and to continue to provide this vital monitoring and education in future years. This is where you can help to make a huge difference in the lives of these killer whales!

What we need:

Cetus is an incredibly efficient organization run by a team of unbelievably dedicated and passionate board members, staff, interns and volunteers.

 - If we are able to raise $300 000 we are confident that we can provide   another full season of monitoring and education both in the waters around Victoria and in the waters around Northern Vancouver Island which are home to the threatened population of Northern Resident killer whales.

- If we are able to raise even a portion of this amount, we will use this money to keep our organization going, to continue our community outreach programs and to provide at least partial monitoring throughout the summer.

- The 300,000 goes towards fuel, moorage and essentail maintenace for our vessles, as well as 8 full time (some seasonal) employees (in 2 different locations) to be out there providing the education and looking out for the whales best interests. 

Your generous donation to our cause will help minimize potential disturbances around our iconic killer whales and other marine life, increase public awareness of these animals and the threats they face and promote respect and understanding of the marine environment. You can also receive some exciting perks by donating to us. These include a beautiful art card, Cetus Society cozy toques, and even a day on our monitoring vessel! Donations over $50 in this campaign are eligible for tax receipts. 

Other ways you can help!

If you are unable to make a financial contribution to our campaign you can still help make a big difference! Please consider helping out in the following ways::

  • Spreading the word about our campaign through email, Facebook, or other social media;
  •  “Liking” us on Facebook;
  • Attending one of our up and coming fundraising events in Victoria, BC which you can read more about on our Facebook page;
  • Writing to your local MP to express your support for projects such as ours.

story:
Please Help The Honey Bees !!

My name is Francesca Hatzopoulos, 

I have been involved with bee keeping for a few years as a hobbiest and have been drawn to the Honey Bee on an unbelievable level. Bee'ing around these magnificent creatures is just awesome!!

I need your help to raise healthy and robust hives to pollinate our farm lands in California nd through out the United States. It is not easy work and the bees are not able to survuve on thier own. Please visit my website for information on the horrible epidemic that is going on in regards to the honey bees. www.beelovedinc.com 

California alone depends 100% on honey bees just for our almond farms. We are not able to meet the amount of bees needed to have a succeful pollination season.

I am hopeing with your help to be able to conquer the epidemic. I would like to be the one, people call on if they need any help with the honey bee. Call me the ultimate QUEEN BEE. 

I and the honey bees have a very long and hopefull road ahead of us. Any amount contributed will bee greatly appreciated. The perks will be well worth your kindness.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!!

We are always looking for like minded people and bee keepers that want to help out with this cause in any capacity you may bring...

As always, Bee Loved, Bee Happy.
story_txt:
Please Help The Honey Bees !!
My name is Francesca Hatzopoulos, 
I have been involved with bee keeping for a few years as a hobbiest and have been drawn to the Honey Bee on an unbelievable level. Bee'ing around these magnificent creatures is just awesome!!
I need your help to raise healthy and robust hives to pollinate our farm lands in California nd through out the United States. It is not easy work and the bees are not able to survuve on thier own. Please visit my website for information on the horrible epidemic that is going on in regards to the honey bees. www.beelovedinc.com 
California alone depends 100% on honey bees just for our almond farms. We are not able to meet the amount of bees needed to have a succeful pollination season.
I am hopeing with your help to be able to conquer the epidemic. I would like to be the one, people call on if they need any help with the honey bee. Call me the ultimate QUEEN BEE. 
I and the honey bees have a very long and hopefull road ahead of us. Any amount contributed will bee greatly appreciated. The perks will be well worth your kindness.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!!
We are always looking for like minded people and bee keepers that want to help out with this cause in any capacity you may bring...
As always, Bee Loved, Bee Happy.

story:
Who are we?

We are middle school students at Lesher International Baccalaureate (IB) World Middle School in Fort Collins, Colorado.  We applied for and were accepted into an Extended Learning Opportunity focused on sustainability.  One of the many treats we experience as a part of the service learning class is a trip to Catalina Environmental Leadership Program (CELP) in California from November 7-12, 2014. Part of being an IB student is striving to be knowledgeable, open-minded, inquirers, principled, balanced, reflective, and caring.  We hope to practice all of these characteristics while running this campaign and on Catalina Island.

What we're doing?

This unique, high-energy learning experience gives us what we cannot find in a classroom: a chance to study natural ecosystems and sustainable living firsthand and hands on. We learn about sustainable living practices such as composting, recycling, and organic gardening, discovering how nature provides perfect examples of communities functioning in a self-sustaining way.  There are 25 students going on the trip along with 3 teachers from our school.  9 of us are participating in this campaign. 

Part of the learning experience will be creating, managing, and fulfilling the perks we offer here.   Running a campaign like this as middle school students (with some help from adults) will be so valuable as we learn to become project managers and will help us throughout our lives.   Learning to be grateful for your help, and sharing what we have learned with you and others is equally important.  Last but not least, we want to pay it forward by teaching others small things that make a huge impact on the planet!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The hard costs for each student are $746.  All of our money for the trip is due by the end of October.  We are running a very short 15-day campaign so please donate today. 

  1. airfare $280
  2. ground transportation $80
  3. ferry $60
  4. camp fees  $276
  5. +misc. spending money for food and activities $50 

  • Our goal is to raise $350 per student participating or $3150. Our stretch goal is $6714, and of course we're gonna GO FOR IT, but we wanted to set an achievable goal. 

  • Depending on your level of support, supporters will...
  • Have their names printed on the back of our t-shirts.  This is a great way to honor your child and give a small donation in their name or challenge your fellow students from high school or college to make a donation. It's only $10! OR
  • Receive a hand-written postcard from Catalina Island sharing what we have learned, OR
  • Receive a special thank you photo of our group at Catalina Island matted and signed by all the students.   Great for individuals or small businesses! OR
  • Attend a reception where we share what we have learned and describe our plan to pay it forward. OR
  • Receive a Elementary Education Session.  A short presentation reviewing 3 simple ways to live a more sustainable life appropriate for kids ages 5-11.  You may choose the group receiving the session (girl scouts, church group, after school club) or we will coordinate for you.  We already have a list of classrooms ready for us! This is a great way to share our knowledge and encourage & inspire younger kids to make smart sustainable choices. OR
  • Have a  tree planted on the Lesher Middle School campus with a plaque honoring your name or business name.


  • If we don't reach our goal, the money we DO raise will go towards the trip and we will brainstorm for new fundraising ideas.
  • If we exceed our stretch goal, we will help supplement costs for other students or teachers or will contribute to a fund to establish scholarships for next year.
  • If you have  a specific student that you would like to help, you may do that by putting the student's name in the "2nd address" section.  And, of course, you can donate to the shared fund as well. 
  • We also have a goal of 25 campaign shares in the first week.  Please help us make that happen by using the share features within this campaign.


Students Participating

  • Matthew Pappas
  • Cleo Anderson
  • Madeline Koepsell
  • Josh Birlingmair
  • Lily Carmichael
  • Sarah Way
  • Carly Rockwell
  • Keegan Seidl
  • Dagan Genson

************************************************************

If you are supporting a specific student, please make note of that in your perk donation in the "2nd address line" of your mailing address.    If no name is listed, we will be happy to see the group fund grow.  Group or specific, perks are from the entire Catalina Kids crew!  If you have any questions before or after your donation, don't hesitate to email us.  

*************************************************************************


Social Change & Leadership Skills

As middle school students we are working to build both social change and leadership skills through this program. 
 "Research shows that the foundation to both of these begin during the transformative years in adolescence and greatly impact the long term impact these have on individuals for the rest of their lives."

    "Extensive studies provide enough evidence to conclude that adolescents can be developed as Leaders if required traits are identified and appropriate environment is created for nurturing such adolescents. Various theories have been propounded by scholars and researchers for developing leadership.  It is our strong belief that this is an excellent program for enhancing the development of these core leadership traits in these students.  The following graphic showcases the four C's of Leadership that will be enhanced through participation in this program."


    So What are Our Risks?

    • This campaign is different.  
    • It is NOT just about the money. 
    • Its about the process of creating the campaign, working as a team, cherishing the opportunity to build leadership skills, and sharing how grateful we are for your support in a meaningful way. 
    •  We are learning to ask for help which is harder than we thought.  Its hard to put ourselves out there and take this risk. 

    • What if we fail?    What if people don't see this as a valuable cause? 

    •  If we don't raise the money needed we will have to put our brains together and problem solve.  
    • In some ways, that wouldn't be a failure, there would be learning there too!  

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We know that some of you reading this know us and know the program, and some of you are learning about us for the first time.  We would love and appreciate your financial support.  However, your willingness to share our story with those around you is just as meaningful in some ways.  

      • Please help us the share tool from this campaign

story:
Bonjour à tous!

Le but de ce projet est très simple: la solidarité internationale!!!!

En effet, nous irons au Nicaragua, avec l’organisme Mer et Monde et dans le cadre du programme Québec sans frontières. Mer et Monde a pour mission de favoriser la solidarité entre les personnes et les peuples, en encourageant l’émergence d’un réseau d’artisans, ayant la justice comme balises à un engagement citoyen responsable, à moyen et à long terme. [http://www.monde.ca/]

Nous vous demandons aujourd'hui de vous arrêter quelques instants, pour ainsi comprendre la grande importance de votre implication dans notre projet. Ce sont des gens comme vous, et nous, qui peuvent contribuer à faire une différence, et ce, par de tout petits gestes!!!!! 

 

Qui? : Neuf stagiaires et un accompagnateur membres de l’organisme de coopération internationale Mer et Monde, en partenariat avec l’association nicaraguayenne Tierra y Vida et le ministère des Relations internationales et de la Francophonie du Québec.   

Où? : Dans la communauté de Calishuate, département de Carazo au Nicaragua.

Quand? : Deux mois et demi au cours de l’été 2015 au Nicaragua, suite à six fins de semaine de formation intensive réparties sur huit mois au Québec.

Quoi? : Appuyer l’association Tierra y Vida dans un projet visant l’augmentation durable de la production et de la consommation de produits agrobiologiques. La mission de cette association est de soutenir les organisations de paysans et les familles vulnérables, en mettant l’emphase sur les jeunes et les femmes, dans l’adoption de pratiques agrobiologiques dans leurs systèmes de production et dans l’amélioration du commerce local de produits sains.

[https://www.facebook.com/AsociacionTierraYVida]

Comment? : Notre rôle de stagiaire consistera à soutenir l’initiative locale en agrobiologie. À cet effet, nous serons appelés à :

• Monter une campagne de sensibilisation et de promotion d’une production agricole saine, autant pour l’environnement que pour l’alimentation.

• Créer du matériel et des outils pédagogiques portant sur l’agriculture biologique.

• Offrir un appui technique sur le terrain (caractérisation des sols) 

• Élaborer des mécanismes de mise en marché pour les productions agricoles

• Mettre en place une méthode de suivi de la progression de la production des fermes agrobiologiques de la région 

Ce sont ces objectifs qui justifient notre volonté d'amasser 10 000$. Tout l'argent amassé ira directement pour le développement de l'agriculture biologique soit par le biais de notre engagement envers l'association d'agriculteurs avec qui nous travaillerons et prévoit également un fonds pour l'amélioration de la communauté de Calishuate. 

Votre participation? : Nous sollicitons votre collaboration dans le développement de ce projet solidaire. Un don aiderait grandement au succès de notre stage! 1$, 5$, 10$, il n'y a pas de petit don, parce que tout geste compte pour nous et pour la communauté d'agriculteurs de Calishuate! 

Sachez que votre don fera l'objet d'un catalyseur à l'amélioration de la qualité de vie d’une population vulnérable, mandat dont nous nous portons garants, et que ce sont les petits gestes qui en inspirent des plus grands. Merci beaucoup d'avoir pris le temps :)

 Nous sollicitons aussi votre aide dans le partage de cette campagne! Aidez-nous à répandre l'importance de la solidarité internationale :)

story:
I am raising money for the start up materials needed to practice bee keeping. Honey bee colonies are collapsing at an alarming rate. I would like to create a safe haven for some local bees where they can be nurtured & live a healthy, substasinable life, & where they can use their bee magic to help out local gardens.

I have been wanting to start a hive for the last 4-5 years. I have been reading up on bee keeping, researching different methods, & I attended a bee keeping class in 2013. I've lacked the space to set up a hive, time to manage a hive, confidence to take on this journey, & funds. I have remedied all of those factors except the funds part. 

I am currently enrolled in an 8 week bee keeping class through the Worcester County Bee Keepers where I am also a member. I will be keeping a hive at 55. I have become better at time management & allowing more time for my hobbies. I have matured as a lady & this bee keeping journey no longer seems too tough to handle. I'm channeling my inner queen Bey.

I wish to raise bees primarily to do my part to save them & help prevent their decline. In a few years, if my hive(s) thrive I would love to be able to harvest honey but that is not my main goal. Although i do love honey for it's nutritional benefits, health benefits, & longevity, bee's honey belongs to them. Bees spend their lives working & making that liquid gold. It would be a bit evil to just steal it. Imagine if you worked your wings off every day & everything you made, in return, went to the hypothetical (wo)man! These bees & I are going to coexist peacefully & hopefully with a mutual respect.


The $500 dollars is a rough estimate of what it will take to set up a functional hive this spring. Here is a quick breakdown:

*10 frame bee hive starter kit- around $280 

*protective clothing & tools- around $150

****there is also the option, instead of the above, for an "ultimate hive starter kit" which includes the hive starter & the clothing/tools for $489

Then comes the most important part, the bees! 

Starter bees from either a nuc or 3 lbs of bees- $150




Any funds raised that exceed the limit will go towards student loans. Just kidding, they'll go towards extra bee supplies :)

story:
▶ Πάτα εδώ για να διαβάσεις το κείμενο στα ελληνικά
▶ Leer aqui el texto en castellano

From Austerity to Abundance

Greece is home to heroes and goddesses, mythical creatures and jeweled beaches, damn fine olives, and the most sun-kissed skin in Europe. While the recent coverage from Greece has been about scarcity, austerity and converging crises, it has failed to cast a shadow over a country that is abundant in a powerful and ancient source of hope: the Sun.

Co-Creating a Brighter Future

With energy poverty being one of the most dramatic symptoms of the Greek crisis (6 out of 10 households are struggling to pay their energy bills), investing in the abundant sun, the country’s biggest asset, will be key to a Greek recovery. The solarization of the country will put money back in real people’s pockets by reducing their energy bills, it will put people back to work with new skills and opportunities, and it will support a renewable energy revolution that is sweeping the globe.

How do we start?

We are going to start from the beautiful island of Rhodes, also know as “The Island of the Sun”.  With your support, we want to utilize the island’s most generous energy source and install as many solar panels as possible onto households that live on the brink of energy poverty.

Why Rhodes? Because hundreds of millions of Euros are wasted every year importing expensive oil for its power generation, because people living there continue to face serious energy shortages and because worse still, a new oil power plant is under construction. So this island is where the fight for Greece’s energy future is most visible.

How is this going to help Greece?

Today powering the islands with oil costs all Greek consumers some 800 million Euros in subsidies each year. For every panel we install, a household will get a significant boost to their family income from lowering electricity bills, but at the same time Greek consumers will pay less in oil subsidies and Greece will save money from less imported oil.

And why stop there? If we can make this project a success, we can use it to kickstart the solarization of the Greek economy (and beyond!) and save billions of Euros that can then be used where they’re needed most.

So we invite you to write together the next Greek story, one rooftop at a time!

Additional information: 

When will the installations happen?

As soon as the crowdfunding campaign ends and we know the total amount of money raised, we will choose the best offer from contractors in order to begin the installations as soon as possible. We are already working with local communities on Rhodes, to look for the most suitable buildings focusing on low-income households.

Have you done this before?

Greenpeace Greece has recently completed successfully 3 similar projects. Last year we installed solar panels in two households in Rhodes and earlier this year we installed solar panels and heat pumps in a shelter for orphans that couldn’t afford heating during the winter. Additionally, a couple of years ago we retrofitted a school at a mountainous Greek village by insulating the walls, installing new window double-glazing frames and replacing the oil heater with a biomass one. All of these projects were fully funded by people.

communities on Rhodes, to look for the most suitable buildings focusing on
low-income households.
Have you done this before?
Greenpeace Greece has recently completed successfully 3
similar projects. Last year we installed solar panels in two households
in Rhodes and earlier this year we installed solar panels and heat pumps in a
shelter for orphans that couldn’t afford heating during the winter. Additionally,
a couple of years ago we retrofitted a school at a mountainous Greek village by
insulating the walls, installing new window double-glazing frames and replacing
the oil heater with a biomass one. All of these projects were fully funded by
people.

story:
The Southern Resident Killer Whales are Starving 

Four dams on the lower Snake River kill the salmon that orca whales rely on. Removing them saves money, orcas, and salmon.

  • The creators of Dammed to Extinction have been asked to present at Big Sky TEDx
  • This is an ideal time to spread the message behind this award winning film to a large and relevant audience: Free the Snake River to save orcas and salmon
  • TEDx rules don't allow for speaker payments, so the filmmakers need your help to craft the presentation, edit the required footage and still photos, and spend a week on location rehearsing

Dammed to Extinction was directed by Michael Peterson and written by Steven Hawley. The film is an award winning call to free the lower Snake River in time to save salmon and the Southern Resident Orcas that rely on them. 

A professionally edited version of the talk will be added to the TED YouTube channel, the channel has 15.5 million subscribers.

With your help, Michael and Steven can prepare and execute a presentation with an impact that reaches far beyond the Big Sky TEDx walls. Help them share this vitally important message.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Michael and Steven need $5,000 to put together a presentation worthy of this cause. In return, your contribution lands you some great prizes, like a signed movie poster, DVDs, BluRays, and even the book that inspired the film!

 

The Impact

The economics are as clear as the environmental issues: These dams must be removed. But changing hearts and minds is a longer process. Help us capitalize on the momentum generated by Dammed to Extinction by spreading this message at Big Sky TEDx and beyond

story:
What is Earth Day SF?

This unique celebration packs a powerful green get-together, filled with entertainment & education, into one full day of fun and excitement for all ages.

Designed to support the Bay Area Community and beyond, Earth Day San Francisco focuses on acknowledging the local and planetary environmental challenges we all face, and inviting the public to integrate sustainable practices into their everyday lives.

Why Do We Need Your Support?

While some progress has been made in the past four decades towards creating environmental awareness and action, today the issues are more urgent then ever, as evidenced by critical threats such as climate change, species extinction and the growing toxic threat of chemicals all around us.

Earth Day San Francisco 2013, which happens on April 20th. 2013, is more than just an annual event. This year’s festival is designed to bring together leading members of the green/sustainability movement to co-create a vision of how we address the multitude of environmental issues we face. 

What We Need

Funds will go to the permits and production, for the Main Earth Day SF Stage & Performers ($5,000).

What You Get

Speakers, workshop leaders, nonprofit organizations, businesses, indigenous community leaders, civic agencies, musicians, and youth empowerment groups are invited to use this high-profile event to educate and activate the public to energetically pursue effective green solutions to pressing environmental issues.

The festival also serves as a spring board for individual and group actions as well as long-term strategic planning, and includes some of the most prominent green educators and organizers in the country, as well as a host of powerful musicians...Together we seek to encourage the public to actively pursue Earth-friendly solutions and to empower the sustainability movement to grow and thrive worldwide. E.D.S.F is dedicated to providing the tools and inspiration to bring together our diverse communities as One Green Voice.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools, as well!

Video production by: Andre Champagne - Earth Day SF Media Dir. & Founder of the Transbay Fest

Narration by: Jessica Jane Robinson AKA "Recycle Woman"
