story:
ICARUS: Falling of Birds
A collaborative art book project with

 Photographs by Thaddeus Holownia + Poetry by Harry Thurston

On the night of September 13th, 2013, a flock of songbirds on their migratory journey south were attracted, “like moths to a flame,”  to a hundred-foot-high flare at the Canaport Liquefied Natural Gas plant in Saint John, New Brunswick.  The result was tragic, with 7,500 to 10,000 birds of twenty-six species—mostly wood warblers, including the endangered Canada Warbler—being killed by the heat.  In 2015 Canaport LNG accepted full responsibility for the bird mortality and were fined $750,000 under the Migratory Birds Convention Act and the Species at Risk Act.

This event forms the basis for a long eco-poem[i]  Icarus, Falling of Birds.  The myth of Icarus, who flew too close to the sun, serves as a metaphor to examine our relationship with the natural world, in particular our use of fossil fuels, the source of global warming that threatens not only natural systems but civilization itself.  

The poem will be published as a book with high quality full colour stochastic reproductions of the photographs by Thaddeus Holownia.  Design by award winning and long time collaborator Robert Tombs.   


[i]“Ecopoetry is nature poetry that has designs on us, that imagines changing the ways we think, feel about, and live and act in the world… By showing us also that some things must go (dams, oil rigs, plastic bags, animal concentration camps, virtual disconnectedness), ecopoetry doesn’t supplant nature poetry but enlarges it.” In  “Why Ecopoetry? There’s no Planet B,” by John Shoptaw. http://www.poetryfoundation.org/poetrymagazine/...


PERKS : A CHOICE OF IMAGES OF EGG PHOTOGRAPHS FROM OVA AVES  (a previous book HOLOWNIA/THURSTON collaboration) Each is archivally matted and framed.

PERK FROM OVA AVES   #1                       UNKNOWN 

PERK FROM OVA AVES   #2                      OSPREY

PERK FROM OVA AVES   #3                       NORTHERN HARRIER

  

PERK FROM OVA AVES   #4                     KILLDEER




PERK  - THE COMPLETE SET OF SILVER GHOST NOTECARDS + ENVELOPES




PERK - COMPLETE SET OF WALDEN POND TREE POSTCARDS

about, and live and act in the world… By showing us also that some things must
go (dams, oil rigs, plastic bags, animal concentration camps, virtual
disconnectedness), ecopoetry doesn’t supplant nature poetry but enlarges it.” In
 “Why Ecopoetry? There’s no
Planet B,” by John Shoptaw. http://www.poetryfoundation.org/poetrymagazine/...

PERKS : A CHOICE OF IMAGES OF EGG PHOTOGRAPHS FROM OVA AVES  (a previous book HOLOWNIA/THURSTON collaboration) Each is archivally matted and framed.

PERK FROM OVA AVES   #1                       UNKNOWN 


PERK FROM OVA AVES   #2                      OSPREY


PERK FROM OVA AVES   #3                       NORTHERN HARRIER


  
PERK FROM OVA AVES   #4                     KILLDEER



PERK  - THE COMPLETE SET OF SILVER GHOST NOTECARDS + ENVELOPES







PERK - COMPLETE SET OF WALDEN POND TREE POSTCARDS

story:
CLIQUEZ ICI POUR LA VERSION FRANÇAISE!

 

Awards

Who's talking about ROOTS?

 

 

 

 

Why we created ROOTS?

 

The growth of the word population already poses space problems in most conventional cemeteries in many countries. In Japan, notably, even is cremation is obligatory, the vaults at maximum capacity force us to think of innovative solutions to how ashes are disposed.

Furthermore, traditional funeral rites are being singled out because of their negative impact on the environment. A 10 acre cemetery can contain 1,000 tons of metal, 20 000 tons of cement (vaults) enough wood from coffins to build 40 houses and the equivalence of an in-ground pool of toxic liquid used for embalming.

And in the end, everyone dreams of immortality. To leave his/her trace. To perpetuate life.

No more was required to create ROOTS!

Design

ROOTS pays tribute with beauty and elegance because of its sober and refined design.

With every extraordinary thing that we accomplish in life, why should we satisfy ourselves with a mediocre or ordinary product while it is possible to combine esthetics and ecology?

ROOTS is currently registered for the 11th edition of the GRANDS PRIX DU DESIGN, the most important design contest in Québec awarding the best creations in design.

 

Ecological

ROOTS, both made from post-consumer matter as well as entirely natural materials is certified by the Green Burial Council as a green funeral product. That makes us extremely proud!

The Green Burial Council is the environmental certification organization setting the standard for green burial in North America.

The fertiliser stick that is provided, combined with the new material made of coffee and lime that we created, will neutralise the high pH levels of the ashes and encourage the growth of the tree once planted.

The use of post-consumer coffee grounds honours the sustainable development values of our company. Furthermore, its reutilisation is highly symbolic of the cycle of life.

A tree that really grows!

Each ROOTS urn will contain 3 different species of trees free of charge.

 

Efficient!

Our proven and highly effective planting system will allow for the inside planting of the tree in order to maximise its germination and growth. We even guarantee its germination (*certain conditions apply).

This ensures that you have the possibility of starting the planting process regardless of the season and the time of death.

 

Versatile!

While we highly recommend starting the planting process of the tree inside, ROOTS can respond to many needs:

  • It could be planted directly in the ground
  • It could be used simply as an ecological urn for those who do not wish to grow a tree.
  • It could be buried separately from the tree. If you own a lot in a conventional cemetery, you can bury the urn there and plant the tree in another location that is significant to you.

 

 

How it works

 

The basic idea is to be able to feel the presence of the loved one in the important moments that we will live without him/her: the first celebration, first Christmas, first vacation, etc.

Mourning is a difficult process and the hope created by the tree that is beginning to grow symbolizes life that continues.

After a couple of months, when the tree is big enough, one can choose the appropriate moment to bury the urn and the tree in the ground.

This way, the pace of the mourning process, which is different for each person, is respected.

 

Team and R&D

With the help of a highly talented professional team, including industrial designers and a teacher-researcher who holds a Ph.D in horticulture, we worked on developing ROOTS for close to two years.

During the research and development phase, close to one hundred natural and safe materials have been tested in order to ensure the growth of a tree. These materials were chosen because of their capacity for biodegradability and their strength. Many horticultural research projects were developed and many plans elaborated to ultimately create the sober, clean and functional design of this urn.    

We have invested time, energy and money to develop the best possible product, one that brings together design, sustainable development and an efficient and versatile planting system. We truly believe that we have succeeded, besides the fact that we greatly enjoyed this journey!

 

Our story … and that of Roots

The seed had been planted for a long time!

This project is part of phase 2 of our company, Muses Design Urns, which already sells contemporary funeral urns made in cooperation with artists/designers.

The original sparkle ignited when my father-in-law died, almost 20 years ago. No funeral product could truly suit his unique, inspiring and original personality! Therefore, we decided to have one of his cabinetmaker friends build a gorgeous urn. Jacques also has a tree planted in the country making his presence felt with us whenever we go.

There you have it! Jacques’ urn and tree are behind ROOTS !

 

Partners

Thank you to our financial partners without whom the research and development would not have led to this much innovation!

 

Collaborators

 

Why encourage us and

to what purpose your financing will be used

 

For a small business, launching a new product can be very costly, especially when a lot of money has already been invested in R&D. To be able to bring ROOTS to markets, we need you. You are our dragons!

Investing in our crowdfunding campaign means participating in a great business endeavour. Moreover, you will not only be contributing personally, but you will also join a collective effort to transform our cemeteries into forests.

In order to start the production of Roots, which will be totally local in order to respect the very essence of the product and the sustainable development value that is dear to Muses Design Urns, we need $15,000. This amount will allow us, among other things, to purchase the moulds to launch the first production of this new product and bring it to the market.

 

Our social involvement

 

On top of valuing sustainable development and local as well as fair trade, Muses Design Urns strongly believes in social involvement.

Since we want to give back to our community, the 10 first ROOTS urns will be donated to the J’Allume une étoile Foundation. They will be for families who have lost a baby.

Muses also gives the equivalent of 1% of its sales to families in need by giving them urns for free.

 

Timeline

 

Counterparts

The more you give, the more you receive.

See of rewards description below.

 

 

Risks and challenges

 

Every new project has its challenges. Even more so if we develop a new product and create a new material!

If you have any questions, we will gladly answer them. You can contact us at info@musesdesign.com

Moulding of coffee and lime

The material we have developed is optimal for the growth of a tree, but it is very difficult to mould. We worked all summer long to finalize the recipe and the moulding process. We had the support of the Centre de transfert technologique en écologie industrielle in Sorel for advice. The use of metal moulds for the production was obvious in order to provide a high-quality product with a standardized production.

Layering the seeds

We faced other challenges for the seeds. Before planting indoors, the seeds used cannot be in dormancy. Therefore we need to either:

  • pick a tree whose seeds are not in dormancy
  • ask the supplier to break dormancy (in which case the seeds have to be planted right away)
  • break dormancy at home (certain seeds need up to 90 days of layering in the fridge). Not very useful for our purposes …!

We chose a seed that is not dormant in order to facilitate fast sprouting and planting in any season. For the time being, the selection is narrow, but we continue our research.

Exporting seeds abroad is also challenging. We are working to find the best solution, in order to allow Roots to travel as far as possible.

 

Thank you!

Thanks to our supporters and contributors. Your participation is important and greatly appreciated!

 

Share!

Whether you are a financial partner or not, you can always help us by sharing our project with your networks. That is what social media platforms are for!

Talk about it to your friends and family.

Obviously, sharing a funeral product is not as appealing as a video about cats, but you could write something like: “I don’t plan on dying anytime soon, I am not ready to become a tree just yet, but I do support the birth of an innovative project: ROOTS .”

 

VERSION FRANÇAISE

 

PRÉSENTATION DU PROJET

 

Notre mission est simple : offrir la plus belle et innovante urne funéraire écologique qui se transforme en arbre.

Que ce soit pour la naissance, un mariage ou pour ou un décès, planter un arbre est un hommage à la vie. C’est un geste symbolique qui consolide nos racines. Quelle belle façon écologique de perpétuer la vie !

Avec ROOTS :

  • Le cycle de la vie se renouvelle;
  • Les cimetières se transforment en forêt;
  • Le deuil est accompagné d’espoir et la mémoire devient une présence vivante;
  • Vous optez un produit écologique sans faire de compromis sur l’esthétique.

 

Prix :

Qui parle de ROOTS ?

 

 

Pourquoi avoir créé ROOTS ?

 

La croissance de la population mondiale pose déjà un problème d’espace dans les cimetières conventionnels, et ce dans plusieurs pays. Au Japon, en autres, même si la crémation est obligatoire, les voutes au maximum de leur capacité nous obligent à réfléchir à des solutions innovatrices pour disposer des cendres.

D’autre part, les rites funéraires traditionnels sont de plus pointés du doigt en raison de leur impact négatif sur l’environnement. Un cimetière de 10 acres peut contenir 1 000 tonnes de métal, 20 000 tonnes de béton (voûtes), assez de bois provenant des cercueils pour construire 40 maisons et l’équivalent d’une piscine creusée en liquides toxiques servant à l’embaumement.

Et finalement, tout le monde rêve d’immortalité. De laisser sa trace. De perpétuer la vie.

Il n’en fallait pas plus pour créer ROOTS !

Design

ROOTS rend hommage avec beauté et élégance par son design sobre et épuré.

Avec tout ce que nous accomplissons d’extraordinaire dans la vie, pourquoi faudrait-il se contenter de produit médiocre ou ordinaire alors que c’est possible d’allier écologie et esthétisme?

ROOTS est actuellement inscrite à la 11e  édition des GRANDS PRIX DU DESIGN, le plus important concours québécois récompensant les meilleures réalisations en design.

 

Écologique

ROOTS, fabriquée à la fois de matière post-consommation et de matériaux entièrement naturels est certifiée produit funéraire vert par le Green Burial Council et nous en sommes très fiers !

Le Green Burial Council est l’organisme de certification environnementale qui établit les normes pour l’inhumation verte en Amérique du Nord.

 

Le bâtonnet d’engrais fourni combiné au nouveau matériau à base de café et chaux que nous avons inventé, permettront de neutraliser le pH élevé des cendres et de favoriser la croissance de l’arbre une fois en terre.

 

L’utilisation de marc de café post consommation fait honneur aux valeurs de développement durable de notre entreprise. De plus, son réemploi est hautement symbolique du cycle de la vie.

Un arbre qui pousse vraiment !

Chaque urne ROOTS contiendra gracieusement 3 essences d’arbres différentes.

 

Efficace !

Notre système de plantation performant et éprouvé permet de débuter la plantation de l’arbre à l’intérieur afin de maximiser sa germination et sa croissance.

Nous garantissons même la germination.  (*certaines conditions s’appliquent)

De cette façon vous avec la possibilité débuter la plantation peu importe la saison ou le moment du décès.

 

Polyvalent !

Bien que nous suggérions fortement de débuter la plantation de l’arbre à l’intérieur, ROOTS peut répondre à différents besoins :

  • Elle pourrait être plantée directement en terre.
  • Elle pourrait être utilisée simplement comme urne écologique pour ceux qui ne veulent pas nécessairement faire pousser un arbre
  • Elle peut être inhumée séparément de l’arbre. Si vous avez un lot dans un cimetière conventionnel, vous pourriez inhumer l’urne au cimetière et planter l’arbre dans un endroit significatif pour vous.

 

Comment ça fonctionne

 

L’idée de départ est de pouvoir sentir la présence de l’être cher dans les premiers moments importants que nous vivrons sans lui; la première fête, le premier Noël, les premières vacances...

Le deuil est un processus difficile et l’espoir créer par l’arbre qui amorce sa croissance symbolise la vie continue.

Après quelques mois, lorsque l’arbre est suffisamment grand, chacun peut choisir le moment propice pour aller mettre l’urne et l’arbre en terre.

On respecte ainsi le rythme du processus de deuil, qui est différent pour tous.

 

Équipe et R&D

 

Avec une équipe hautement talentueuse et professionnelle, incluant des designers industriels et une professeur-chercheure détenant un Ph.D en horticulture, nous avons travaillé pendant près de 2 ans au développement de ROOTS .

Au cours de la phase de recherche et développement, une centaine de matériaux naturels et inoffensifs assurant la bonne croissance d’un arbre ont été créés et testés, entre autres, pour leur rythme de biodégradabilité et leur solidité. Plusieurs recherches horticoles ont été conduites et que dire du nombre de plans qui ont été élaborés pour arriver au design sobre, épuré et fonctionnel de cette urne !

Nous avons investi temps, énergie et argent pour arriver à développer le meilleur produit possible qui allie design, développement durable et un système de plantation efficace et polyvalent. Nous croyons sincèrement avoir réussi et nous avons eu énormément de plaisir tout au long de cette aventure !

 

Notre Histoire… et celle de ROOTS

 

Il y a longtemps que cette idée germe !

Ce projet s’inscrit en fait dans la 2e phase de notre entreprise, Muses Urnes Design, qui propose déjà des urnes funéraires contemporaines produites en collaboration avec des artistes/designers. 

Le désir de créer cette entreprise, au départ, faisait suite au décès de mon beau-père il y presque 20 ans. Aucun produit funéraire ne pouvait représenter sa personnalité unique, inspirante et anticonformiste! Nous avons donc fait fabriquer une urne magnifique par un de ses amis ébénistes. Jacques a aussi son arbre hommage à la campagne qui nous permet de sentir sa présence quand nous y allons. 

Voilà ! L’urne et l’arbre de Jacques sont à l’origine de ROOTS !

 

Partenaires

Merci à nos partenaires financiers sans qui la recherche et développement n’aurait pas permis tant d’innovation !

 

Collaborateurs

 

Pourquoi nous encourager

et à quoi servira le financement

 

Le lancement d’un nouveau produit pour une petite entreprise peut s’avérer très couteux, surtout quand des sommes considérables ont été investies dans la R&D. Pour arriver à mettre en marché ROOTS, nous avons besoin de vous. Vous êtes nos dragons !

Participer à notre campagne de socio financement, c’est participer à la réalisation d’une belle aventure entrepreneuriale. De plus, non seulement vous contribuerez personnellement, mais vous participerez collectivement à transformer les cimetières en forêt.

Pour lancer la production de ROOTS, qui sera entièrement locale afin de respecter l’essence du produit et les valeurs de développement durable de Muses Urnes Design, nous avons besoin de 15 000$ CAN. Cette somme permettra, entre autres, l’achat des moules pour lancer la première production et la mise en marché de ce nouveau produit.

 

Notre implication sociale

 

Au-delà des valeurs de développement durable et de commerce local et équitable, Muses Urnes Design croit beaucoup à l’implication sociale.

Et comme nous voulons redonner à la communauté, les 10 premières urnes ROOTS seront offertes à la Fondation J’allume une étoile. Elles seront destinées à des familles qui ont perdu un bébé.

Muses remet également l’équivalent de 1% de ses ventes en offrant gratuitement des urnes à des familles dans le besoin.

 

Ligne de temps

 

 

Contreparties

 

Plus vous contribuez, plus vous recevez !

Voir plus bas la description de chacune des récompenses.

 

 

Risques et défis

 

Tout nouveau projet comporte des défis. Le développement d’un produit avec la création d’un nouveau matériau encore plus !

Si vous avez des questions, il nous fera plaisir d’y répondre. Vous pouvez nous rejoindre à info@musesdesign.com

Le moulage du café et de la chaux

Le matériau que nous avons créé est optimal pour la croissance de l’arbre, mais il est très difficile à mouler. Nous avons travaillé tout l’été à l’optimisation de la recette et des procédés de moulage. Nous avons eu recours aux conseils du Centre de transfert technologique en écologie industrielle de Sorel. L’utilisation des moules en métal pour la fabrication s’est imposée d’elle-même. Nous aurons ainsi un produit de haute qualité dont la production sera uniformisée.

Stratification des semences

Autres défis du côté des semences. Afin de débuter la plantation à l’intérieur, les semences utilisées ne doivent pas être en dormance. Pour ce faire, il faut soit :

  • choisir des essences d’arbre dont les semences ne sont pas dormantes
  • faire lever la dormance par le fournisseur de semences (auquel cas elles doivent être semées immédiatement)
  • lever la dormance à la maison. (Certaines essences demandent jusqu’à 90 jours de stratification au réfrigérateur.) Pas très pratique pour notre concept… !

Nous avons donc opté pour des essences non dormantes afin de maximiser la germination rapide et la plantation, peu importe la saison. Pour l’instant la sélection relativement restreinte, mais nous poursuivons nos recherches.

L’exportation des semences à l’étranger peut poser également son lot de contraintes. Nous travaillons actuellement à trouver la solution idéale, afin de pouvoir faire voyager ROOTS le plus loin possible !

 

Merci !

Merci à tous nos supporteurs et à nos contributeurs. Votre participation est vraiment importante et appréciée !

 

Partager !

Que vous participiez financièrement ou non, vous pouvez toujours nous aider en partageant ce projet dans votre réseau. Les réseaux sociaux, c’est un peu fait pour ça !

Parlez-en à vos amis, votre famille.

C’est certain que partager des trucs funéraires ce n’est pas aussi mignon que les p’tits vidéos de chats, mais vous pourriez écrire : «Je n’ai pas l’intention de mourir bientôt, je ne suis pas prêt à devenir un arbre maintenant mais je supporte la naissance d’un projet innovateur qui prend racine : ROOTS ».

ROOTS, fabriquée à la fois de matière post-consommation et de matériaux entièrement naturels est certifiée produit funéraire vert par le Green Burial Council et nous en sommes très fiers !
Le Green Burial Council est l’organisme de certification environnementale qui établit les normes pour l’inhumation verte en Amérique du Nord.
 


Le bâtonnet d’engrais fourni combiné au nouveau matériau à base de café et chaux que nous avons inventé, permettront de neutraliser le pH élevé des cendres et de favoriser la croissance de l’arbre une fois en terre.
 
 L’utilisation de marc de café post consommation fait honneur aux valeurs de développement durable de notre entreprise. De plus, son réemploi est hautement symbolique du cycle de la vie.

Un arbre qui pousse vraiment !
Chaque urne ROOTS contiendra gracieusement 3 essences d’arbres différentes.
 
Efficace !
Notre système de plantation performant et éprouvé permet de débuter la plantation de l’arbre à l’intérieur afin de maximiser sa germination et sa croissance.
Nous garantissons même la germination.  (*certaines conditions s’appliquent)
De cette façon vous avec la possibilité débuter la plantation peu importe la saison ou le moment du décès.
 
Polyvalent !
Bien que nous suggérions fortement de débuter la plantation de l’arbre à l’intérieur, ROOTS peut répondre à différents besoins :

Elle pourrait être plantée directement en terre.
Elle pourrait être utilisée simplement comme urne écologique pour ceux qui ne veulent pas nécessairement faire pousser un arbre
Elle peut être inhumée séparément de l’arbre. Si vous avez un lot dans un cimetière conventionnel, vous pourriez inhumer l’urne au cimetière et planter l’arbre dans un endroit significatif pour vous.


 
Comment ça fonctionne
 
L’idée de départ est de pouvoir sentir la présence de l’être cher dans les premiers moments importants que nous vivrons sans lui; la première fête, le premier Noël, les premières vacances...
Le deuil est un processus difficile et l’espoir créer par l’arbre qui amorce sa croissance symbolise la vie continue.
 Après quelques mois, lorsque l’arbre est suffisamment grand, chacun peut choisir le moment propice pour aller mettre l’urne et l’arbre en terre.
On respecte ainsi le rythme du processus de deuil, qui est différent pour tous.


 
Équipe et R&D
 
Avec une équipe hautement talentueuse et professionnelle, incluant des designers industriels et une professeur-chercheure détenant un Ph.D en horticulture, nous avons travaillé pendant près de 2 ans au développement de ROOTS .

Au cours de la phase de recherche et développement, une centaine de matériaux naturels et inoffensifs assurant la bonne croissance d’un arbre ont été créés et testés, entre autres, pour leur rythme de biodégradabilité et leur solidité. Plusieurs recherches horticoles ont été conduites et que dire du nombre de plans qui ont été élaborés pour arriver au design sobre, épuré et fonctionnel de cette urne !
Nous avons investi temps, énergie et argent pour arriver à développer le meilleur produit possible qui allie design, développement durable et un système de plantation efficace et polyvalent. Nous croyons sincèrement avoir réussi et nous avons eu énormément de plaisir tout au long de cette aventure !

 

Notre Histoire… et celle de ROOTS
 
Il y a longtemps que cette idée germe !
Ce projet s’inscrit en fait dans la 2e phase de notre entreprise, Muses Urnes Design, qui propose déjà des urnes funéraires contemporaines produites en collaboration avec des artistes/designers. 
Le désir de créer cette entreprise, au départ, faisait suite au décès de mon beau-père il y presque 20 ans. Aucun produit funéraire ne pouvait représenter sa personnalité unique, inspirante et anticonformiste! Nous avons donc fait fabriquer une urne magnifique par un de ses amis ébénistes. Jacques a aussi son arbre hommage à la campagne qui nous permet de sentir sa présence quand nous y allons. 
Voilà ! L’urne et l’arbre de Jacques sont à l’origine de ROOTS !

 
Partenaires 

Merci à nos partenaires financiers sans qui la recherche et développement n’aurait pas permis tant d’innovation !

 
Collaborateurs

 
Pourquoi nous encourager
et à quoi servira le financement
 
Le lancement d’un nouveau produit pour une petite entreprise peut s’avérer très couteux, surtout quand des sommes considérables ont été investies dans la R&D. Pour arriver à mettre en marché ROOTS, nous avons besoin de vous. Vous êtes nos dragons !
Participer à notre campagne de socio financement, c’est participer à la réalisation d’une belle aventure entrepreneuriale. De plus, non seulement vous contribuerez personnellement, mais vous participerez collectivement à transformer les cimetières en forêt.
Pour lancer la production de ROOTS, qui sera entièrement locale afin de respecter l’essence du produit et les valeurs de développement durable de Muses Urnes Design, nous avons besoin de 15 000$ CAN. Cette somme permettra, entre autres, l’achat des moules pour lancer la première production et la mise en marché de ce nouveau produit.
 
Notre implication sociale
 
Au-delà des valeurs de développement durable et de commerce local et équitable, Muses Urnes Design croit beaucoup à l’implication sociale.
Et comme nous voulons redonner à la communauté, les 10 premières urnes ROOTS seront offertes à la Fondation J’allume une étoile. Elles seront destinées à des familles qui ont perdu un bébé.
Muses remet également l’équivalent de 1% de ses ventes en offrant gratuitement des urnes à des familles dans le besoin.
 
Ligne de temps
 

 
Contreparties
 
Plus vous contribuez, plus vous recevez !
Voir plus bas la description de chacune des récompenses.

 

 
Risques et défis
 
Tout nouveau projet comporte des défis. Le développement d’un produit avec la création d’un nouveau matériau encore plus !
Si vous avez des questions, il nous fera plaisir d’y répondre. Vous pouvez nous rejoindre à info@musesdesign.com
Le moulage du café et de la chaux
Le matériau que nous avons créé est optimal pour la croissance de l’arbre, mais il est très difficile à mouler. Nous avons travaillé tout l’été à l’optimisation de la recette et des procédés de moulage. Nous avons eu recours aux conseils du Centre de transfert technologique en écologie industrielle de Sorel. L’utilisation des moules en métal pour la fabrication s’est imposée d’elle-même. Nous aurons ainsi un produit de haute qualité dont la production sera uniformisée.
Stratification des semences 
Autres défis du côté des semences. Afin de débuter la plantation à l’intérieur, les semences utilisées ne doivent pas être en dormance. Pour ce faire, il faut soit :

choisir des essences d’arbre dont les semences ne sont pas dormantes
faire lever la dormance par le fournisseur de semences (auquel cas elles doivent être semées immédiatement)
lever la dormance à la maison. (Certaines essences demandent jusqu’à 90 jours de stratification au réfrigérateur.) Pas très pratique pour notre concept… !

Nous avons donc opté pour des essences non dormantes afin de maximiser la germination rapide et la plantation, peu importe la saison. Pour l’instant la sélection relativement restreinte, mais nous poursuivons nos recherches.
L’exportation des semences à l’étranger peut poser également son lot de contraintes. Nous travaillons actuellement à trouver la solution idéale, afin de pouvoir faire voyager ROOTS le plus loin possible !
 
Merci !
Merci à tous nos supporteurs et à nos contributeurs. Votre participation est vraiment importante et appréciée !
 
Partager !
Que vous participiez financièrement ou non, vous pouvez toujours nous aider en partageant ce projet dans votre réseau. Les réseaux sociaux, c’est un peu fait pour ça !
Parlez-en à vos amis, votre famille.
C’est certain que partager des trucs funéraires ce n’est pas aussi mignon que les p’tits vidéos de chats, mais vous pourriez écrire : «Je n’ai pas l’intention de mourir bientôt, je ne suis pas prêt à devenir un arbre maintenant mais je supporte la naissance d’un projet innovateur qui prend racine : ROOTS ».

story:
Personal introduction:

My name is Cyril Derreumaux. I am French and American living in California, father of two absolutely amazing boys. I am also a 39-year old dreamer-doer. All my life I have followed my intuitions and my “guts”, taking the opportunities as they came along. Whether it be on my professional or personal life, the challenges that I overcame have crafted through time a can-do attitude, problem solving skills, and a huge ambition. I am passionate with everything I undertake.

In one month, I will be crossing part of the Pacific Ocean in a 24-foot Rowing Boat, from California to Hawaii.

Here is my personal website: www.SuchaBlast.com

Objectives:

1.  Personal and local impact: I want my adventure to be a source of inspiration for other dreamers to follow their dreams, no matter what they might be, and make them happen. As part of my endeavor, before departure, I am speaking to 1,200 students from 7 to 12 years old in local schools.

2.  Global and worldwide impact: 20% of your donations will be given to 1001 fountains. http://www.1001fontaines.com/en/approach. During our row, we will be using a watermaker unit that filters the salt out of the ocean waters. We would not be able to have drinkable water without those filters. Similarly, I want to support 1001 fountains, a non-profit installing filtering devices in rural regions, delivering drinkable water to populations that would not have access to it.

3.  Longer term: In the process of this row, I have been inspired to create a personal coaching website www.cdxpro.com that aims to enable people to achieve their own extraordinary goals. The aim of this website is to truly help people live their ambitions

The Challenge:

Starting in Monterey, California on June 4th, 2016, we will row as part of a race and should arrive around July 14th in Honolulu, Hawaii.

This endeavor will be part of a race where 10 other crews are signed up to participate.

Different categories will be registered: 4-men/women/mix crew, 2men/women, in both the “classic” and “open” categories.

The website of the race: www.greatpacificrace.com (this is where you will be able to follow our crew on the GPS every day, with newsletter etc.)

Introduction of the Dream-team:

This amazing adventure, in a 4-men crew, should take about 40 to 45 days, rowing shifts of 2-hours, all day, all night.

Our crew is composed of myself (French), Fiann (Iceland), Carlo (USA) and Thiago (Brasil), and we are team Uniting Nations.

 Our crew is aiming as beating the current world record of 43 days in our category (Classic Ocean Rowing boats), and we trained appropriately to get the Guinness World Record!

The website of our crew: www.unitingnationsrow.com

Where did this project come from?

I have participated in several ultra-endurance races:

·  4 times the Catalina Outrigger Challenge (a 5-hour, 32-mile outrigger canoe race from Catalina to Newport Beach),

·  4 times the Molokai Hoe (a 6-hour, 43-mile outrigger canoe race from Molokai to Oahu),

·  the Cal100 (a 12-hour, 100-mile Canoe down the Sacramento river),

·  the Yukon River Quest (a 45-hour, 444-mile Canoe race down the Yukon River in Canada).

Now I want to push even more my personal limits and I will not shy away from the biggest physical, emotional and mental challenge of my life.

In the process of pushing my own limits, I want people to see that with the proper effort, perseverance, will and discipline, anything is possible.

“I’m just a normal guy doing extra-ordinary things, and you can too!”

The Budget:

The total budget for this rowing adventure is $25,000.

·  The rental fees for the boat (pay-per-seat) and the registration fee for the race total $20,000.

·  The nutrition for 60 days, the gears and the return flight total $5,000.

I want to raise $5,000 for the 1001 fountains non-profit

I have self-financed 10,000$, so I am looking to raise 20,000$ on this Indiegogo campaign.

Why am I passionate about this row, and committed to making it happen? 

I have worked hard to make this dream happen: I studied safety and survival at sea, learned about navigation in ocean waters, first aid and CPR, VHF radio communication, electricity set-ups on a boat, created a website, taught myself to row, built a training vessel out of a fishing boat (added a sliding seat and tulip oars), trained up to 45+ hours per month for 3 years, researched and studied optimal nutrition in ultra-endurance endeavors, I haven’t had any vacation for 2 years so I could take 2 months off work, moved out of my apartment to relocate in a houseboat where I could train every day, pushed my own limits of comfort so I would be ready (trained in high winds, rain, cold, dark nights), held a rigorous budget to be able to save money, put the team together…

Learn more:

My Personal website: www.suchablast.com

The website of my crew “Team Uniting Nations”: www.unitingnationsrow.com

The website of the race to track our boat on the GPS: www.GreatPacificRace.com

Email: info@suchablast.com

PLEASE SUPPORT ME BY DONATING WHAT YOU CAN TO MY ENDEAVOR, AND PROVING ONCE MORE, THAT ANYTHING IN THIS WORLD CAN COME TRUE, IF YOU ONLY  HAVE THE INDOMITABLE WILL TO MAKE IT HAPPEN.

story:
Short Summary

I'm Polly Alford, CEO and Founder of ReefCI.  After years of grinding it out with a large, multinational corporation, I followed my heart and relocated to Belize to open a conservation organization.  Selling my home and using my life's savings, I founded Reef Conservation International, ReefCI, a registered Belizean Non-Profit organization.  

An avid diver and PADI Instructor, I created a unique program in which ReefCI's multifaceted conservation efforts could be shared and experienced by everyone from professionals to students to tourists. 

By exposing more people to the beauty of our oceans and reefs and educating them on the importance of keeping them healthy and alive, we are creating a strong community of advocates who will help insure the ocean and it's many creatures and inhabitants will continue to provide sustenance, income and enjoyment for generations to come.  

While ReefCI has many important initiatives, none in recent years is more critical than the eradication of the Lionfish. 

The Lionfish invasion is arguably the worst marine disaster in history! Not native to Caribbean waters, Lionfish were first spotted in Belize in 2009, and they have multiplied at frightening rates ever since.  They have no natural enemies and are systematically killing off key species of fish, crustaceans and coral.  

No other organization in Belize has done more to address the Lionfish problem than ReefCI.  

Unless we wish to face a natural disaster from which we can never recover, the extinction of fish species and the death of the second largest barrier reef in the world, we must expand our efforts now.  

Our needs are financial and without your support, we will be faced with the harsh reality of being unable to continue. With your support, we can go on. We can educate more people and expand the efforts in Belize and other parts of the Caribbean and the United States.  With your support, we will save the beautiful ocean and reef for our children and their children and the generations beyond.  

What We Need & What You Get

The number one expense for ReefCI is the maintenance and running of our boats.  Fuel is very pricey and our engines are old and inefficient.

To replace the old engines with new, fuel and energy efficient 4-stroke 250 Yamaha's, we need to raise $50,000 US.  Reaching this level of funding will be sufficient to allow us to continue our efforts in a manner similar to what we are doing today.  

If we are able to raise more money, we can invest in relocating our business from Punta Gorda to Placencia where we will realize incredible savings in fuel by being 17 miles closer to the reef and our operations based in the Sapodilla Cayes Marine Reserve.  

Additionally, with more funding, we can purchase much needed equipment such as spears, fish bags, dive gear and tanks.  On the island, solar power energy and an additional compressor could be purchased and some upgrades to the property could be realized.  While our accommodation is clean and basic, small improvements would be helpful in attracting more and more people to our program. 

If we do not reach our goal of $50,000 or more, we will use whatever funds we have to replace an engine at a time and continue to look for ways to operate in the bootstrapping method we've always employed.  We will do this, but time is of the essence and the Lionfish problem is growing rapidly.  Please consider helping us move more quickly by giving today.  

If you choose to help, we will have some great benefits and perks available!  Please see perks for detail.

The Impact

Lionfish are indigenous in the Indio Pacific oceans and the Red Sea but not the Atlantic-Caribbean belt.  In their natural environment, they have a diet that is not a threat, and they have natural predators.  However, In the Atlantic and Caribbean oceans, they are feeding on species that are key to our environment such as juvenile wrasse, parrotfish, and crustaceans.  Lionfish are voracious predators and can consume huge percentages of juvenile fish recruits.  And, they breed rapidly releasing around 20,000 eggs every 4 days!
Our coral reefs and oceans have an important role in the world economy and in world health. Over 42 million people make their living from the coral reefs primarily through fishing and tourism.  If the reef dies, what will happen?  Additionally, commercially important species will reduce or disappear making the price of fish skyrocket for everyone.  This could easily force fisherman out of business and create the need for millions of people to alter the way they eat and their primary sources of protein.  
But, it's not just the fishermen who are in danger.  With no fish or reef, there will be no divers and far fewer tourists.  Diving alone is a $2.1 billion business in the Caribbean.  Hotels, restaurants, dive operations, and other tourist attractions will close and local economies will tank.  
A single Lionfish may reduce the number of juvenile native fish on any given reef by approximately 79% in just 5 weeks!  Removing 20 Lionfish on a single dive equates to saving approximately 300,000 juvenile fish over a one-year period.  ReefCI, on average, removes 50 Lionfish on every dive, and we can multiply that with each diver we educate and teach to help.
Additionally, ReefCI has been instrumental in teaching local restaurants the value of putting Lionfish on the menu.  They are delicious and, by creating a demand for them as food, we can increase the desire of the fishing community to participate in our efforts.
ReefCI also works with local women who use the Lionfish spines to make beautiful jewelry.  ReefCI is helping empower them by creating a sustainable source of income.

Risks & Challenges

Certainly every organization could potentially face financial ruin and dissolve.  We believe this risk, for ReefCI, is mitigated by our 11 year history of success in Belize.  Our experienced staff is efficient and hard working and we stretch each and every dollar to the limit.  We are committed to ongoing success and to making a positive impact in the world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

While our primary needs are financial, if you cannot afford to give, there are other ways you can help.  

First, develop a passion for our oceans and coral reefs.  Educate yourself on their importance and enjoy the beauty and vitality.

Second, take that passion and turn it into action!  Tell your family, friends and contacts about the marine disaster accelerating in the Atlantic-Caribbean basin and ask them to help.  Post the link to our Indiegogo site on your personal social media pages and help us spread the word and expand our community of supporters. 

Finally, come to Belize, visit us at ReefCI, and see for yourself.  Once you've experienced the beauty and majesty, you will want to join us in our conservation efforts.  

Thank you for your consideration and gift of time or money.  You can be part of the solution!

But, it's not just the fishermen who are in danger.  With no fish or reef, there will be no divers and far fewer tourists.  Diving alone is a $2.1 billion business in the Caribbean.  Hotels, restaurants, dive operations, and other tourist attractions will close and local economies will tank.  
A single Lionfish may reduce the number of juvenile native fish on any given reef by approximately 79% in just 5 weeks!  Removing 20 Lionfish on a single dive equates to saving approximately 300,000 juvenile fish over a one-year period.  ReefCI, on average, removes 50 Lionfish on every dive, and we can multiply that with each diver we educate and teach to help.
Additionally, ReefCI has been instrumental in teaching local restaurants the value of putting Lionfish on the menu.  They are delicious and, by creating a demand for them as food, we can increase the desire of the fishing community to participate in our efforts.
ReefCI also works with local women who use the Lionfish spines to make beautiful jewelry.  ReefCI is helping empower them by creating a sustainable source of income. Risks & Challenges
Certainly every organization could potentially face financial ruin and dissolve.  We believe this risk, for ReefCI, is mitigated by our 11 year history of success in Belize.  Our experienced staff is efficient and hard working and we stretch each and every dollar to the limit.  We are committed to ongoing success and to making a positive impact in the world.  
 Other Ways You Can Help

While our primary needs are financial, if you cannot afford to give, there are other ways you can help.  
First, develop a passion for our oceans and coral reefs.  Educate yourself on their importance and enjoy the beauty and vitality.
Second, take that passion and turn it into action!  Tell your family, friends and contacts about the marine disaster accelerating in the Atlantic-Caribbean basin and ask them to help.  Post the link to our Indiegogo site on your personal social media pages and help us spread the word and expand our community of supporters. 
Finally, come to Belize, visit us at ReefCI, and see for yourself.  Once you've experienced the beauty and majesty, you will want to join us in our conservation efforts.  
Thank you for your consideration and gift of time or money.  You can be part of the solution!

story:
[English below | Tiếng Anh bên dưới]

Mục tiêu của chiến dịch là gì?

Hang Sơn Đoòng tại vườn quốc gia Phong Nha Kẻ Bàng được UNESCO công nhận là Di sản thiên nhiên thế giới từ năm 2011. Vương quốc dưới lòng đất này, với thời tiết, phong cảnh và hệ sinh thái riêng, là nơi cư ngụ của thảm rừng nhiệt đới, thác, sông, đồi và nhiều loài động thực vật quý hiếm. Kỳ quan thiên nhiên 5 triệu năm này cũng chỉ mới được con người khám phá ra trong thời gian gần đây, nhưng rủi thay đang sớm trở thành miếng mồi béo bở cho những dự án thương mại khai thác du lịch kém bền vững.

Chuyện gì đang xảy ra với nó?

Dự án xây dựng cáp treo vào vùng lõi của rừng quốc gia Phong Nha Kẻ Bàng cận biên hang Sơn Đoòng có nguy cơ gây tổn hại nghiêm trọng lên hang. Với sức tải 1000 người một giờ, hệ thống cáp treo sẽ chuyển gần 1 triệu - 1.5 triệu người đến xem hang mỗi năm. So sánh với con số 1000 khách bộ hành khám phá hang hiện đang được cấp phép, áp lực dung chứa đột biến và quá tải sẽ sớm bức tử kỳ quan này. Thực trạng tiêu cực ở những di sản văn hóa lẫn thiên nhiên khác khiến chúng ta có cơ sở lo ngại hệ thống cáp treo sẽ trực tiếp đe dọa tới hệ sinh thái mẫn cảm và cấu trúc không vững chắc của hang.

Chúng tôi là ai?

#Savesondoong là một nhóm hoạt động môi trường, đơn vị đã phát động chiến dịch bảo vệ hang được gần 3 năm với sự ủng hộ của hơn 175000 người theo dõi trên Facebook. Chúng tôi đã tổ chức rất nhiều sự kiện offline nhằm tăng cường ý thức cộng đồng và kiêu gọi hành động, bao gồm các suất chiếu phim tài liệu về hang, cuộc thi tranh ảnh, tập huấn, hội thảo, diễn đàn tranh luận, v.v. bao gồm cuộc gặp gỡ tổng thống Obama.

Bạn có thể giúp như thế nào?

Sự ủng hộ của Quí mạnh thường quân  sẽ giúp chúng tôi mở rộng và tăng chất lượng của các hoạt động truyền thông kể trên. Ngoài ra, sẽ giúp phát triển một dự án mới vô cùng thú vị của nhà Đoòng:

Những hành vi xâm hại môi trường đa số xuất phát từ sự thiếu hiểu biết, nhiều hơn là ác ý. Xác định được điều đó chúng tôi cùng đơn vị đối tác R.E.S.T (Responsible Environmental Stewardship & Tourism) hiện đang phát triển dự án edutainment (sản phẩm giáo dục vừa học vừa chơi thông qua giải trí). Khai thác dữ liệu, hình ảnh từ video 360 của nhiếp ảnh gia Jason Speth (dự án của Ryot News, và Google). REST sử dụng công nghệ tiên tiến (4D thực tế ảo) để mang vẻ đẹp hoang sơ của Sơn Đoòng đến nhiều người hơn nữa một cách sống động nhất, thông qua đó lồng ghép các bài học về giá trị sinh học & địa chất độc nhất của hang một cách trực quan. Khi dự án được triển khai, chúng tôi tin rằng sẽ cải thiện được tình trạng đại bộ phận dân chúng đang vô tư và vô tình phá hoại thiên nhiên như đang xảy ra ở đỉnh Fanxipan, Bà Nà hay trên khắp đất nước Việt Nam xinh đẹp này.

Sự góp sức của bạn dù ít, dù nhiều chắc chắn sẽ giúp giúp bảo vệ Di sản thiên nhiên thế giới 5 triệu năm tuổi. Đừng để Sơn Đòong sẽ trở thành ký ức của cả một thế hệ. Xin hãy đồng hành cùng chúng tôi trong hành trình giữ gìn Di sản thế giới.

(Nếu không thể hỗ trợ tài chính, mỗi sự chia sẻ về chiến dịch gây quỹ này trên mạng xã hội cũng giúp chiến dịch đến gần hơn với hi vọng giữ gìn sự nguyên sơ của Sơn Đòong cho con cháu của chúng ta.)

Quà tặng Tri ân:

Để bày tỏ sự trân trọng của chúng tôi với những đóng góp của bạn, #SaveSonDoong xin gửi tặng bạn những món quà nhỏ sau:

$20: Với mỗi khoản đóng góp $20 (450.000 VND), quà tặng là bộ hình nền (wallpaper sử dụng trên máy tính, điện thoại) gồm những hình ảnh tuyệt đẹp ở hang Sơn Đoòng với độ phân giải HD.

$50: Với mỗi khoản đóng góp $50 (1.100.000  VND), quà tặng là một áo thun #Savesondoong (hình trong gallery). Áo có các kích cỡ từ XS đến 4XL. Vui lòng gửi email về info@savesondoong.org nếu bạn có thắc mắc về cỡ áo. Giao áo miễn phí ở Việt Nam, phí vận chuyển $10 trong nước Mỹ, $15 đến các nước khác trên toàn thế giới.

Son Doong in Virtual Reality (illustration purposes - hình minh họa)

--------

What are we saving?

Son Doong is the world's largest cave located in a National Park of Vietnam and a World Heritage of UNESCO. This underground kingdom is so big it has its own weather, landscape, and ecosystem with jungles, waterfalls, rivers, hills, and many rare flora and fauna species. This 5-million-year-old hidden wonder has just been recently discovered. But like any other wonder found by humankind, the cave is facing the threat of being exploited.

What is the problem?

A cable car project is being considered, which can bring in up to 1000 tourists an hour (equivalent to 1-1.5 million per annum). That is a huge increase in tourism traffic, given the current trekking permit quota to this cave is only 1000 a year. Like how mass tourism has destroyed numerous Natural & Cultural Heritage sites around the world, this cable car project poses a threat to the sensitive ecosystem and the fragile structure of the cave.  

Who are we?

#SaveSonDoong is a group of Vietnamese environmental activists, who have been advocating for the conservation of Son Doong for the past three years. We've built a loyal fan base of more than 175,000 followers on Facebook and organized numerous offline events, from movie screening, photo exhibition, to workshops, conferences, debate forums, competitions, etc, including meeting President Obama.

How can YOU help?

Your support will help us put together more offline events like the above. Moreover, our partners and we are producing an "edutainment" exhibition named R.E.S.T (Responsible Environmental Stewardship & Tourism). Featuring photographer’s Jason Speth’s 360-degree videography of the cave (a project in collaboration with Ryot News and Google), R.E.S.T uses cutting-edge technologies (4D virtual reality) to bring the beauty of Son Doong to a lot more people while embedding the lessons about the scientific values of this World Heritage. The project by no means aims to replace traditional traveling methods, but rather engage viewers to educate them and in returns produce more informed travelers. Our theory of change is that most harmful actions are caused by lack of knowledge, rather than bad intentions.

Your support will directly help save Son Doong and indirectly prove that the above "edutainment" model works. This has the potential to save other endangered Natural & Cultural Heritage sites. So if you would like to become a part of an innovation will save the planet's treasures and support local people, please join our journey!

(If you can't financially support the campaign, please help us by sharing this on your social media. We would sincerely appreciate it!)

To Thank you:

We would like to express our appreciation for your contribution with the following gifts:

$20: For every $20 contribution, we will send you a set of magnificent Son Doong Cave wallpapers in HD resolution.

$50: For every $50 contribution, we will send you a #Savesondoong T-shirt (picture in gallery). The sizes vary from XS to 4XL. Please email us at info@savesondoong.org if you have questions about sizing.  Shipping is free in Vietnam, $10 shipping to US, $15 shipping to the rest of the world.

story:
UQAMAZONE

   Milieu, intervention et conservation!

UQAMAZONE c'est 20 étudiants de maitrise et doctorat en sciences de          l'environnement qui participent à un cours de terrain en Amazonie.

  1. Ce cours intensif se déroulera durant un séjour de deux semaines (fin août – début septembre) en Amazonie brésilienne, tant en milieu rural (vallées de la rivière Tapajós et du fleuve Amazone) qu’à Belém (rencontres avec des représentants de grandes institutions amazoniennes œuvrant en recherche, en intervention et en planification).

  2. L'objectif est de dresser un portrait global des problématiques sociales et environnementales de ce milieu. En plus des professeurs québécois et brésiliens, plusieurs personnes ressources œuvrant en Amazonie interviendront durant le cours.
  3. De nombreuses rencontres sont également prévues avec des représentants des populations riveraines de l’Amazone et du Tapajós (agriculteurs et pêcheurs).
    Ce projet nous tient à coeur puisqu'il nous permettra de: 

    • Comprendre le fonctionnement des écosystèmes amazoniens.

    • Comprendre les enjeux sociaux en relation avec le besoin de concilier la conservation et le développement de cet environnement.

    • En plus de favoriser les échanges culturels et intellectuels entre les étudiants québécois et brésiliens.
    Votre contribution ainsi que votre support nous sont d'une grande aide pour concrétiser ce voyage!


    Pourquoi devons nous débourser et ce que vous obtenez en soutenant notre financement

    Bien que nous ayons déjà fait plusieurs activités de financement durant la dernière année (vente de café bio-équitable, emballage en épicerie, nettoyage des rues après la F1 de Montréal, soirée brésilienne, cocktail de Noël) nous n'avons toujours pas atteint les 40 000$ nécessaires à la réalisation de ce voyage.

    Le montant du financement dont nous avons besoin sert à :
    • Payer les frais du bateau.
    • Payer l'équipage.
    • Acheter de la nourriture et de l'eau potable.
    • Se procurer des médicaments en cas de besoin.
    • Nous déplacer en Amazonie

    Nous avons développé une manière intéressante de nous financer en vous faisant participer à notre voyage!  

    • Pour 10$ nous vous enverrons une carte postale virtuelle du groupe en action en Amazonie.
    • Pour 20$, un participant vous remettra une paire de boucles d'oreille achetée au Brésil.

     Mettez-nous au défi!

    • Mais pour 40$, vous et vos amiEs pouvez lancer, à l'ensemble du groupe ou à un des participantEs en particulier, un défi en Amazonie qui sera capturé en photo puis envoyé à votre adresse courriel.
    • Enfin pour 100$ nous vous ferons parvenir 3 photos encadrées sur les problématiques environnementales étudiées en Amazonie. À moins que vous ne préféreriez  recevoir 3 photos encadrées de 3 défis que vous nous aurez lancé?

            ... Nous sommes prêts!

     Profil des participants:  http://uqamazone.wordpress.com/etudiants/


     L'impact: votre contribution fait la différence!

    Ce projet en Amazonie est précieux à nos yeux, mais il peut également l'être aux vôtres ainsi qu'au reste du monde.  Les problématiques environnementales nous affectent tous de près ou de loin.   Nous encourager, c'est aussi encourager une cohorte d'étudiants qui reviendront grandis et nourris de réflexions sur des problématiques environnementales qui sont aussi vécues au Québec, comme la déforestation et la contamination par l'agriculture. Bref, c'est certainement une expérience qui sème les graines d'un monde plus écologique!

    Voici quelques liens vers des vidéos sur YouTube qui traitent de certains problèmes en Amazonie (déforestation, culture du soja, barrage hydroélectrique). 
    • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wYbsxDI_Hp4
    • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mhph0vDGweI
    • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZIWmzmWwok4
    • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cVFUMcpRltI
    • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ne37oJTdWj4

    Risques et défis

    Nous nous engageons à relever les défis que vous nous lancez, dans la mesure ou ils sont réalisables et surtout... présentables!   Lancez-nous au défi de danser dans la forêt tropicale, de sauter d'une bateau ou autre, pourvu que ce ne soit pas dangereux!

    D'autres façons d'aider

    Vous ne pouvez pas contribuer, nous comprenons! Cela ne veut toutefois pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider :

    • Visitez notre site:  http://uqamazone.wordpress.com/
    • Parlez de notre projet autour de vous.
    • Parlez de notre projet sur les réseaux sociaux.
    • Utilisez les outils de partage sur Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo, Instagram etc.
    • Finalement, suivez notre projet en Amazonie, mais  informez-vous également sur les problématiques environnementales qui vous entourent. 
    • Soyez des citoyens conscientisés! 

    Merci! Obrigada! Thank you!
story_txt:
UQAMAZONE

   Milieu,
intervention et conservation!



UQAMAZONE c'est 20 étudiants de maitrise et doctorat en sciences de          l'environnement qui participent à un cours de terrain en Amazonie.

	
		
		
	
	
		






Ce cours intensif se déroulera durant un séjour de deux semaines (fin août – début
septembre) en Amazonie brésilienne, tant en milieu rural (vallées de la rivière
Tapajós et du fleuve Amazone) qu’à Belém (rencontres avec des représentants de
grandes institutions amazoniennes œuvrant en recherche, en intervention et en
planification).






L'objectif est de dresser un portrait global des
problématiques sociales et environnementales de ce milieu. En plus des professeurs
québécois et brésiliens, plusieurs personnes ressources œuvrant en Amazonie
interviendront durant le cours.





De nombreuses
rencontres sont également prévues avec des représentants des populations
riveraines de l’Amazone et du Tapajós (agriculteurs et pêcheurs).

						
			

Ce projet nous tient à coeur puisqu'il nous permettra de: 






Comprendre le fonctionnement des écosystèmes amazoniens.






Comprendre les enjeux sociaux en relation avec le besoin de concilier la conservation et le
développement de cet environnement.




En plus de favoriser les échanges culturels et intellectuels entre les étudiants québécois et brésiliens.

	





Votre contribution ainsi que votre support nous sont d'une grande aide pour concrétiser ce voyage!









Pourquoi devons nous débourser et ce que vous obtenez en soutenant notre financement
Bien que nous ayons déjà fait plusieurs activités de financement durant la dernière année (vente de café bio-équitable, emballage en épicerie, nettoyage des rues après la F1 de Montréal, soirée brésilienne, cocktail de Noël) nous n'avons toujours pas atteint les 40 000$ nécessaires à la réalisation de ce voyage. Le montant du financement dont nous avons besoin sert à :
Payer les frais du bateau.
Payer l'équipage.
Acheter de la nourriture et de l'eau potable.
Se procurer des médicaments en cas de besoin.
Nous déplacer en Amazonie

Nous avons développé une manière intéressante de nous financer en vous faisant participer à notre voyage!   

Pour 10$ nous vous enverrons une carte postale virtuelle du groupe en action en Amazonie.
Pour 20$, un participant vous remettra une paire de boucles d'oreille achetée au Brésil. 


 Mettez-nous au défi!
Mais pour 40$, vous et vos amiEs pouvez lancer, à l'ensemble du groupe ou à un des participantEs en particulier, un défi en Amazonie qui sera capturé en photo puis envoyé à votre adresse courriel.
Enfin pour 100$ nous vous ferons parvenir 3 photos encadrées sur les problématiques environnementales étudiées en Amazonie. À moins que vous ne préféreriez  recevoir 3 photos encadrées de 3 défis que vous nous aurez lancé?
        ... Nous sommes prêts!

 Profil des participants:  http://uqamazone.wordpress.com/etudiants/


 L'impact: votre contribution fait la différence!Ce projet en Amazonie est précieux à nos yeux, mais il peut également l'être aux vôtres ainsi qu'au reste du monde.  Les problématiques environnementales nous affectent tous de près ou de loin.   Nous encourager, c'est aussi encourager une cohorte d'étudiants qui reviendront grandis et nourris de réflexions sur des problématiques environnementales qui sont aussi vécues au Québec, comme la déforestation et la contamination par l'agriculture. Bref, c'est certainement une expérience qui sème les graines d'un monde plus écologique!Voici quelques liens vers des vidéos sur YouTube qui traitent de certains problèmes en Amazonie (déforestation, culture du soja, barrage hydroélectrique).  
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wYbsxDI_Hp4
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mhph0vDGweI
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZIWmzmWwok4
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cVFUMcpRltI
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ne37oJTdWj4


Risques et défis
 Nous nous engageons à relever les défis que vous nous lancez, dans la mesure ou ils sont réalisables et surtout... présentables!   Lancez-nous au défi de danser dans la forêt tropicale, de sauter d'une bateau ou autre, pourvu que ce ne soit pas dangereux!

D'autres façons d'aider
Vous ne pouvez pas contribuer, nous comprenons! Cela ne veut toutefois pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider :

Visitez notre site:  http://uqamazone.wordpress.com/

Parlez de notre projet autour de vous.

Parlez de notre projet sur les réseaux sociaux. 

Utilisez les outils de partage sur Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo, Instagram etc. 

Finalement, suivez notre projet en Amazonie, mais  informez-vous également sur les problématiques environnementales qui vous entourent.  

Soyez des citoyens conscientisés!  


Merci! Obrigada! Thank you!

story:
Who We Are & What We're Doing

Oregon Stewardship is a 501c3 Non-profit located in Southern Oregon focused on offering educational opportunities designed to encourage Oregon residents of all ages to participate in healthy stewardship of Oregon land. We also provide student scholarships for college as part of our efforts to support education.

Currently, Oregon Stewardship is working with local students (many are SMHS students working on senior projects) and other supportive agencies/organizations to help restore Bear Creek throughout downtown Medford and beyond. Our work provides multiple benefits for the community including but not limited to:

  • Improved water quality for the health of fish, birds, and other animals as well as humans.
  • Improved riparian zones
  • Reclaimed natural beauty and increased opportunity for future enjoyment of this natural resource
  • Educational opportunities for local high school students

Contributions of any level are gratefully accepted and create an immediate impact on our work! We believe the creek is an important part of the valley and deserves to be restored to it’s original inspiring beauty. We invite you to partner with us in making this creek and the areas around it valuable assets to our community and future recreation.

Every $1,000 given provides enough money to restore 100 feet of creek bank. Currently, we’re working to raise $5,000.00 to continue work on large sections of creek bank in downtown Medford.

The following videos give a small taste of what we're doing and what we're working for including protecting what we believe is the largest spawning salmon run in the last 20 years:



Other Ways You Can Help

While financial support is the primary need, we also greatly appreciate any willingness to share our efforts with others! Also, please come out and enjoy the Bear Creek Greenway and partner with us in restoring Bear Creek and our downtown!

story:
Good Turn Earth Company is changing the landscape in Fredericksburg, Virginia – literally. The local start-up is committed to rescuing green waste from the landfill and transforming it into a living, breathing soil conditioner that produces strong and healthy plants.


Our team first met in September 2014 where we were finalists in the Start-Up Weekend Competition in Fredericksburg, Virginia.  Later that fall we took honors at the Made in FredVa competition sponsored by the Fredericksburg Chamber of Commerce.  Our team has grown to include partners bringing diverse experience -- in farms and gardens, start-ups, family businesses, and non-profits -- all with a shared commitment to tackling waste, improving the food system, and creating local jobs.


We didn't hesitate to get started: we got our hands dirty in all kinds of ways! We have already built strong local partnerships with key Fredericksburg institutions, including Wegmans grocery store, 25 30 Espresso, Earth Mother Mushrooms and Fredericksburg City Public Works. We collect unsellable produce from Wegmans supermarket and coffee grounds from the coffee shops every Saturday, and have been storing literally tons of leaves from the city fall cleanups. Good Turn Earth Co. is producing a gourmet mix composed of city leaves, coffee grounds, out-of-date produce, mushroom compost and worm castings that will recondition and revitalize local soil.

We love the Fredericksburg community and want to see it flourish! Our premium organic soil conditioner will be sold in downtown Fredericksburg at the Farmer’s Market and Roxbury Farm and Garden Center and in Spotsylvania at Harvest Market and Courtland Ace Hardware.

To get these products to market, we need your help! Our campaign will help Good Turn Earth Co. grow, processing our first set of soil conditioner in spring 2015, bagging, distributing and selling the first 5 tons of compost; building new partnerships with other city businesses; launching collection of food waste at local farmer's markets; and scaling up our processing to be able to handle more of Fredericksburg's food waste.

What We Need & What You Get

So far, we've been bootstrapping. Together, we've built composting systems from scratch, with chicken wire, tarps and a lot of hard work by all of us, friends, and family.


With this campaign, we are raising $11,500 to be able to register and launch the business officially, build the equipment we need to finish processing our materials, distribute the first set of our soil amendment, and begin collecting food waste from consumers at farmer's markets. Here's the breakdown:

$2,000 professional services including attorneys, licensing, registration fees, insurance

$1,500 launching farmers market food waste collection, including farmers market fees, bins, education materials 

$3,000 tools for sifting final compost, essential supplies, and other equipment

$5,000 first run of packaging, including plastic free burlap bags, marketing, web services, and our video production

We know that this goal is ambitious but achievable -- with your help! Since we can't do this without you, we've put together an amazing combination of perks and rewards for different funding levels. Any level of funding will receive something from us in gratitude! 

Here's an example of some of the goodies we have for funders

At our entry levels, we'll send you a signed postcard to the team ($10) or a magnet with original artwork by Lindsay Coffman reminding you and your family or roommates about what can be composted ($25) We're making great Good Turn tote bags and t-shirts for the next levels, so you can show your support and look amazing! For the first 50 early birds, you can get a bag of our first round of compost (plus a t-shirt, tote bag, magnet and postcard) for only $65! After that, it'll go up to $75! Thanks to our incredible partnerships with Earth Mother Mushrooms, donors of $100+ will get their own tabletop oyster mushroom kit. Local FXBG artists have pitched in too: you can get your hands on a famous Dan Finnegan piece -- small and large planters for growing herbs or flowers! Bill Harris has offered to do a line drawing of one lucky donor's house, and David Wold has hand-turned a wooden compost bucket, etched with the city of Fredericksburg's  skyline! These are truly unique pieces, available only for supporters of Good Turn during this IndieGoGo campaign!
(scroll down to see images for each level of funding)

The Impact
According to the USDA and the National Resources Defense Council, more than 40 percent of all food grown and distributed in the US is thrown away, somewhere between the farm and our forks. For fruits and vegetables, this is even higher -- more than 50 percent ends up wasted. In landfills, this food waste breaks down into methane, a potent greenhouse gas, contributing to climate change. At the same time, to fertilize soil that has lost its nutrients, Americans add millions of tons of fertilizer. While there are many exciting solutions to these systemic problems, Good Turn Earth Company is focused on converting food waste -- captured from supermarkets, restaurants and households -- into a soil amendment that helps create healthier, living soil, naturally.

Good Turn Earth Company is already making a difference!  In just a couple of short months we have developed partnerships with local businesses, diverted over 4 tons of greenwaste from the landfill, helped the city process several tons of dried fall leaves, and built our first waste processing "bins" right in Fredericksburg. 

We are creating a system that nurtures life from waste, and inviting the whole community to participate. Compost bins will be available at the downtown farmer's market each week and there will be a drop off site for locals to bring their coffee grounds and food scraps that would otherwise end up in a landfill.  Good Turn is pioneering a new way for the Fredericksburg area community to collaborate and do a good turn for the planet. 

Risks & Challenges

We've already overcome many of the initial challenges: we've built partnerships with one of the largest supermarkets and coffee shops of Fredericksburg, who are both excited about what we do; we've found a values-aligned partner in Downtown Greens, Inc., an urban greenspace who has provided the space to compost our first round of materials; we've built a relationship with the city to be able to store and process leaves collected during the fall; and we've found distributors willing to host and sell our final product.

The biggest challenges ahead will be in generating sales for the soil amendment, which will be costlier and much healthier than chemical fertilizers. This will require consumer education about the importance of living soil for the health of our planet, ourselves, our farms, and our food. Given that our team brings experience in environmental education and business development and given that our distribution partners are committed to helping get the word out to their customers, we are in a great place to launch. This campaign -- and each one of you -- will be a huge help in getting the word out about our incredible mission and product.

Other Ways You Can Help

This funding campaign is critical to the production of our first batch of living, breathing soil. We know that everyone is at a different place financially, so if you can't contribute right now, please help us get the word out by sharing the link on social media or forwarding on to your friends or family that might be interested.  Any way that you do it, you'll be doing a Good Turn for the planet! 

THANKS! 

Here are some of the perks that we have put together for our funders! Full descriptions and availabilty of each perk can be found in the column to the right.
