story:
Myanmar Hideout

This is a crowdfunding project for an upcoming Retreat located in the incredible 'Mergui Archipelago' southern Myanmar.

Myanmar Hideout will be unlike any resort you've ever experienced. It will feel like haven. Our enchanting island will show you a modern life in balance. Time-out from everyday life to relax and recharge your body's energy, enjoy and cook healthy food made from natural ingredients, physical activitys to improve health, strengthen your mind and flow into the spiritual world of meditation and wisdom to know how to live a happy life.


1 Perks

You can choose between 2 donation types:

  • 4 different donations with the choice where your money goes.
  • 4 different donations with booking discounts for your next holiday.

Donations with special target

You can decide which of the offered activities are more important for you.

Donation with discounts

Only Early Birds get the low season prices + discounts of your choice. The low season price is 150$/night for a 2 person residence (+ child). All bookings will have full board, free water, free transfer island >< airport and free wlan. (The discount is only for your first booking and a maximum stay of 14 days.)

Example: If you choose your discount today and book for 14 days, you will save:
$626,00 - Early Bird Discount (75%)
$361,00 - Early Bird Discount (50%)
$136,00 - Early Bird Discount (25%)


2 Eco

We create a resort that conserves the environment and improves the well-being of local people.


CLEAN ENERGY
The use of renewable energy is the most important way in which we protect this planet.


NATURE PROTECTION
We only use products that have been produced in an environmentally friendly way.


MEDICAL CARE
Medical care is not self-evident in Myanmar. Therefore we support the basic needs of the locals.


DRINKING WATER
Many people have no access to clean drinking water. We share our produced water with the locals.


3 Team


Aung Zaw Min (Diver/Facility Assistant)
Aung knows the mergui archipelago like the back of his hand. Since years he is a professional diver und one of the kindest person on this planet.

Daniela Vey (Social Media Expert)
Daniela works as freelancer in web design for more than 12 years. She is addicted to Online- and Social Media and also works as lecturer at Stuttgart Media University.

Erich Huth (Construction Engineer)
Since Erich first came in touch with the building industry he had gained strong knowdlege in restoring monuments and building homes, halls, summer houses, infrastructures and bridges. Therefore he loves what he is doing and can't think of retirement.

 Evelyn Pede (Yoga Instructor)

Evelyn has experience in Human Resources due to her work as a recruiting agent and her studies Public Administration. But in fact she is a Yogi with body and soul. She acquired her extensive yoga knowledge from various trainings all over the world.

Hin Ei Hlaing (Recruiting/Local Communication)
She gathered her knowledge as an office and production manager at “Yangon Film School” and from teaching many workshops.

Jan Schneekluth (Facility Manager)
Jan loves wood – he is a professional carpenter and joiner and can prove 16 years of lifework. He has been working in the building industry and taking care of different machinery for generation of energy.

Karl-Heinz Mattern (Head of Cuisine/Meditation)
Karl is a nutritionist, a sommelier and an award-winning chef. To spread around his knowledge he wrote a book about the healing effects of aloe vera. Furthermore he has skills as a meditation teacher.

Martin Klaua (SEO/Google Analytics)
Martin is a kind of a statistic nerd. He likes to evaluate the success of webpages and helps us to optimize google search.

Stephan Huth (Founder)
Stephan brings plenty of experience in construction business (family-owned enterprise). Due to his studies at the Stuttgart Media University he has gained knowledge in marketing and project management. In the last 6 years he has experienced strategy development and change-/ supplier management at Daimler AG (Mercedes Benz).

Yrkia Mattern (Therapist Massage)
Yrkia is a professional in Shiatsu and a Therapist Masseuse.


4 Resort

Philosophy

Myanmar Hideout Villa Residence Resort

Today, the modern industrial society is characterised by an increasing range of services, efficiency, increase profitability, overstimulation and customer world development. Back in the day this behaviour seemed desirable. But nowadays we feel stressed and even suffer from burn-out. Society is seeking a spot for rest and recreation, with a sufficient distance between holiday and daily life to recharge our body’s batteries. A symbiosis of nature and culture with opportunities to practice sports and to socialise with others is preferable.

The resort “Myanmar Hideout” is pursuing the same aim: A place for holiday makers, far from industry and big cities, with endless, lonely beaches, local exotic dishes and specialties prepared by the Islanders; getting to know Myanmar’s nature and culture.

Residences

Designed to blend in with the rich nature that surrounds it, the 20 cabins sit on the hill with views of the ocean. The cottages are predominantly constructed from natural materials in a modern, clear design with indigenous touch. They intend to present a private retreat in order to create space for quiet and concentration. Each cabin is equipped with a bathroom, a terrace, deckchairs and a comfortable covered lounge.

Restaurant and Bar

There will be two restaurants on the premises. The international restaurant is connected to a bar. Guests can order international, vegetarian and vegan dishes.

The second restaurant, a Burmese style cuisine, has exclusively local chefs. Guests can experience the traditional cuisine of the country. The atmosphere and operating concept follows the habits of the local people.

On demand we offer special detox programs to purify the body.

Nutrition Advice and Cooking

A balanced state of nutritional, physical and mental health play an increasingly important role in our life. Brainwashed marketing strategies like processed food are quick to prepare but damage our body. Our nutritional advice class provides good knowledge about individual characteristics of nature products in order to ensure a healthy living.

Yoga and Meditation

Join daily yoga classes in a peaceful ambience surrounded by palmtrees. Take the dynamic class in the early morning for an active start into the day or join us for a restorative class in the evening to finish the day with peace and harmony. We offer dynamic styles like Vinyasa Flow and restorative classes like Yin Yoga for everybody. Be open for other steps in Yoga like Pranayama and Meditation to calm your mind.
During off-peak seasons we organize Yoga Teacher Trainings.

Massage

Three types of massage will be offered:

  • Thai massage
  • Ayurvedic massage
  • Shiatsu massage

Water Shiatsu

Water shiatsu (Watsu) is an innovative method of relaxation. There is no active participation. In Watsu the guest slides through the water by a trainer. The goal of this method is primal emotion of security, harmonising, stimulationand healing for inner harmony.
Due to movement and the massage a muscle relaxation finds place. Organs get strengthens, flexibility gets trained and it expands the joints. It will enable your life energy to flow freely again.


Sailing, Kayaking, Stand up Paddling, Boat trips

Kayaks are provided for exploring the nearby areas. Guests with a valid sailing license can get their own small boats to explore the surrounding themselves. Moreover, it is worth considering combining the cooperation of regional fisher man from different villages to join tourists on the daily fishing trips. Furthermore boat trips to the Moken (sea gipsys) and remote islands are offered. In this way guests get offered a wide range of ways to discover the archipelago.

Scuba Diving and Snorkelling

We will have trips for beginner and intermediate class where our guests can explore the beautiful flora and fauna of the tropical sea; e.g. elephant manta rays, majestic whale sharks and the colourful corals for makro-lovers.
The remote location, unique underwater world and the significant biodiversity will provide an adventurous diving experience. Due to location and limited boat access the spots won’t be filled with mass tourists.


5 Myanmar


The Country

Myanmar lies in South-East Asia bordering Bangladesh, India, China, Laos and Thailand. From north to the south it’s 2.500 km and approximately 900 km from east to west. Myanmar is double the size of Germany.
Yangon is the economical and cultural centre where the foreign embassies are located and has a population of 6.5 million. Naypyidaw is where the parliament is located and in 2005, became the capital city.
Myanmar has a population of 59 million from over 135 different ethnic groups. The main religion is Buddhism with 89% (Christian 5%, Muslim 4%, Hinduism and Animism 1%).
Due to economic sanctions because of a predominantly military regime, the country couldn’t be reached from the outside at all until 2012.
It is only now that the country is becoming more open for tourists.

To get a feeling how Myanmar looks like, try these films:

Myanmar (Burma) in 4K

Beautiful Myanmar

Hand in Hand to Myanmar

Mergui Archipelago


The resort will be located in south east Myanmar on Mergui Archipelago. Burmese name: မြိတ်ကျွန်းစု), Coordinates: 11°08’49.2″North 98°16’58.8″East. Area of 36.000 km2. The archipelago starts at the border of Thailand and spreads 450 km up north and 160 km west to the Andaman Sea (Indian Ocean). It consists more than 800 beautiful tropical islands made from limestone and granite. The climate is tropical with high humidity. The rain season is from mid May to mid of October. Biotope to rare wildlife. Gorgeous coral reefs, white sand beaches & jungle.

The UNO classified the south-east Asian Coral Triangle as having the largest population of coral and fish species on the whole planet.

This area is inhabited by the Moken, in other words sea gypsies or nomads of the ocean. Last pristine paradise on Earth. A real hideout to feel pure nature.

Especially the south is still unexplored by tourists.

Arrival

  1. → Yangon → Kawthaung
    Myanmar is increasingly interesting as a travel destination, therefore more and more airlines have started having stopovers at Myanmar’s international airport Yangon or in Mandalay. There are domestic flights from Yangon to Kawthaung, where our resort guests will get picked up by our boat.
  2. → Bangkok → Ranong/Kawthaung
    Alternatively the route via Bangkok (Thailand) can be chosen. A domestic flight from Bangkok to Ranong takes only 50 minutes. From there it’s a small step with a ferry to our pick up location in Kawthaung (Myanmar).
story_txt:
Myanmar Hideout

This is a crowdfunding project for an upcoming Retreat located in the incredible 'Mergui Archipelago' southern Myanmar.
Myanmar Hideout will be unlike any resort you've ever experienced. It will feel like haven. Our enchanting island will show you a modern life in balance. Time-out from everyday life to relax and recharge your body's energy, enjoy and cook healthy food made from natural ingredients, physical activitys to improve health, strengthen your mind and flow into the spiritual world of meditation and wisdom to know how to live a happy life.






1 Perks

You can choose between 2 donation types:

4 different donations with the choice where your money goes. 

4 different donations with booking discounts for your next holiday.

Donations with special target
You can decide which of the offered activities are more important for you.
Donation with discounts
Only Early Birds get the low season prices + discounts of your choice. The low season price is 150$/night for a 2 person residence (+ child). All bookings will have full board, free water, free transfer island >< airport and free wlan. (The discount is only for your first booking and a maximum stay of 14 days.)Example: If you choose your discount today and book for 14 days, you will save:$626,00 - Early Bird Discount (75%)$361,00 - Early Bird Discount (50%)$136,00 - Early Bird Discount (25%)
2 Eco
 We create a resort that conserves the environment and improves the well-being of local people.

CLEAN ENERGYThe use of renewable energy is the most important way in which we protect this planet.

NATURE PROTECTIONWe only use products that have been produced in an environmentally friendly way.

MEDICAL CAREMedical care is not self-evident in Myanmar. Therefore we support the basic needs of the locals.

DRINKING WATERMany people have no access to clean drinking water. We share our produced water with the locals.

3 Team



 Aung Zaw Min (Diver/Facility Assistant)Aung knows the mergui archipelago like the back of his hand. Since years he is a professional diver und one of the kindest person on this planet.
 Daniela Vey (Social Media Expert)Daniela works as freelancer in web design for more than 12 years. She is addicted to Online- and Social Media and also works as lecturer at Stuttgart Media University.


 Erich Huth (Construction Engineer)Since Erich first came in touch with the building industry he had gained strong knowdlege in restoring monuments and building homes, halls, summer houses, infrastructures and bridges. Therefore he loves what he is doing and can't think of retirement.



 Evelyn Pede (Yoga Instructor)Evelyn has experience in Human Resources due to her work as a recruiting agent and her studies Public Administration. But in fact she is a Yogi with body and soul. She acquired her extensive yoga knowledge from various trainings all over the world.


 Hin Ei Hlaing (Recruiting/Local Communication)She gathered her knowledge as an office and production manager at “Yangon Film School” and from teaching many workshops.


 Jan Schneekluth (Facility Manager)Jan loves wood – he is a professional carpenter and joiner and can prove 16 years of lifework. He has been working in the building industry and taking care of different machinery for generation of energy.


 Karl-Heinz Mattern (Head of Cuisine/Meditation)Karl is a nutritionist, a sommelier and an award-winning chef. To spread around his knowledge he wrote a book about the healing effects of aloe vera. Furthermore he has skills as a meditation teacher.

 Martin Klaua (SEO/Google Analytics)Martin is a kind of a statistic nerd. He likes to evaluate the success of webpages and helps us to optimize google search.
 Stephan Huth (Founder)Stephan brings plenty of experience in construction business (family-owned enterprise). Due to his studies at the Stuttgart Media University he has gained knowledge in marketing and project management. In the last 6 years he has experienced strategy development and change-/ supplier management at Daimler AG (Mercedes Benz). Yrkia Mattern (Therapist Massage)Yrkia is a professional in Shiatsu and a Therapist Masseuse.
4 Resort

Philosophy
Myanmar Hideout Villa Residence Resort 
Today, the modern industrial society is characterised by an increasing range of services, efficiency, increase profitability, overstimulation and customer world development. Back in the day this behaviour seemed desirable. But nowadays we feel stressed and even suffer from burn-out. Society is seeking a spot for rest and recreation, with a sufficient distance between holiday and daily life to recharge our body’s batteries. A symbiosis of nature and culture with opportunities to practice sports and to socialise with others is preferable.
The resort “Myanmar Hideout” is pursuing the same aim: A place for holiday makers, far from industry and big cities, with endless, lonely beaches, local exotic dishes and specialties prepared by the Islanders; getting to know Myanmar’s nature and culture.
Residences
Designed to blend in with the rich nature that surrounds it, the 20 cabins sit on the hill with views of the ocean. The cottages are predominantly constructed from natural materials in a modern, clear design with indigenous touch. They intend to present a private retreat in order to create space for quiet and concentration. Each cabin is equipped with a bathroom, a terrace, deckchairs and a comfortable covered lounge. 
Restaurant and Bar
There will be two restaurants on the premises. The international restaurant is connected to a bar. Guests can order international, vegetarian and vegan dishes.
The second restaurant, a Burmese style cuisine, has exclusively local chefs. Guests can experience the traditional cuisine of the country. The atmosphere and operating concept follows the habits of the local people.
On demand we offer special detox programs to purify the body.
Nutrition Advice and Cooking

A balanced state of nutritional, physical and mental health play an increasingly important role in our life. Brainwashed marketing strategies like processed food are quick to prepare but damage our body. Our nutritional advice class provides good knowledge about individual characteristics of nature products in order to ensure a healthy living.
Yoga and Meditation

Join daily yoga classes in a peaceful ambience surrounded by palmtrees. Take the dynamic class in the early morning for an active start into the day or join us for a restorative class in the evening to finish the day with peace and harmony. We offer dynamic styles like Vinyasa Flow and restorative classes like Yin Yoga for everybody. Be open for other steps in Yoga like Pranayama and Meditation to calm your mind.During off-peak seasons we organize Yoga Teacher Trainings.
Massage

Three types of massage will be offered:

Thai massage
Ayurvedic massage
Shiatsu massage

Water Shiatsu
Water shiatsu (Watsu) is an innovative method of relaxation. There is no active participation. In Watsu the guest slides through the water by a trainer. The goal of this method is primal emotion of security, harmonising, stimulationand healing for inner harmony.Due to movement and the massage a muscle relaxation finds place. Organs get strengthens, flexibility gets trained and it expands the joints. It will enable your life energy to flow freely again.



Sailing, Kayaking, Stand up Paddling, Boat trips

Kayaks are provided for exploring the nearby areas. Guests with a valid sailing license can get their own small boats to explore the surrounding themselves. Moreover, it is worth considering combining the cooperation of regional fisher man from different villages to join tourists on the daily fishing trips. Furthermore boat trips to the Moken (sea gipsys) and remote islands are offered. In this way guests get offered a wide range of ways to discover the archipelago.
Scuba Diving and Snorkelling
We will have trips for beginner and intermediate class where our guests 
can explore the beautiful flora and fauna of the tropical sea; e.g. 
elephant manta rays, majestic whale sharks and the colourful corals for 
makro-lovers.
The remote location, unique underwater world and the significant 
biodiversity will provide an adventurous diving experience. Due to 
location and limited boat access the spots won’t be filled with mass 
tourists.

5 Myanmar



The Country
Myanmar lies in South-East Asia bordering Bangladesh, India, China, Laos and Thailand. From north to the south it’s 2.500 km and approximately 900 km from east to west. Myanmar is double the size of Germany.Yangon is the economical and cultural centre where the foreign embassies are located and has a population of 6.5 million. Naypyidaw is where the parliament is located and in 2005, became the capital city.Myanmar has a population of 59 million from over 135 different ethnic groups. The main religion is Buddhism with 89% (Christian 5%, Muslim 4%, Hinduism and Animism 1%).Due to economic sanctions because of a predominantly military regime, the country couldn’t be reached from the outside at all until 2012.It is only now that the country is becoming more open for tourists.


To get a feeling how Myanmar looks like, try these films:
Myanmar (Burma) in 4K
Beautiful Myanmar
Hand in Hand to Myanmar
Mergui Archipelago





The resort will be located in south east Myanmar on Mergui Archipelago. Burmese name: မြိတ်ကျွန်းစု), Coordinates: 11°08’49.2″North 98°16’58.8″East. Area of 36.000 km2. Biotope to rare wildlife. Gorgeous coral reefs, white sand beaches & jungle.
The UNO classified the south-east Asian Coral Triangle as having the largest population of coral and fish species on the whole planet.
This area is inhabited by the Moken, in other words sea gypsies or nomads of the ocean. Last pristine paradise on Earth. A real hideout to feel pure nature.
Especially the south is still unexplored by tourists.


Arrival


→ Yangon → KawthaungMyanmar is increasingly interesting as a travel destination, therefore more and more airlines have started having stopovers at Myanmar’s international airport Yangon or in Mandalay. There are domestic flights from Yangon to Kawthaung, where our resort guests will get picked up by our boat.

story:
There are incredible young people across Canada working tirelessly to find solutions to climate change and sustainably live and thrive with our natural ecosystems. We see these everyday heroes speaking at climate strikes, advocating for change to big businesses, encouraging people to change their lifestyle in subtle but impactful ways, and much more. 

These young people deserve recognition, which is why we created our Top 25 Environmentalists under 25 program nine years ago. We have annually celebrated Canada’s youngest minds that are working creatively and differently about how the way we work and live, and because of them, we’ve seen change for the better. 

Since 2011, this program:

  • Has celebrated over 200 environmental leaders across Canada, ranging from ages 8-25 and from every province and territory in Canada;
  • Contributed over $60,000 in cash awards and prizes to young leaders;
  • Connected dozens of leaders together to learn and grow from each other;
  • Partnered with over 50 organizations and media outlets to amplify the message of young leaders in Canada.

"As a young change-maker seeking to leverage my influence to drive environmental action, the Top 25 under 25 Award gave me the credibility, the recognition, and a platform to amplify my work, our vision, and principles. I was so grateful for being a two-time recipient of the award that I decided to give back by volunteering as a judge and later as Board Chair of the Starfish Canada." - Tesicca Truong, Top 25 finalist

What’s happening 

In 2018, we received $100,000 from the Lawson Foundation to elevate and accelerate our work. The Lawson Foundation is taking a lead role in funding youth and environmental initiatives, and we are proud to be their partners in this endeavour. This year, they have decided to take the year to evaluate their progress in their 5th generation program, and as such, The Starfish Canada’s funding is paused for further consideration until that process is complete.

Although we were unaware of this pause until recently, we are certainly supportive of evaluative processes — for us, that’s how we ensure we’re doing the right thing. Evaluative processes are essential to how we made important decisions about our Top 25 program over the years. The value of the work the Lawson Foundation will be undertaking can’t be understated and we are excited for what outcomes they get to.

For our programming, it leaves us in a bind. With this current state of affairs and our major funder taking a pause, we are currently unable to provide the same level of support that we offered last year. 

 

What we’re doing

We’re coming to you, our community of family, friends and supporters, to help us make sure our work can continue to do our best work. Please contribute what you can to help us make 2019 one of our best years yet.

At The Starfish Canada, we believe in being as open and transparent as we can. Please note that We certainly are investigating various funding avenues to make this work continue. Our intent is that this is one of the multiple places where funding will help us do our best work, and the success of this campaign could help us secure additional funds in other places. We plan to determine when we will launch the 2019 iteration of this program after seeing how this campaign goes.

Here are some of the other things we’ve done to make 2019 a great year:

  • We’ve applied for charitable status! This is a big step, as many funders and donors prefer to get tax receipts when they donate. Our application went out in March and we expect to hear back around September.
  • We have recruited a dedicated set of incredible volunteers as part of our leadership and editorial teams. These folks are essential to making our Top 25 programs and others a success.

“Being recognized in the Starfish Top 25 amplified my voice. The support and confidence I gained helped me to advocate for climate action to SFU’s board of governors. SFU recognized me for my sustainability work in the community, which opened the door to more opportunities including admission to a master’s program in mental health research.” - Raaj Chatterjee, Top 25 finalist

What you get

We’ve lined up an amazing set of perks that you can grab. We know that giving can be a selfless act, and we want to promote giving through reciprocity. 

Anyone who donates can choose to become a member of The Starfish Canada. This gives you voting rights at our Annual General Meetings, discounts on our merchandise, and more. 

We’ve also worked with the kind folks at Coast Protein, earth’s choice, and others to provide valuable and sustainable gift packages (they sound delicious). Local artists have also stepped up to the plate to offer prints and original artwork to spruce up your home.

We also have experiences to offer. We are offering sessions with a professional coach that can help you navigate through tough life obstacles in a confidential and creative manner.  If you’re looking to engage your community and want some assistance making an engagement plan for success, we have our co-founder who can guide you through how to make sure you meet the objectives you set out for you or your organization.

Our Story

Hi, We are a group of children ages 5-17 who have teamed up with the Williams Community Forest Project to save the forest in the heart of our town from a devastating 320 acre clear-cut.  This pristine forest  is part of a major corridor for animal migration, and home to numerous endangered and threatened species such as the Red Tree Vole, Pacific Fisher, Mariposa Lily and Northern Spotted Owl. It contains the headwaters for three of our creeks which provide the people and farms of the Williams Valley with some of the cleanest drinking and irrigation water in the nation.  Because this land is privately owned, it is within the owners right to clear-cut the trees and spray noxious, cancer causing herbicides afterward which will wash down these creeks.. These are the same creeks which flow through our homes and provide irrigation water to our many organic farms.  We play in these creeks in the summer. We have decided to buy this land and turn it into a community forest which will be protected by the Williams Community Forest Project in perpetuity and preserved as a Community Forest to be used by all. It will be managed ecologically and sustainably to support and enrich our local and global forest ecology and community. We have already raised over $120,000 towards the $500,000 we need to secure a million dollar low interest loan and buy the land.


The Impact

If this campaign is not successful, the consequences are devastating.  A clearcut of this magnitude would have a disastrous effect on our local environment and economy. It would affect the entire watershed by destroying important habitat, causing massive erosion, and most likely  poisoning our water with herbicides.

 .

With your help, we plan to prevent this  clearcut by purchasing this land to secure it's future for present and future generations. We envision a forest maintained for the benefit of our local ecology and community. This community forest will provide rich educational and recreational opportunities and serve as a model for sustainable forest management.  


What We Need & What You Get


The owner has already begun clearcutting this land!  We need to raise $500,000 in order to protect what is left. We have already raised $120,000. That means we need to raise $350,000 more dollars. We are pursuing many avenues of funding including several grants, a concert, and a fund raising dinner. Please help us save this pristine forest. Any level of donation helps us toward our goal! Any donation over $250 receives a tax deductible receipt from the Williams Community Forest Project.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out.  Please don't be shy about posting this and sharing this information with your friends. The lives of many creatures depend on this! Thank-you for your support. Please read the update for further information.

story:
Marisa is Going to Brazil:

My name is Marisa Noble and I am a Sustainability student at Arizona State University with a minor in Urban Planning. What I aim to do with my degree is basically to construct large metropolises with the health of the planet in mind. I want to be able to satiate the public's desire to live in the city while also creating little to no harmful effects on the environment. In fact, I want to be able to create a city that actually is beneficial to the land and promotes biodiversity in plants as well as animals. One day, I want to be able to look upon people living alongside animals and plants without sacrificing any sort of comfort that the city has grown accustomed to. 
In Brazil, I will be a part of a program that is dealing with poverty experienced throughout the country. As seen all over the world, there is a huge gap between the wealthy and the unemployed working class and, unfortunately, it is widening every day. I will be working with about twenty other people in an effort to provide basic human rights to those who have lost so much. Many of us have never had to experience the true pain of being without food or water, not to mention hygiene or even a personal space to sleep at night. To be able to go to another country and offer aid to those who may not have the ability to help themselves means everything. So much is readily available for us which depletes its true worth and allows us to forget how fortunate we are. These basic necessities must be available to everyone. This program will also be focusing on the impact that our efforts will have on the environment. We must use Earth-friendly means as we provide these necessities to the people of Brazil. Sustainability is a constant partnership with human rights because we cannot obtain happiness of the people without being mindful towards the health of the planet and vice versa. Contributions will help me get to Brazil and participate in this program so that I may use the knowledge that I have accumulated over the years in an effort to grant basic rights to the people while also keeping the environment active, healthy, and diverse. 

What I Need in a Nutshell:

First of all, these contributions will go towards my actual arrival and departure from Brazil. To be able to fly to another country over a period of 25 hours is very costly! The first hurdle that I am attempting to tackle is my actual presence in Brazil where I will be applying my efforts and those of the people I will be working with. 

Second, contributions will also go towards my education. Since this is a program provided by Arizona State University, I will also be attending classes in Brazil. Much of this class will be interactive which requires funding, both for the holding of the class and everything we will be doing outside of the classroom. We will not be going to this country blind. This class will help prepare us for anything we may encounter and give us the knowledge we need in order to lessen the wage gap experienced by many in Brazil. Funding is necessary and needed as I prepare to take an upper level college course in another country that will equip me with everything I need to know in order to provide these rights to the people as well as the environment. 

I Am Not a Robot, I Promise:

This program means everything to me and will be the crowning achievement of my educational career. By choosing to aid me in my trip, you will not only allow me to do everything I have been aiming to do but you will also change the lives many living in poverty in Brazil. This program will not only give me the opportunity to help others living in different countries but will also satiate a small part of my incurable wanderlust. I feel a deep need to travel to as many places as I can and to be able to do that while also working with such a great program is truly an honor.  

We Are Not Stopping Here:

Even if another country is out of reach, we all still have power to help lessen the detrimental effects poverty has on the soul of a person. These efforts do not require much effort or even a large amount of time from one's schedule. The smallest of efforts can be made. These include anything from sharing our food to offering to water to volunteering at a soup kitchen. One is not required to travel to another country in order to help people. Poverty is right at the doorstep of everyone living in a city and requires the same amount of attention as anywhere else. 
As far as the environment goes, the smallest of efforts are also appreciated and easily accumulate to a larger effect. We must be mindful of our waste and dispose of everything properly. If something is able to be reused, we must recycle it either within our own homes or at a proper plant. If our destination is relatively close, biking or walking is a beneficial alternative to driving a car.
Even the most average person can help alleviate poverty and support the environment. One does not have to be a huge granola hippie that doesn't own a home and lives off of a single bowl of rice everyday in order to care for the environment and the people around them. It is our duty as a person to care for those around us. It is our duty to ensure a safe future for our grandchildren where they will have access to clean water and food. It is our duty to be mindful of the effects that the actions performed today will have on tomorrow. It is our duty to be good people. Let's go get 'em, tiger.

campaign_city: Sao Paulo, Santarem, Curitiba, B, Brazil

story:
“The way that we preserve our ceremonies and our culture, is by sharing the knowledge with those who would take the time to listen.” 

~ Grandmother Mona Polacca, Hopi/Havasupai/Tewa

The International Council of Thirteen Indigenous Grandmothers

Mitakuye pi (relatives), we call on all those who honor the Creator and support the International Council of Thirteen Indigenous Grandmother’s work to please practice generosity for the upcoming 2014 Gathering, hosted by Oglala Lakota Grandmother and Council Member, Unci (Grandmother) Rita Long Visitor Holy Dance.  The event will take place September 4 - 7, 2014 in Spearfish, South Dakota, located in the ancestral lands of the Lakota Nation.


    WHO WE ARE & OUR MISSION

    We are the International Council of Thirteen Indigenous Grandmothers who came together for the first time in October, 2004, in Phoenicia, New York.  We gathered from the four directions on the sacred land of the Iroquois Confederacy.  We came from the rainforest of the Amazon, the Alaskan Tundra of North America, the great forests of the American Northwest, the vast plains of North America, the highlands of Central America, the Black Hills of South Dakota, the mountains of Oaxaca, Mexico, the desert of the American Southwest, the mountains of Tibet, and the rainforest of West Africa.

    We have been brought together by a common vision to form a new global alliance.  Our purpose is an alliance of prayer, education, and healing for our Mother Earth – for all Her inhabitants, for all children, and for the next seven generations.

    We are deeply concerned with the unprecedented destruction of our Mother Earth; the contamination of our air, waters, and soil; the atrocities of war; the global scourge of poverty and the violence globally; the threat of nuclear weapons and waste; the epidemics that threaten the health of all of life on Mother earth; the exploitation of indigenous medicines; and the destruction of indigenous ways of life.

    We come together to nurture, educate, and train our children.  We come together to uphold the practice of our ceremonies and affirm the right to use our plant medicines free of legal restrictions. We come together to protect the lands where our peoples live and upon which our cultures depend, to safeguard the collective heritage of traditional medicines, and to defend Mother Earth.  We believe that the teachings of our ancestors will light the way through these uncertain times. 


    OUR GATHERINGS

    For the past decade, the Grandmothers have shared their messages of prayer, healing, and education globally. Thousands of people around the world have been profoundly moved by the Grandmothers prayers at each of their gatherings.
    As you can imagine, the expense of bringing the Grandmothers together from all over the world (from Alaska, Mexico, Nepal, Africa, Brazil, Canada and various parts of the United States) is enormous.

    Each official Gathering of the Grandmothers is unique to each host Grandmother’s ancestral lineage and culture, geographical location, and historical/contemporary indigenous struggles and accomplishments. 


    FUNDING REQUEST FOR UNCI RITA’S GATHERING

    Unci Rita is a Lakota elder in her late 80’s.  In her lifetime she has witnessed eight decades and more than three generations of life.  As the host, she has the unique opportunity to share her insights and wisdom as a Lakota woman and elder with those in attendance at this Gathering.

    Plans are underway for the upcoming Gathering that is to be held in Spearfish, South Dakota, hosted by Unci Rita and you can help make this Gathering possible with your financial contributions.  The event will take place in the Northern He Sapa (the Black Hills). It is in close proximity of several ancient and sacred sites to the Lakota people.

    At the 13th Gathering each grandmother plans to share her culture and tradition of prayer and teachings. The prayers of the Grandmothers needs to be heard and your financial support can make this happen.  If you are unable to make a contribution we ask for your prayers for the success of the this Gathering.

    We have a goal to raise $55,000 to help cover of the cost round trip airfare, meals, lodging, transportation, rental vans, equipment rentals, honorariums, printing, and insurance to name a few of the expenses that need to be covered. Any surplus of funds raised will be dedicated for the planning of the next Grandmother’s Gathering.

    To date we have raised over $30,000 and we need your help to ensure the safe arrival of our elderly Grandmothers, each of the Grandmother’s travel companions, and  their translators to the beautiful plains of the South Dakota.

    On behalf of Unci Rita, “Mitakuye Oyasin, Wopila Ye”, “We are all related, thank you”
    May you be blessed with Love & Light.

    INTERNATIONAL COUNCIL OF THIRTEEN INDIGENOUS GRANDMOTHERS

To date we have raised over $30,000 and we need your help to ensure the safe arrival of our elderly Grandmothers, each of the Grandmother’s travel companions, and  their translators to the beautiful plains of the South Dakota.On behalf of Unci Rita, “Mitakuye Oyasin, Wopila Ye”, “We are all related, thank you”May you be blessed with Love & Light.INTERNATIONAL COUNCIL OF THIRTEEN INDIGENOUS GRANDMOTHERS

story:
Together we can make pollution-free electricity.

But we need your help, and we need it now.

Seebeck Effect, a discovery that's been around since 1821, was only able to convert wasted heat into small amounts of energy. We're a team of scientists that came together almost a year ago determined to find methods to help solve the problems of global warming and pollution in a more meaningful and impactful way.
During our research, we had a significant breakthrough in scaling-up this “Seebeck Effect technology” that will dramatically reduce fuel consumption, and in the process, significantly reduce greenhouse gasses. The waste of energy by manufacturing plants all over the world is a huge problem (even recycling plants create waste heat that is just released into the atmosphere.) Why not take this heat and make something of it?
We created Seebeck Research to look into doing just that.

Why do we need your help?

We need to build at least one full sized generator to measure the full effect, prove this is a viable alternative and get ready to build enough production units to have an impact.
When you contribute to our campaign you'll be doing something that will really make a difference to the future of our planet.
 
"When you look at any analysis of what happens to energy in the world, the vast majority of it is lost as waste heat. Instead, this heat can be a huge part of creating a supply of clean and renewable energy."  Andrew Trickett - Executive Director at San Antonio Clean Energy Incubator.

Your Impact

We have created our prototypes and have proven that we can scale-up our technology. Now we need to create a full scale generator unit that we can test and measure. This will require a substantial investment of time and money. Our team is ready to go, and all we need is some help in getting the final funds required to purchase equipment, rent a development space and cover utilities etc.

When you contribute to our campaign you receive a Perk that memorializes your involvement in the birth of our technology. If you are able to contribute a higher amount you will receive a working, small scale model of our technology that you can provide to a student or school. The model will be inscribed with your name and the name of the recipient, and it will help the next generation understand that a change is underway, and they can be a part of it.

The demonstration unit Perk comes with simple instructions and access to an online educational description of the Seebeck Effect, and our mission to reduce global warming.

Demonstration unit Perk - It shows the Seebeck Effect in action.

Seebeck mugs for Hot Stuff! The Seebeck collector mug is one of our indiegogo Perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, please consider spreading the word about our campaign. You can go to: http://seebeckresearch.org , click on a couple of buttons and tell your Facebook friends or Tweet about Seebeck.

Thanks for your involvement and support.

story:
A 3.5 Acre Organic Farm in San Francisco?!

That's right! Alemany Farm has been growing tons of free produce for the Bay Area community for 13 years. No seriously, in 2016 our total crop yield was 11 tons (that's 22,000 pounds for the math-phobic) of organic fruits and veggies. Over the years we’ve grown to become San Francisco’s largest urban farm and second-most popular volunteer site (we see you Golden Gate Park!), all thanks to the efforts of dedicated community members, and a core group of volunteers, the Friends of Alemany Farm(FoAF).

California agriculture is unique in that farmers can plant year-round, and Alemany Farm is no exception. After a summer season full of tomatoes, cucumbers, squash, and more plums than we knew what to do with (thanks to one ambitious tree that produced over 500 pounds of plums!), we're excited for the cooler days of fall. 

Where Do We Grow From Here? 

Fall is a natural time to reflect and gather the community. We just wrapped up our Fall Workshop series, where participants learned how to plan a winter garden, make pickles, build healthy soil, keep bees, and cook using a solar oven; and though we harvest every week at the farm, we'll be throwing our annual Harvest Festival on 10/21. We'll have live music, farm tours, a pot luck BBQ (featuring a whole roast pig!), and we'll even do a little farm work for those who want to get their hands dirty. If you're in the Bay Area we hope you'll join us!

We want to keep the farm growing, and explore new methods to increase our productivity. By backing this campaign you'll help grow food for your neighbors, as well as help us offer more opportunities for community engagement in the form of more public workdays, workshops, internships, and community events.

Enter, Abby, Farm Manager Extraordinaire! 

The all-volunteer Friends of Alemany Farm have grown the farm as much as we can. To help us both maintain our current operations and expand into the areas mentioned above, we put out the call to hire our first paid farm manager, and boy did we find one!

Meet Abby Bell! 

Abby is a San Francisco native, farmer, gardener, food justice activist, and educator with over 14 years of experience working within the food system. Before taking the job as Alemany Farm Manager, she got her degree from UC Santa Cruz in Community Studies focused on sustainable urban food systems. Abby then taught produce-based cooking classes at Willard Middle school in South Berkeley followed by two years working on a diversified organic vegetable farm. In 2007 AbbyCo-founded "Food, What?!" - a farm-based youth empowerment and food justice organization in Santa Cruz county where she worked for 10 years as the Farm, Program, and Culinary Manager. 

The Breakdown: 

Here's how donations to this campaign will be distributed: 

  • Many of the new programs we're working on will be facilitated by Abby, so we're raising money to help fund her salary for the year. 
  • Though all of our workshops are run by volunteers, each have materials costs; this money will help us offer more workshops. 
  • We'd like to formalize our internship program to include educational materials, college credit, and potentially a modest stipend for our interns. The world needs more farmers, you can help that happen! 
  • After all of the rain last winter, we had a mudslide on the farm that wiped out over two dozen fruit trees. We've got some replanting to do! 
  • Last but not least, the majority of our crops start as seeds in the greenhouse, so raising money for seeds, potting soil, and greenhouse maintenance will help keep the farm vibrant. 

 Take a look at our perks and pick one that looks good to you. If you can't make any of those donations, every little bit helps, and we appreciate donations of any amount. If you're not in a place to be able to make any donations, you can still help by sharing a link to the campaign with your friends and networks!

Thank you all for your support, let's grow Alemany Farm together! 

— Friends of Alemany Farm

story:
Nafa Naana, une entreprise sociale innovante pour faciliter l’accès à l’énergie domestique

Nafa Naana, an innovative social enterprise to facilitate access to domestic energy

 

                                

 

Roseline a quatre enfants et habite à Dano, dans le Sud-Ouest du Burkina Faso. Chaque mois, alors qu’elle ne gagne que 75€, elle dépense 7,5€ pour acheter du bois pour cuisiner les repas et chauffer l’eau. Cette maman et le bébé qu’elle porte sur son dos sont exposés aux fumées de cuisson nocives au moins quatre heures par jour, quand elle cuisine. De plus, Roseline n’a pas accès à l’électricité ce qui, entre autres, empêche sa fille aînée de faire ses devoirs le soir. Les foyers améliorés et les lampes solaires pourraient aider Roseline et sa famille à vivre mieux et dépenser moins. Mais Roseline ne connait pas ces produits…

 

Roseline has four children and lives in Dano, in South-West Burkina Faso. Each month, even though she only earns $100, she spends $10 to buy firewood to cook meals and heat water. This mother and the baby she carries on her back are exposed to harmful cooking fumes at least four hours a day, when she cooks. In addition, Roseline has no access to electricity, which, among other things, prevents her eldest daughter to do her homework in the evening. Improved cookstoves and solar lamps could help Roseline and her family live better and spend less. But Roseline doesn’t know about these products ...

 

 

 

L’entreprise sociale Nafa Naana – qui signifie « le bénéfice est arrivé » en langue locale - est là pour faire connaitre les avantages de ces produits par des sensibilisations ! Ainsi :

• Nous rendons accessible au plus grand nombre de familles burkinabè des produits économiques et écologiques (foyers améliorés, lampes solaires, paniers thermos…)

• via un réseau de revendeurs détaillants à qui par ailleurs, il est donné l’occasion d’accroître ses revenus

• et par la mise en place de facilités de paiement, ce qui donne la possibilité de rembourser le produit grâce aux économies réalisées en l’utilisant.

 

The social enterprise Nafa Naana - which means "gains made easy" in local language - is there to make the benefits of these products known thanks to awareness-raising sessions! Thus :   

• We make available to the greatest number of Burkinabe families economic and ecological products (improved cookstoves, solar lamps, hayboxes ...)

• through a network of small retailers, who also are given the opportunity to increase their income

• and the implementation of credit facilities, which give the possibility to refund the product through savings done by using it

 

   

Depuis 2010, plus de 10 000 produits Nafa Naana ont été distribués. Pour découvrir nos activités, regardez la vidéo http://www.youtube.com/user/ENTREPRENEURSduMONDE

Since 2010, more than 10,000 products Nafa Naana have been distributed. To discover our activities, watch the video http://www.youtube.com/user/ENTREPRENEURSduMONDE! 

 

 

Du théâtre-forum, un mode de communication interactif pour sensibiliser les familles

Forum-Theatre, an interactive mode of communication to educate families

Pour que plus de familles comprennent les avantages des foyers améliorés et des lampes solaires, et profitent de l’offre Nafa Naana dans les villages de Gueguere, Oronkua, Koper, Dissin, Zambo et Niego, nous souhaitons organiser des représentations de théâtre-forum dans ces communautés.

So that more families understand benefits of improved cookstoves and solar lampes, and benefit from Nafa Naana offer in the villages Gueguere, Oronkua, Koper, Dissin, Zambo and Niego, we want to organize forum-theater sessions in these communities.

 

Le théâtre-forum est un mode original de communication interactive pour faire comprendre aux populations peu alphabétisées les bénéfices économiques, sociaux, sanitaires et environnementaux des produits Nafa Naana au regard des risques et inconvénients de la cuisson et de l’éclairage traditionnels.

Lors d’une séance de théâtre forum, une troupe interprète successivement plusieurs situations conflictuelles qui se terminent mal. Elles sont ensuite jouées à nouveau, exactement de la même façon, mais cette fois les spectateurs peuvent interrompre le déroulement fatidique des événements, venir sur scène pour remplacer un personnage ou en ajouter un, et tenter de briser l’oppression.

 

Forum-Theatre is an original way of interactive communication for people with low literacy skills. Thanks to it, they can become aware of the economic, social, health and environmental benefits of Nafa Naana products, as well as the risks and drawbacks of traditional cooking and lighting.

During a forum-theater session, the theater company performs successively several conflicts that end badly. They are then played again in exactly the same order, but this time the audience can stop the fateful course of events, coming on stage to replace a character or add one, and try to break oppression.

 

Nous avons besoin de vous…

We need you...

Pour mener à bien ce projet, et faire connaitre les produits Nafa Naana à Roseline et ses voisines, nous recherchons 2,8 millions FCFA, soit 5 565 US$. Ce financement servira à rémunérer la troupe de théâtre qui va concevoir la pièce et assurer les 7 représentations ainsi que coordonner la mise en œuvre des activités.

To carry out this project, and to make Nafa Naana products known to Roseline and her neighbors, we look for FCFA 2,800,000, i.e. US$ 5,565. This funding will pay for the theater company that will design the play and perform the 7 sessions, and for the coordination of the implementation of activities.

 

In compensation, you will receive:

$25 / 20€

 

Montrez votre soutien aux activités de théâtre-forum.  Vous recevrez une photo dédicacée du terrain.

Be part of theatre activities and help people be aware of economic and health benefits of Nafa Naana products. You will receive an autographed picture from the field.

         $40 / 30€

  

Participez significativement à leur réalisation. Vous recevrez une Crème Mains Karité grâce à notre partenaire la Fondation L'OCCITANE.

Help us organize these forum-theater sessions and you will receive – thanks to our partner the Occitane Foundation – a shea butter cream for hands, particularly appreciated for its nourishing and protective qualities.

For international delivery, add $6.5 / 5€

          $50 / 40€

 

Devenez membre du projet. Vous recevrez par mail le texte illustré de la pièce de théâtre et verrez votre nom apparaître dans les remerciements et sur notre blog http://afriquedelouest.entrepreneursdumonde.org/

Significantly participate to our project. You will receive the illustrated text of the play in electronic format and see your name appear in the credits and in our blog http://westafrica.entrepreneursdumonde.org/ 

         $100 / 80€

Contribuez significativement au financement d’une représentation. Nous vous enverrons un CD dédicacé du groupe burkinabè Kalyanga: http://www.myspace.com/kalyanga.

Contribute largely to finance a representation. We will send you a signed disk of the Burkinabe group of music Kayanga. Don’t wait for discovering these talented musicians following this link: http://www.myspace.com/kalyanga.

For international delivery, add $6.5 / 5€

       $300 / 230€

Soutenez largement cette campagne de communication et recevez un Coffret Karité offert par notre partenaire la Fondation L’OCCITANE.

Support Nafa Naana and receive a set of Shea-butter products offered by our partner the L’OCCITANE Foundation. L’OCCITANE beauty products are made of Shea butter sourced responsibly in Burkina Faso.

For international delivery, add $13 / 10€

      $500 / 385€

  

Mobilisez-vous auprès des acteurs qui vont assurer les représentations. Nous vous enverrons le témoignage personnel filmé de l'un d'entre eux. 

Support actors from the theater company and ensure that they are able to play in the South-West region. You will receive a personal testimony from an actor.

        $1,000 / 775€

 

Devenez membre bienfaiteur : financez la totalité d’une représentation ! Nous vous enverrons alors le livret imprimé et illustré de la pièce de théâtre que vous pourrez partager avec vos enfants et vos familles pour découvrir le Burkina Faso. Nous vous dédierons également un article sur notre blog http://afriquedelouest.entrepreneursdumonde.org/

Finance an entire representation in a village in Burkina Faso! We will send you the printed and illustrated booklet of the play, so that you can share it with your children and families to discover Burkina Faso. We also dedicate you an article on our blog. http://westafrica.entrepreneursdumonde.org/ 

For international delivery, add $6.5 / 5€

Si l’objectif budgétaire global n’est pas atteint, les fonds levés financeront un nombre inférieur de représentations théâtrales

If the overall budget target is not reached, the funds raised will fund a smaller number of forum-theater sessions.

 

Les femmes du Faso vous remercient !

Women of Burkina Faso thank you!

                                                

Ces 7 représentations de théâtre-forum permettront de sensibiliser environ 2 000 personnes sur les bénéfices économiques, environnementaux et sociaux de l’utilisation d’un foyer amélioré ou d’une lampe solaire. En supposant que 20% des spectateurs achètent un équipement de cuisson ou d’éclairage économe, cela se traduira par : 

- 2 000 Fcfa ($ 4) en moyenne économisés par famille et par mois (10% du budget d’un ménage), soit $ 1,600 économisés au total ;

- L’amélioration de la santé des familles liées à de moindres émissions de fumée et à la diminution des risques d’incendies;

- 400 arbres sauvés par mois.

 

These 7 forum-theater sessions will raise awareness of about 2,000 people on the economic, environmental and social benefits of using improved cookstoves and solar lamps. Assuming that 20% of viewers will buy an energy-efficient cooking equipment or lighting, this will result in:

- FCFA 2,000 ($ 4) average savings per family per month (10% of the household budget) or $ 1,600 savings in all;

- Improved family health in relation to lower smoke emissions and reduced fire risk;

- 400 trees saved per month.

You want to help but you can’t contribute financially? Share this link with your friends and present them Nafa Naana project.

 

Qui sommes-nous ?

Who are we?

 

Nafa Naana

   

Nafa Naana est une entreprise sociale en création, issue du projet ‘Une femme, un foyer, une forêt’ mené par l’association Entrepreneurs du Monde au Burkina Faso depuis 2010 (www.entrepreneursdumonde.org). Notre équipe compte aujourd’hui 5 personnes. Nicole et Benoit sont basés à Dano et coordonneront la tenue des représentations de théâtre-forum. Armel, Claire et Cheick sont à Ouagadougou. Ils travailleront avec la troupe sur la conception de la pièce, et ils seront vos interlocuteurs pour vous donner des nouvelles du terrain et répondre en permanence à toutes vos questions !

Nafa Naana is a social enterprise in creation, outcome of the project ‘Save for a Stove' led by the association Entrepreneurs du Monde in Burkina Faso since 2010 (www.entrepreneursdumonde.org). Our team accounts now for 5 people. Nicole and Benoit are based in Dano and coordinate forum-theater sessions. Armel, Claire and Cheick are based in Ouagadougou. They will work with the theater company on the design of plays, and they will be your contacts to give you news from the field and continuously answer to all your questions!

        

 

La Fondation L’OCCITANE

Depuis sa création en 1976, L’OCCITANE s’engage pour des actions d’intérêt général ayant un réel impact sur le terrain. En 2006, L’OCCITANE créée sa Fondation pour porter et rassembler ces initiatives.

La Fondation accompagne des projets qui couvrent 2 champs d’action : le soutien aux personnes déficientes visuelles, en France et dans le monde, et l’entrepreneuriat féminin au Burkina Faso, notamment à travers le renforcement des compétences de base (alphabétisation), l’apport de moyens financiers et techniques (microcrédit et formations) et la valorisation des actions entrepreneuriales (remise de prix). Depuis la création de la Fondation, 9 700 femmes ont bénéficié de ces programmes et plus de 500 000 personnes ont reçu des soins oculaires. 

La Fondation L’OCCITANE est partenaire de Nafa Naana depuis 2012.

Pour plus d’informations : http://foundation.loccitane.com/

 

Ever since its creation in 1976, L'OCCITANE has firmly supported actions to benefit the community that have a real impact on the ground. In 2006, L’OCCITANE created its Foundation to drive and bring together these initiatives.

The L'OCCITANE Foundation is involved in projects in two fields of action: supporting the visually impaired in France and in the world, and promoting women entrepreneurship in Burkina Faso, thanks to the reinforcement of basic knowledge and skills (literacy), financial and technical resources (microcredits and trainings) and the promotion of entrepreneurial action (rewards).

Since the creation of the Foundation, 9,700 women benefited from these programs and more than 500,000 people received eye care.

The Foundation is a partner of Nafa Naana since 2012.

For more information: http://foundation.loccitane.com/
story_txt:
Nafa Naana, une entreprise sociale innovante pour faciliter l’accès à l’énergie domestique
Nafa Naana, an innovative social enterprise to facilitate access to domestic energy
 
                                 
 
Roseline a quatre enfants et habite à Dano, dans le Sud-Ouest du Burkina Faso. Chaque mois, alors qu’elle ne gagne que 75€, elle dépense 7,5€ pour acheter du bois pour cuisiner les repas et chauffer l’eau. Cette maman et le bébé qu’elle porte sur son dos sont exposés aux fumées de cuisson nocives au moins quatre heures par jour, quand elle cuisine. De plus, Roseline n’a pas accès à l’électricité ce qui, entre autres, empêche sa fille aînée de faire ses devoirs le soir. Les foyers améliorés et les lampes solaires pourraient aider Roseline et sa famille à vivre mieux et dépenser moins. Mais Roseline ne connait pas ces produits…
 
Roseline has four children and lives in Dano, in South-West Burkina Faso. Each month, even though she only earns $100, she spends $10 to buy firewood to cook meals and heat water. This mother and the baby she carries on her back are exposed to harmful cooking fumes at least four hours a day, when she cooks. In addition, Roseline has no access to electricity, which, among other things, prevents her eldest daughter to do her homework in the evening. Improved cookstoves and solar lamps could help Roseline and her family live better and spend less. But Roseline doesn’t know about these products ...
 
  
 
L’entreprise sociale Nafa Naana – qui signifie « le bénéfice est arrivé » en langue locale - est là pour faire connaitre les avantages de ces produits par des sensibilisations ! Ainsi :
• Nous rendons accessible au plus grand nombre de familles burkinabè des produits économiques et écologiques (foyers améliorés, lampes solaires, paniers thermos…)
• via un réseau de revendeurs détaillants à qui par ailleurs, il est donné l’occasion d’accroître ses revenus
• et par la mise en place de facilités de paiement, ce qui donne la possibilité de rembourser le produit grâce aux économies réalisées en l’utilisant.
 
The social enterprise Nafa Naana - which means "gains made easy" in local language - is there to make the benefits of these products known thanks to awareness-raising sessions! Thus :    
• We make available to the greatest number of Burkinabe families economic and ecological products (improved cookstoves, solar lamps, hayboxes ...)
• through a network of small retailers, who also are given the opportunity to increase their income
• and the implementation of credit facilities, which give the possibility to refund the product through savings done by using it
 
    
Depuis 2010, plus de 10 000 produits Nafa Naana ont été distribués. Pour découvrir nos activités, regardez la vidéo http://www.youtube.com/user/ENTREPRENEURSduMONDE
Since 2010, more than 10,000 products Nafa Naana have been distributed. To discover our activities, watch the video http://www.youtube.com/user/ENTREPRENEURSduMONDE!  
 
 
Du théâtre-forum, un mode de communication interactif pour sensibiliser les familles
Forum-Theatre, an interactive mode of communication to educate families
Pour que plus de familles comprennent les avantages des foyers améliorés et des lampes solaires, et profitent de l’offre Nafa Naana dans les villages de Gueguere, Oronkua, Koper, Dissin, Zambo et Niego, nous souhaitons organiser des représentations de théâtre-forum dans ces communautés.
So that more families understand benefits of improved cookstoves and solar lampes, and benefit from Nafa Naana offer in the villages Gueguere, Oronkua, Koper, Dissin, Zambo and Niego, we want to organize forum-theater sessions in these communities.
 
Le théâtre-forum est un mode original de communication interactive pour faire comprendre aux populations peu alphabétisées les bénéfices économiques, sociaux, sanitaires et environnementaux des produits Nafa Naana au regard des risques et inconvénients de la cuisson et de l’éclairage traditionnels.
Lors d’une séance de théâtre forum, une troupe interprète successivement plusieurs situations conflictuelles qui se terminent mal. Elles sont ensuite jouées à nouveau, exactement de la même façon, mais cette fois les spectateurs peuvent interrompre le déroulement fatidique des événements, venir sur scène pour remplacer un personnage ou en ajouter un, et tenter de briser l’oppression.
 
Forum-Theatre is an original way of interactive communication for people with low literacy skills. Thanks to it, they can become aware of the economic, social, health and environmental benefits of Nafa Naana products, as well as the risks and drawbacks of traditional cooking and lighting.
During a forum-theater session, the theater company performs successively several conflicts that end badly. They are then played again in exactly the same order, but this time the audience can stop the fateful course of events, coming on stage to replace a character or add one, and try to break oppression.
 
Nous avons besoin de vous…
We need you...
Pour mener à bien ce projet, et faire connaitre les produits Nafa Naana à Roseline et ses voisines, nous recherchons 2,8 millions FCFA, soit 5 565 US$. Ce financement servira à rémunérer la troupe de théâtre qui va concevoir la pièce et assurer les 7 représentations ainsi que coordonner la mise en œuvre des activités.
To carry out this project, and to make Nafa Naana products known to Roseline and her neighbors, we look for FCFA 2,800,000, i.e. US$ 5,565. This funding will pay for the theater company that will design the play and perform the 7 sessions, and for the coordination of the implementation of activities.
 
In compensation, you will receive:



$25 / 20€

 


Montrez votre soutien aux activités de théâtre-forum.  Vous recevrez une photo dédicacée du terrain.
Be part of theatre activities and help people be aware of economic and health benefits of Nafa Naana products. You will receive an autographed picture from the field.




         $40 / 30€
   


 Participez significativement à leur réalisation. Vous recevrez une Crème Mains Karité grâce à notre partenaire la Fondation L'OCCITANE.
Help us organize these forum-theater sessions and you will receive – thanks to our partner the Occitane Foundation – a shea butter cream for hands, particularly appreciated for its nourishing and protective qualities.
For international delivery, add $6.5 / 5€




          $50 / 40€
 


Devenez membre du projet. Vous recevrez par mail le texte illustré de la pièce de théâtre et verrez votre nom apparaître dans les remerciements et sur notre blog http://afriquedelouest.entrepreneursdumonde.org/
Significantly participate to our project. You will receive the illustrated text of the play in electronic format and see your name appear in the credits and in our blog http://westafrica.entrepreneursdumonde.org/ 




         $100 / 80€



Contribuez significativement au financement d’une représentation. Nous vous enverrons un CD dédicacé du groupe burkinabè Kalyanga: http://www.myspace.com/kalyanga.
Contribute largely to finance a representation. We will send you a signed disk of the Burkinabe group of music Kayanga. Don’t wait for discovering these talented musicians following this link: http://www.myspace.com/kalyanga.
For international delivery, add $6.5 / 5€




       $300 / 230€



Soutenez largement cette campagne de communication et recevez un Coffret Karité offert par notre partenaire la Fondation L’OCCITANE. 
Support Nafa Naana and receive a set of Shea-butter products offered by our partner the L’OCCITANE Foundation. L’OCCITANE beauty products are made of Shea butter sourced responsibly in Burkina Faso.
For international delivery, add $13 / 10€




      $500 / 385€
   


Mobilisez-vous auprès des acteurs qui vont assurer les représentations. Nous vous enverrons le témoignage personnel filmé de l'un d'entre eux. 
Support actors from the theater company and ensure that they are able to play in the South-West region. You will receive a personal testimony from an actor.




        $1,000 / 775€ 
 


Devenez membre bienfaiteur : financez la totalité d’une représentation ! Nous vous enverrons alors le livret imprimé et illustré de la pièce de théâtre que vous pourrez partager avec vos enfants et vos familles pour découvrir le Burkina Faso. Nous vous dédierons également un article sur notre blog http://afriquedelouest.entrepreneursdumonde.org/
Finance an entire representation in a village in Burkina Faso! We will send you the printed and illustrated booklet of the play, so that you can share it with your children and families to discover Burkina Faso. We also dedicate you an article on our blog. http://westafrica.entrepreneursdumonde.org/ 
For international delivery, add $6.5 / 5€



Si l’objectif budgétaire global n’est pas atteint, les fonds levés financeront un nombre inférieur de représentations théâtrales
If the overall budget target is not reached, the funds raised will fund a smaller number of forum-theater sessions.
 
Les femmes du Faso vous remercient !
Women of Burkina Faso thank you!
                                                 
Ces 7 représentations de théâtre-forum permettront de sensibiliser environ 2 000 personnes sur les bénéfices économiques, environnementaux et sociaux de l’utilisation d’un foyer amélioré ou d’une lampe solaire. En supposant que 20% des spectateurs achètent un équipement de cuisson ou d’éclairage économe, cela se traduira par :

- L’amélioration de la santé des familles liées à de moindres émissions de fumée et à la diminution des risques d’incendies;
- 400 arbres sauvés par mois.
 
These 7 forum-theater sessions will raise awareness of about 2,000 people on the economic, environmental and social benefits of using improved cookstoves and solar lamps. Assuming that 20% of viewers will buy an energy-efficient cooking equipment or lighting, this will result in:

- Improved family health in relation to lower smoke emissions and reduced fire risk;
- 400 trees saved per month.

story:
Mouthwateringly Tantalizing
Acorn Cookies and other great perks 
for your contribution!

A plethora of information at www.iloveacorns.com!

The Acorn Center is ready to open if we can get a new roof! The Hamada Acorn Initiative creates sustainable income from an ancient oak forest for farm families in Greece where the economic crisis has hit hardest.

The World's 1st Acorn Bakery

Sweet & Savoury, Low and Zero Gluten Treats will show the world just how versatile acorns can be. Acorn tortillas, pan bread, muffins, cookies, pudding, jelly and much more will be served with local organic ingredients.

Quercus Ithaburensis  (Valonia Oak) have giant acorns up to 40g each! 

2012 film for even more information about the Acorn Adventure on Kea:
(GREEK version on the Gallery page)


http://www.huffingtonpost.com/marisa-churchill/i-love-acorns_b_4395356.html


We will continue to offer FREE adult and children's seminars as well as our 1/2 day activities for schools from the mainland. Here are the connections we've already made:


Greek and International Press for the Acorn Initiative:


Thank you for taking a few minutes out of your day to watch Natasha Blatsiou's 4 minute film about the Acorn Initiative on Kea. We hope it made you smile!


Click the GALLERY tab at the top for 3 more videos about Oaks and Acorns on Kea.

story:
What we want to do

We want to drive a car from England to Mongolia on 100% pure plant oil, eg. no fossil fuels. We will be driving in the charity rally, Mongol Rally, hosted by the Adventurist (http://www.theadventurists.com/the-adventures/mongol-rally).

We are a team of four people taking on this quest, and we want to show to the world that it is possible to do better things for the climate today and not tomorrow. We do not need to wait for better fuel alternatives, we already have them.

We want to get funding to make this trip and also to talk about it so that people will be aware of the alternatives to fossil fuels.

For more information see http://www.therollingpotatowagon.com/index.php/en/

The journey will start in Chichchester, England on 13/6-2013 and will last 6 weeks.

What we need:

For this project to succeed we need to get some funding. The most important things are:

  • Car which will have to be prepared to drive on plant oil (approx. 3000£)
  • Plant oil for the car on the journey (approx. 1500£)
  • Insurance + maintainance for the car + visas (approx. 3000£)

Because it is a charity rally we will also be raising money for charity. We will raise money for two charities, Cool Eart (http://www.coolearth.org/) and Denmarks Society for Nature Conservation (http://www.dn.dk/default.aspx) (Danmarks Naturfredningsforening).

Cool Earth is chosen as charity by the organizers, and Denmarks Society for Nature Conservation (DN) is a charity which we have chosen. DN is working for a beautiful and varied landscape, a rich and diverse nature and a clean and healthy environment in Denmark. Cool Earth is a charity working with local communities to secure forests at risk of being destroyed within the next 18 months. Only 10% of donations are spent on admin and governance, making sure every penny possible goes on safeguarding our climate.

We will donate a minimum of 1000£ to the charities, but preferably much more. Of couse all proceeds will go the charities.

Together with this campaing we are seeking sponsors to donate equipment, knowledge and funds for the project, and it is very important to spread the message to attract sponsors and get the message to the people.

The Impact

The project will increase the knowledge of solutions and changes about the climate changes and the following global warming.

Climate changes are known throughout the whole existence of the earth, and we know of times where the earth was totally covered by ice, and of times where it was like a green house.

What makes climate changes to something special today is that they are caused by human actions.

It is the increasing amount of CO2 in the atmosphere, which creates the changes in the weather, the meltdown of the ice caps and the increasing global temperature.

Therefore it is important to take a stand on these changes and accept, that something must be done in order for the earth to stay as it is today.

Other Ways You Can Help

We ask not only for funding, but also publicity, we want to tell a story, and share our story.

We are also looking for spare parts for the car, and knowledge about alternative fuels, which we will be very happy to get as well.

We also need solar panels to charge our electrical equipment, for this we need solar panels end power converters.
