story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Philippe, and I am a filmmaker. I have done more than 50 documentaries for BBC, 20th Century Fox, French TV, and Indie Productions.  I am experienced in video and sound production as well as post-production.   My wife Maxine has over 10 years of experience in the entertainment industry.  She has appeared as an actress on NYPD Blue and City of Angels, she is now a screenwriter.

We have become aware of a disaster going on in the Pacific Ocean: The Plastic Island floating twice the size of Texas. Well, in fact, it’s not an island floating. It’s worse than that. It is like a soup floating at different depth, with different size plastic.

This plastic right now is killing about a million birds worldwide every year, and 100,000 marine mammals. We are responsible for that, not only as a nation but as a human race. If we don't stop right now, we are going into a disaster. The plastic is releasing chemicals into the ocean and polluting our source of life. After doing research we estimate that the Pacific Patch is going to reach the West Coast of America in about 4 years....Then we will see hundreds of dolphins, sea lions and whales dead on our beaches...

It is time to radically change our habit with plastic worldwide.

That is why we are doing this documentary, and will translate it to as many languages as we possibly can to reach the entire population on earth.

It seems that when people see what is really going on, their common sense of survival makes them change, for the better, and for the betterment of future generations to come.

As a contributor, you will help us to achieve this goal of awareness worldwide.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $50,000 to achieve this goal. $12,000 is going toward the video and sound equipment.  $20,000 is going towards the travel expenses (Plastic garbage sites: Hawaii big Island, Kauai, Atolls, Pacific Garbage Patch, Malaysia beaches), $4000 for the post-production, $1000 for the voice over, $8,000 for the online promotion worldwide to reach 1 million view worldwide the first month, and the rest in payment processing fees from this site.

If we don't reach our entire goal, then we will still do the documentary with what we have. However, it will take much more time...

Everyone will still have his film copy or online digital copy, and you will be on the films credit roll as a contributor.   Remember, this film is going to be viewed by millions of people worldwide.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a huge difference. As a human race, we can have a chance to survive the future if everyone is aware of the damage we are creating. We have already wiped out hundreds of ocean wildlife species from our world forever. What is our heritage that we will leave to our kids, and the future generations? If we have a chance to do something about it, let's take it. Let's make the world aware!

I know we can make a difference. I am a successful business owner here is Los Angeles and I started from zero. So, I know we can make this a success! (Here is my website: www.studio116corp.com)

And here is my Facebook page: www.facebook.com/phil.carillo.3

We just opened a non-profit EXODUS RESEARCH INSTITUTE, and started to create clips about the Ocean Pollution. Check this out: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Exodus-Research-Institute/627896203887481

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you cannot contribute and are willing to help, you are welcome. Just spread the word, and make some noise about this campaign.  Use Indiegogo share tools, and let us know what you did. We will really appreciate it!

We also need people who have expertise in social networking, online advertising, grant researcher, online fundraising…Send us a line!

Thank you so much for being a part of it!

Philippe and Maxine
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Hello my name is Philippe, and I am a filmmaker. I have done more than 50 documentaries for BBC, 20th Century Fox, French TV, and Indie Productions.  I am experienced in video and sound production as well as post-production.   My wife Maxine has over 10 years of experience in the entertainment industry.  She has appeared as an actress on NYPD Blue and City of Angels, she is now a screenwriter.
We have become aware of a disaster going on in the Pacific Ocean: The Plastic Island floating twice the size of Texas. Well, in fact, it’s not an island floating. It’s worse than that. It is like a soup floating at different depth, with different size plastic.
This plastic right now is killing about a million birds worldwide every year, and 100,000 marine mammals. We are responsible for that, not only as a nation but as a human race. If we don't stop right now, we are going into a disaster. The plastic is releasing chemicals into the ocean and polluting our source of life. After doing research we estimate that the Pacific Patch is going to reach the West Coast of America in about 4 years....Then we will see hundreds of dolphins, sea lions and whales dead on our beaches...
It is time to radically change our habit with plastic worldwide.
That is why we are doing this documentary, and will translate it to as many languages as we possibly can to reach the entire population on earth.
It seems that when people see what is really going on, their common sense of survival makes them change, for the better, and for the betterment of future generations to come.
As a contributor, you will help us to achieve this goal of awareness worldwide.
What We Need & What You Get
We need $50,000 to achieve this goal. $12,000 is going toward the video and sound equipment.  $20,000 is going towards the travel expenses (Plastic garbage sites: Hawaii big Island, Kauai, Atolls, Pacific Garbage Patch, Malaysia beaches), $4000 for the post-production, $1000 for the voice over, $8,000 for the online promotion worldwide to reach 1 million view worldwide the first month, and the rest in payment processing fees from this site.
If we don't reach our entire goal, then we will still do the documentary with what we have. However, it will take much more time...
Everyone will still have his film copy or online digital copy, and you will be on the films credit roll as a contributor.   Remember, this film is going to be viewed by millions of people worldwide.
The Impact
Your contribution will make a huge difference. As a human race, we can have a chance to survive the future if everyone is aware of the damage we are creating. We have already wiped out hundreds of ocean wildlife species from our world forever. What is our heritage that we will leave to our kids, and the future generations? If we have a chance to do something about it, let's take it. Let's make the world aware!
I know we can make a difference. I am a successful business owner here is Los Angeles and I started from zero. So, I know we can make this a success! (Here is my website: www.studio116corp.com)
And here is my Facebook page: www.facebook.com/phil.carillo.3
We just opened a non-profit EXODUS RESEARCH INSTITUTE, and started to create clips about the Ocean Pollution. Check this out: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Exodus-Research-Institute/627896203887481
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you cannot contribute and are willing to help, you are welcome. Just spread the word, and make some noise about this campaign.  Use Indiegogo share tools, and let us know what you did. We will really appreciate it!
We also need people who have expertise in social networking, online advertising, grant researcher, online fundraising…Send us a line!
Thank you so much for being a part of it!
Philippe and Maxine

story:
Who We Are 

We are seven students traveling exclusively by bicycle from New Orleans to Houston to draw attention to climate change and the locally affected communities. Our purpose is to connect a network of community members. We also hope to open up a dialogue between the two "sides" of this movement, those who depend on oil and gas production for their livliehood and those who want to move beyond fossil fuels. 

Help support our journey! Your contributions will be put towards the organization feeding and housing us this summer as we travel from town to town, carrying only what we can pull behind us and whole lot of hope.

Our goal is to raise $2500 dollars by the end of our program, July 31st, for a summer of asking the fossil fuel industry to examine alternatives to the finite resources we depend on today. 

Why We're Doing What We're Doing

"Warming of 4°C can still be avoided: numerous studies show that there are techinically and economically feasible emissions pathways to hold warming likely below 2°C. Thus the level of impacts that developing countries and the rest of the world experience will be a result of government, private sector, and civil society decisions and choices, including, unfotunatley, inaction."

From Turn Down the Heat: Why A 4°C World Must Be Avoided, put out by The World Bank in 2012. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Find us on facebook or follow our ride along the Gulf Coast!

story:
On “The Simple Things"campaign front there have been developments. I am partnering with and joining an eco-agency who will be helping to make this happen. I don't have any more detail at the moment but can say the project will be a great fit for them.

Once I entered into talks I stopped actively promoting the campaign. That is why there has been no activity since the holidays.

You can still support the campaign by contributing but the production timings will be later now. More on this when I have firm details.

I will be happy to provide refunds for anyone who finds this unacceptable.

All the simple, effective energy efficiency measures in one convenient, affordable, online interactive guide. With just the slightest hint of fun!

Now to the serious stuff, but there is a dance remix of the main video half way down to ease your journey!

A little about David and CHOOSE Knowing.
Why this will make a difference!
Why Should we care?
Testimonials & Endorsements.
So what will the guide look like?
How will it be delivered?
Energy efficiency can be pretty dull stuff!
Some examples of things covered in the guide.
What has happened so far?
What we need to continue on the journey!
Other important stuff?
What are we offering as perks.
Other Ways to Help.
A thousand "simple" thanks.

Our world and life support system is changing fast!

Global warming, increasing weather severity, escalating energy costs and energy security. This can start to feel a little overwhelming.

It really doesn't have to be overwhelming!

There are lots of small, simple but collectively effective things we can ALL do in our homes.

I want to try and change the way we view energy efficiency in the home. It does not need to be tedious, expensive and/or confusing to carry out effective energy efficiency measures. More often than not it only involves slight alterations to our lifestyles.

Start with the simple things and hopefully, use that as a springboard for the bigger bolder stuff!

My vision, is to create a social enterprise that produces simple, fun and affordable products that are used to help people make their homes more energy efficient. Helping people heal the planet and lower their bills!

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

I have spent close to twenty years working in the environment, web and online-learning fields. Working on the largest government education web sites to the smallest of organisations and not-for-profits.

In the last five years I have worked directly in the energy efficiency field. In that time I have met, interacted with and spoken to hundreds if not thousands of homeowners. I now have a clear idea of what is needed!

The general message is, most people want to do something but are often confused by what to do and more importantly where and how to start. There is a lot of information out there but it is often hard to find and can be contradictory and worse still, inaccurate.

What is needed is an affordable and dependable online guide, fact checked by industry experts.

We have the passion, knowledge and experience to develop this online interactive guide!

In my view there is no better time to get this easy to follow, online interactive guide out there! It is needed and in my opinion needs a little injection of fun in there too!

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

This is one example of how doing just one simple thing, can create real change.

There are many more examples of simple changes that can create greater savings and help the planet.

Saving energy is an investment we can all make; not only financially but more importantly, to leave a habitable planet for future generations.

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

There is a rapidly developing climate and energy crises playing out. I'm not suggesting this will solve it, but every little helps as they say!

Collectively, these small actions if carried out by enough of us can amount to a very big deal. Not just for energy efficiency but also the collective health of the planet and all it’s inhabitants!

"Large streams from little fountains flow, Tall oaks from little acorns grow."
14th century proverb.

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

"You may have "touched a nerve" with this that could be very transformational, something that has the potential to coalesce the whole energy efficiency industry. "

Thomas A. Peterson - CEO at Solar Design & Construction.

"Great idea, I wish you success."

Hans-Jörn Eich - Owner Pinwheel Building Supplies and passive house proponent.

"Keep up the good work the planet needs you!"

My very sweet mother.

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

The demo video gives a good insight as to how the interface will look, feel and function.

WARNING!!! This is the full dance remix version so maybe you should sit down. Better still, stand up and throw some shapes!

Note: If for whatever reason it won't play there is a Vimeo version in the gallery up top! Failing that here's a nice still shot!

The guide will be graphically rich with animations, quizzes, puzzles, photographs and videos. This will provide real-world easy to follow examples of energy saving tips and tricks. A friendly, knowledgeable, and devilishly sexy receptacle, Reynard, will narrate every detail. Print-based materials (hopefully infographics) will be available to supplement the online guide. The guide will also be "accessible" and therefore, available to the numerous groups who struggle with online content and are also frequently overlooked.

The guide will also highlight:

  • Potential money savings with Return On Investment (ROI) calculations.
  • Greenhouse gas savings.
  • To illustrate the point that small things really do make a difference, "Equivalents" such as number of cars off road and virtual power stations will be used.

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

The guide will be delivered online via a Learning Management System (LMS). The benefits of this are:

  • Accurate tracking and reporting.
  • Easily updated.
  • Self paced "in your own time" learning.
  • Have the ability to record a pledge (what you are going to try and achieve)

The guide will act as a standalone "paid for" service which, will act as a revenue generator for future developments which, could include:

  • Smart phone app.
  • A full set of infographics based on the guide.
  • Children’s interactive eBook.
  • More in-depth residential energy efficiency guides.

The guide will be available to ALL but could also be used for a subsidised** community driven scheme. For instance the guide could be backed up by a door to door community volunteer program with free give-away in addition to the guide.

**The guide could be subsidised/supported by organisations such as:

  • Insurance companies.
  • Property management companies.
  • Local government.
  • Energy related utilities.
  • Large corporate sponsors (in exchange for co-branding for instance)
  • Hardware stores.
  • Efficiency "not for profits" and Demand Side Management (DSM) companies who, could "buy" the energy savings for their programs.

There will also be an optional "pledge system". This will record what the user plans to do in an allotted time frame. This could be backed with a money back guarantee if the user doesn't save the cost equivalent of the guide!

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

It can, dare I say it… be fun!

"This saving energy thing and helping the planet does not have to involve you living in a cave!"

Think of it as a game or competition you can do with your entire family, friends and neighbours. Most of us like some healthy competition and it does not get much better than helping the planet and saving some money to boot. This could form part of a street/condo/apartment energy saving league table. Buy a cheap energy meter from your local hardware store and bask in your glory!

"Reynard, bringing the sexy back to small appliances"

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

The guide will focus on the many small yet effective energy efficient measures you can carry out in the “standard home”. It will also cater to the often overlooked apartment/condominium sector. Here are some of measures covered:

  • The use of CFL/LED lighting.
  • Small and large appliance best practice.
  • Power bars, timers and meters (smart or otherwise).
  • Motion sensing switches.
  • Faucet aerators, low flow shower-heads and hot water use.
  • Thermostat and heating controls.
  • Energy efficient Christmas/Holidays add-ons.
  • Home office and multimedia equipment.

To name but a few!

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

Proof of concept!

  • The graphical user interface or GUI has been designed.*
  • Kitchen/diner area has been (almost) fully modeled.*
  • Low Resolution 3D and line renderings have been tested of the kitchen diner area.*
  • Some High Definition or HD video footage has been produced.*
  • Partner engagement is ongoing.
  • Selected viewings of the demo have been carried out with user feedback.
  • Scoping document has been produced for crowd funding and other investors/partners.
  • Other experts in the field have been consulted with.

* If you haven't already viewed the videos then please do!

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

If you require a full breakdown of the costs just contact me please.

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

The interactive guide also needs to be affordable for the those on tight budgets. Crowd funding on Indiegogo will allow that! My target is to produce this guide for under $25 per guide.

If we raise enough I would also like to take on extra personnel for the development phase and beyond.

Only you can make this project happen and give the planet a helping hand along the way!

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

See perk graphic below then use this link to go the "perks" section above left!

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

  • Please endorse the project with a few kind words.
  • Give me a testimonial of you are feeling wordy.
  • If you have a sustainability related business or otherwise, then please please please give me a shout on your web site or social media page(s).
  • If you are a tenant then ask your property manager/owner to take a look at the campaign.

For whatever reason, some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Sign up to the CHOOSE Knowing facebook page for updates and freebies.
  • Just Google "CHOOSE Knowing Facebook". I will send you a 10% discount coupon per "Like" for the release candidate guide when it is ready.

Go back to the top of the page or continue reading

Thanks to all my friends and family for being, well... awesome!

story:
We are 22 vibrant, driven and highly skilled people wanting to spread practices of regenerative living and build a network of impact centers throughout the U.S, Mexico and Central America.
(La versión española se encuentra por debajo)

http://projectnuevomundo.org/odyssey/

Our mission is To build an on-the-ground network and provide imperative, regenerative technology skills and labor and professional media and publicity to festivals, impact centers and communities in the United States, Mexico and Central America.

 

Vision
Imagine that there is an active Earth Odyssey on each continent, building self-sufficient homesteads and villages from the ground up while training and empowering passionate individuals to make their own dreams come true, traveling with intention and connecting to new projects and expanding the network's reach. We envision a world of all beings living in harmony with the ecosystem and creating transformational experiences for people to rekindle their tribal wisdom.

Short Summary

Earth Odyssey will leave a positive trace at nine impact centers and transformational festivals by providing skilled labor, professional media and publicity, and an array of workshops taught by our econauts to bring communities into living in balance with the planet. We will strengthen the network between these centers on the ground and online to increase their visibility by releasing 3-minute films throughout the journey. Previous to enlisting in service to the Earth Odyssey, both buses on board have exceptional histories as vehicles for community service. Twenty econauts, two buses, and a mission to build a network of interlinked impact centers = a potent formula, ripe with the potential to catalyze a movement. We can do this, together.

What We Need

To cover all of our expenses and to empower us to fully realize the mission we are embarking upon, we seek to raise $30 000 (We are asking $20 000 from our community as we are attempting to raise funds from other sources as well). The budget breaks down as follows:

What You Get

For rewards, we have an array of special offerings to thank our supporters, such as private classes with Econauts, media packages, life-changing and educational experiences facilitated by Project Nuevo Mundo, lots of beautiful hand-made souvenirs made with love by econauts, and memoirs of the journey!

You'll also get to join us in this growing network of intentional travelers who are making a difference in the world. Travel and develop your skills, find experiences, and arrive at beautiful new sites to join communities that will be so happy to have you and your gifts. You get your own story, written on your own network-- like a LinkedIn and Wwoof crossover for your community that regrows the planet.


Earthcrafts
The Cobra Bus

The Cobra Bus has been a fully functional mobile community for over five years, visiting and being of service to communities, transporting people cross-country and serving as a kitchen and dormitory in many different environments.

The Blacksmith Bus

The veggie-powered Blacksmith Bus has served as a mobile service for communities and individuals, creating useful tools from recycled steel.

 

The Impact

By participating in our campaign, you are having a direct impact by:

  • You are helping us develop a model for ecovillage-building, and a methodology for ecovillage-building education that we plan on spreading far and wide on many continents!

  • You are providing regenerative technology installations and permaculture to impact centers. and communities who need it throughout the U.S, Mexico and Central America!

  • You are providing heavy publicity to emerging leaders building centers that are growing the new world through photo’s and 3-minute video clips weekly and posted live and promoted through our website and networks!

  • You are increasing the momentum of our movement to build a new world by connecting to like-minded projects in Latin America, establishing crucial relationships that will solidify our network and enable everyone to find the projects they are looking for and learn the skills they need!

  • You are enabling 22 young, passionate and skillful leaders who are dedicating their lives to creating a regenerative planet to expand their ability to create large transformation on the planet!


Econauts

Our 22 Econauts have been selected through a rigorous application process, and have been singled out due to their passion, their mission in life, and their skill sets that will enable the Earth Odyssey be more able to fully support the development of impact centers and projects. You are enabling 22 young, passionate and skillful leaders who are dedicating their lives to creating a regenerative planet to expand their ability to create large transformation on the planet!We hope to inspire more earthlings to become econauts!


Brennan Bird, a bottle brick and cob teacher and builder.
http://www.bottlebrick.com/



Jessica Perlstein, an organic gardener, and visionary muralist supporting sustainability and the new world.
www.dreamstreamart.com/

 

Our Partner: JUSTA - Comida Vida

JUSTA has developed a health and nutrition course for the artisans we work with and other women around Lake Atitlan. Comida Vida offers workshops on nutrition and wellness, and provides sustainable, accessible alternatives to the processed foods that have replaced the traditional diet of indigenous families. http://www.justafairtrade.org/communityprograms/health/


Other Ways You Can Help!

  • Join our Crowdfunding Campaign Team!

  • Share this on your social media networks

  • Sponsor Us! Contact Shayna(at)projectnuevomundo.org to receive our sponsorship package.

  • Reach out to media publications and press see if they’d like to write an article about this!

  • Attend a fundraising event:

    • Re-Inhabiting the Village at Emerald VIllage EcoVillage in Vista, CA - 10/2
      https://www.facebook.com/events/223680857785147/

    • Earth Odyssey Fundraiser at PLACE in Oakland - October 5th
      https://www.facebook.com/events/433677353415523/

 


Impact Centers & Festivals We’re Visiting

Atitlan Organics


Atitlan Organics is a demonstration and education site for organic farming techniques. Beyond their production for local markets, they are actively working to build a cooperative of local growers that all sell under one brand name. They will provide food and seed donations, and will be collaborating additionally  with us in the future.

www.atitlanorganics.com

The Vision Council at Nierika

A workshop hosted by The Vision Council in Mexico at Nierika, one of the first stops on our tour. The Vision Council a networking event between indigenous tribes and ecovillages across Mexico.

Our team has dedicated our lives to making this world one that is thriving and abundant for future generations. We are infinitely grateful for your support in helping us make this goal a reality.

Love and Light

PNM Team & Econauts
story_txt:
We are 22 vibrant, driven and highly skilled people wanting to spread practices of regenerative living and build a network of impact centers throughout the U.S, Mexico and Central America.(La versión española se encuentra por debajo)

http://projectnuevomundo.org/odyssey/
Our mission is To build an on-the-ground network and provide imperative, regenerative technology skills and labor and professional media and publicity to festivals, impact centers and communities in the United States, Mexico and Central America.

 
VisionImagine that there is an active Earth Odyssey on each continent, building self-sufficient homesteads and villages from the ground up while training and empowering passionate individuals to make their own dreams come true, traveling with intention and connecting to new projects and expanding the network's reach. We envision a world of all beings living in harmony with the ecosystem and
 creating transformational experiences for people to rekindle their 
tribal wisdom.

Short Summary

Earth Odyssey will leave a positive trace at nine impact centers and transformational festivals by providing skilled labor, professional media and publicity, and an array of workshops taught by our econauts to bring communities into living in balance with the planet. We will strengthen the network between these centers on the ground and online to increase their visibility by releasing 3-minute films throughout the journey.  Previous to enlisting in service to the Earth Odyssey, both buses on board have exceptional histories as vehicles for community service. Twenty econauts, two buses, and a mission to build a network of interlinked impact centers = a potent formula, ripe with the potential to catalyze a movement. We can do this, together.

What We Need 


To cover all of our expenses and to empower us to fully realize the mission we are embarking upon, we seek to raise $30 000 (We are asking $20 000 from our community as we are attempting to raise funds from other sources as well). The budget breaks down as follows:

What You Get
For rewards, we have an array of special offerings to thank our supporters, such as private classes with Econauts, media packages, life-changing and educational experiences facilitated by Project Nuevo Mundo, lots of beautiful hand-made souvenirs made with love by econauts, and memoirs of the journey!
You'll also get to join us in this growing network of intentional travelers who are making a difference in the world. Travel and develop your skills, find experiences, and arrive at beautiful new sites to join communities that will be so happy to have you and your gifts. You get your own story, written on your own network-- like a  LinkedIn and Wwoof crossover for your community that regrows the planet.



EarthcraftsThe Cobra BusThe Cobra Bus has been a fully functional mobile community for over five years, visiting and being of service to communities, transporting people cross-country and serving as a kitchen and dormitory in many different environments. The Blacksmith BusThe veggie-powered Blacksmith Bus has served as a mobile service for communities and individuals, creating useful tools from recycled steel.
 

The Impact



By participating in our campaign, you are having a direct impact by: 



You are helping us develop a model for ecovillage-building, and a methodology for ecovillage-building education that we plan on spreading far and wide on many continents!



You are providing regenerative technology installations and permaculture to impact centers. and communities who need it throughout the U.S, Mexico and Central America!



You are providing heavy publicity to emerging leaders building centers that are growing the new world through photo’s and 3-minute video clips weekly and posted live and promoted through our website and networks!






You are increasing the momentum of our movement to build a new world by connecting to like-minded projects in Latin America, establishing crucial relationships that will solidify our network and enable everyone to find the projects they are looking for and learn the skills they need!



You are enabling 22 young, passionate and skillful leaders who are dedicating their lives to creating a regenerative planet to expand their ability to create large transformation on the planet!



Econauts

Our 22 Econauts have been selected through a rigorous application process, and have been singled out due to their passion, their mission in life, and their skill sets that will enable the Earth Odyssey be more able to fully support the development of impact centers and projects. You are enabling 22 young, passionate and skillful leaders who are dedicating their lives to creating a regenerative planet to expand their ability to create large transformation on the planet!We hope to inspire more earthlings to become econauts!Brennan Bird, a bottle brick and cob teacher and builder.http://www.bottlebrick.com/

Jessica Perlstein, an organic gardener, and visionary muralist supporting sustainability and the new world. www.dreamstreamart.com/

			 

Our Partner: JUSTA - Comida Vida

JUSTA has developed a health and nutrition course for the artisans we work with and other women around Lake Atitlan. Comida Vida offers workshops on nutrition and wellness, and provides sustainable, accessible alternatives to the processed foods that have replaced the traditional diet of indigenous families. http://www.justafairtrade.org/communityprograms/health/

Other Ways You Can Help!




Join our Crowdfunding Campaign Team!



Share this on your social media networks



Sponsor Us! Contact Shayna(at)projectnuevomundo.org to receive our sponsorship package.



Reach out to media publications and press see if they’d like to write an article about this!



Attend a fundraising event:



Re-Inhabiting the Village at Emerald VIllage EcoVillage in Vista, CA - 10/2https://www.facebook.com/events/223680857785147/



Earth Odyssey Fundraiser at PLACE in Oakland - October 5thhttps://www.facebook.com/events/433677353415523/

story:
My 10yr old nephew Mason has Muscular Dystrophy and he lives in Oregon 12hrs away from us.  We want to be able to raise enough funds that we can buy him a service dog.

What better gift to give a boy but a dog and not just any dog but one that can keep him company that will always be with him.  A boy’s best friend is his dog!!  My Dane/Sheppard mix is not a service dog but when I can’t get up he knows how to help me and that is one of the big things Mason needs is to have that extra support to get up off the floor or out of a chair or even to walk with him.

 Mason loves to fish and used to go with Grandpa fishing on the weekends when possible or Grandpa would take him to Winchester Bay to go crabbing.  Now that my dad his Grandpa, has passed it has left an empty hole that we want to try and help fill and a dog can not only help fill that hole but also provide a needed service.  He has problems walking and now has an Electric chair due to the generosity of his Aunt and Uncle. They received some unexpected money and instead of paying bills or buying something for themselves, they bought Mason a much need Wheel Chair!.

The work or tasks performed by a service animal must be directly related to the handler´s disability.  Retrieving items such as medicine or the telephone, providing physical support and assistance with balance and stability to individuals with mobility disabilities.

Sunstone Service Dogs, does training in Eugene Oregon. We want to be able to raise enough money for the cost of the dog and the training as well as the travel.  Sunstone will make sure that the puppy he would train with is going to have the temperament required of a dog in this environment.  //www.oregonassistancedogs.org

The work or tasks performed by a service animal must be directly related to the handler´s disability.  Retrieving items such as medicine or the telephone, providing physical support and assistance with balance and stability to individuals with mobility disabilities.

I know that a dog would make a world of difference in Mason's home. Not just for him but for his Parents peace of mind!  Help Mason get a good friend and helper.

Donate today to make a boy happy. Thank You

story:
Hello, my name is Alex.

Currently, I am a full-time university student, and I'm focusing a lot of my time and energy on maintaining my position on the Dean's List.

I am a transsexual male. I'm in the process of applying for employment (to set aside money for my food, my own apartment, and HRT) and transitioning. I have not yet started HRT, but have been referring to myself as Alex on and off for two-three years now due to being in the closet to friends and family.

I recently came out of the closet, though I have no familial support.

Why is legally changing your name so important?

Legally changing my name lessens the additional stress of having to contact professors (etc.) about how to address me accordingly, something they don't have to comply to.

I can officially address myself as "Alex" in an official sense (when signing checks, receipts, etc.), and I won't have to worry about being "fraudulent".

My birth name is not who I am. It's uncomfortable for me to about my birth name, let alone sometimes have to address myself by it.

How is this money being broken down?

  1. Petition for name change: $278
  2. Additional fees charged by the Philadelphia courts: $121
  3. ID name change: $26
  4. Birth certifiate amendment: $20
  5. Estimated Indiegogo & PayPal fees: $44
  6. Approximation of Total Cost: $489

Anything extra will be set aside for top surgery, which I hope to schedule sometime in the next few years. Each and every contribution is important.

The Impact

Being able to refer to myself as Alex and only Alex will alow me to feel at least a small bit more comfortable in my own skin.

story:
Project: Green Settlement 

In this new age, more and more people are starting to live  „with nature“ or „off grid“ as someone would say, and this is the concept of this project. To show, how a community can be built with just the materials provided by nature. This project is just a bit more special, because its realization is led by an organization that promotes the Fantasy genre and loves nature. So we want to create something magical. Something people can enjoy, when they walk in, they find themselves in a fantasy world.  

                        

 This is only the first stage in a four stage building project.

In the first stage, a wooden fence will be built. The wooden fence will be built in the form of a medieval palisade wall.  Oak and spruce wood will be used. No cement and modern materials will be used so everything will be as natural as possible. Only the binding materials will be nails and screws, so the fence is sturdy and will last long.

                 350 - 400 euro will be used for the oak skeleton of the fence

                 550 - 650 euro will be used for the spruce half round logs for the outer                                              batting of the fence. 

                 50 - 100 euro will be used for the binding material (nails, screws, rope, etc.)

                 50 - 100 other necessary expenses ( tools, gas, material transport, etc.)


We will start by digging 1 m deep holes for the vertical fence fixation in the ground, then 15 cm diameter oak columns (posts) will be placed in the ground, then the rails will be fixated, first the lower ones, next the upper ones and as the last one, the diagonal fixation, then the skeleton of the fence will be ready.  In the next step, the outer side will be batten with spruce wood ( half round logs), so the outer wall looks like a palisade.


The settlement will be situated in a beautiful environment next to the village Skaroš near Košice in eastern Slovak Republic. We want to create something that will blend in with the nature around. A place for relaxation. A place where one can enjoy nature.  It shall teach people around that one can live without electricity and internet. In the next three stages, buildings will be added ( two houses in the Hobbit hut style in the second stage  and a Inn that will be built it the third stage). We already have the official building plans for the second stage ready.  


Link to the Google map wiev

For starters, we already have a parcel rented where the settlement shall be built. We have the building permit for the fence, the other permits will be added later. The wood will be provided by a nearby saw-mill.  The resources that we want to gain via this project are going solely for wood and building material purchase.  We will add our resources too, but it will be not enough for the 20 cubic meters of wood that we need. 

This settlement is "off grid" so there is no electricity, no pollution, no negative impact on the environment. 

This project is only the first step, after completion, such settlements can be built anywhere and by everyone, because you need only 2000 square meters of land and only natural building materials. We want to make sure, that the costs for this project are as small as possible, because then it can be achieved by anyone who has the motivation for such a building project. After the completion we will gladly send the drafts for the whole settlement to anyone who has been so kind and helped us achieve this goal. 

Hopefully, with your kind support, we will achieve something beautiful and magical that can be an inspiration for other nature loving people.

story:
FarmXchange is a nonprofit that promotes the growth of organic, non-GMO, local, "real" agriculture. We are comprised of a group of passionate urbanites who founded the nonprofit in January of 2013 to raise awareness about the social and environmental impacts of our food choices and to research sustainable, farmer-built technologies. We currently publish our research and experiences developing DIY soil-less vertical gardens and growing our own food in San Diego, California.

We created this campaign in partnership with the Orangutan Foundation International (OFI). Follow the link to learn more about OFI and its mission to regenerate the rainforest in Indonesia and save its unique species of wild orangutans.

Initially, our goal was to raise $7,000 to travel to OFI's rehabilitation centers in Borneo to prototype aquaponic grow structures on tropical rainforest lands previously "degraded" by palm oil companies. The project would not only help OFI feed the 350 orphaned wild orangutans that the foundation cares for until they are ready for release back into the wild, but it would also be used to educate and feed local residents.

With less than three days in the campaign, however, it seems we might fall a bit shy of our initial goal. Nevertheless, FarmXchange is continuing to move forward with our mission of prototyping and testing various aquaponic grow structures -- if only in backyards closer to home! YOUR contributions will help us expand our research and development efforts either way! 

Here are pictures of our latest vertical garden prototype, which cost us under $250 to build from scratch in a backyard in Hawaii:

 

DONATE NOW and receive illustrated specifications of how to build and maintain this aquaponic system to benefit you and your family -->

Features of our vertical farm include:

  • Lightweight and scalable design
  • Minimal, low-cost building materials.
  • Aquaponic grow method, which requires no soil, chemical fertilizers or pesticides and uses 90% less water than soil-based grow methods.
  • Perfect for any open space: patios, backyards, offices, waiting rooms, conference areas -- really any open space, in any human community!
  • Peace of mind that comes with KNOWING you are feeding yourself and your loved ones healthy, organic, antibiotic- and GMO-free fish and veggies.

 

THINK GLOBALLY. ACT LOCALLY.

The pressure on global food producers will only intensify as the population grows and the climate continues to change. Climate change is exacerbating the problem, especially in developing areas with already scarce resources and little access to potable water. 

Ironically, "conventional" agriculture is the greatest polluter, contributor to climate change, and the largest user of land and water. Modern agriculture accounts for 70% of all water use, 40% of all land use, and 30% of all carbon dioxide emissions. Over half the world's tropical rainforests have been destroyed, largely due to increasing demands for food and biodiesels like palm oil. With prevailing monocrop practices and over-reliance on chemical fertilizers and pesticides, "modern" agriculture is polluting our groundwater, depleting the nutrients in our soils, and poisoning our bodies.

To safely meet growing food needs of people everywhere, while also working to reverse climate change and our impact on the environment, FarmXchange's mission is to research, develop, and disseminate alternative agricultural technologies made for people, not for profit. We pledge to keep all design specifications and construction plans open source -- for the public to inspect, replicate, and improve upon. 

Your contributions will enable us to accelerate the movement toward a more sustainable planet like never before. We're committed to making all the knowledge we learn about sustainable farming technologies available to as many people as possible -- in hopes of inspiring and empowering individuals and organizations around the globe to build similar structures to feed and sustain their own communities.

Let’s save the planet, one community at a time!
